loans.name: Maria Ana Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ana, de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos que están estudiando.  

Ana, se dedica a la venta de ropa para señoritas y caballeros, tiene varios años dedicándose a ese negocio, ella visita los cantones vecinos para ofrecer sus productos.

Ana, necesita el crédito para poder comprar más mercancía, ella necesita surtir su negocio con prendas que estén a la moda y así complacer a sus clientes.

Ella sueña con adquirir su propio local en su cantón, para poder vender más prendas y accesorios.
texts.en:
32-year old Ana is a single mother with two children who attend school. She earns her living selling women's and men's clothing. She's had her business for several years. She travels to nearby villages to sell her wares.

Now Ana needs a loan so she can buy more fashionable merchandise and stock to please her customers.

Her dream is to own premises in her village so she can sell more clothes and accessories.

loans.use: buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn is from  Phnomsrok, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 37 years old. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of rice field. In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Sophorn makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses and to buy fertilizer for the field.  Thanks to the loan,  she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana lives in Liquisa, 28 years old and most of her daily income is from selling fish. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is now applying for a loan of $ 700.00. from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy more trawl, fish nets, hooks and including to repair her boat and other materials for her husband to do his activities as a fisherman. What her husband catches, she will take to sell in front of her house and she also bring to the market to sell. She started to sell fish in 2010, with her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy trawl, fish nets, hooks, including to repair her boat and other materials to use.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef wants to repair the stable of his animals and a loan in an amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek that he is requesting from you will help him achieve the goal.

Zef is 49, a villager and father of two, 25 and 10. His wife started a rural type of activity about four years back and since then, according to him, their lives have been improved a bit.

Currently he’s got two sows, one dairy cow and a young female cow and also on the 1.6 dynym agricultural land that he owns, he plants mainly feed for the animals such as corn and fodder. “I have been working as an engineer in the metallurgic complex in the city of Elbasan far from home for years now, but still my income of $500/month was not that much,” said Zef during the interview.

loans.use: to repair the damaged stable of his animals.

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is from Vinogradovo. She used Kiva funds generated from her last loan to do reconstruction in her cafe, which has considerably improved interior of her little diner. Moreover, she has purchased a quality coffee machine which has helped her attract a lot more clients and increase her income as a result.

Svitlana is seeking another 40 000 Grivnyas to do remodelling of her private house and improve living conditions for herself and her family. She is hoping to buy and install three interior doors, to remodel her kitchen and tile the walls in it, to buy a sink, a stove with an oven and a kitchen unit to go along with it.

Svitlana is also hoping to use the rest of the amount to finish remodeling of her lobby and she is planning to clad the stairs and floors with tiles.

loans.use: to do remodeling of her private house and improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is a 38-year-old married construction worker with two children who resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. He has been worked as construction worker since 2009. One of his children attends school. His wife is a 26-year-old factory worker. Together, they can earn approximately $11 per day.

Now Oun would like to improve his family’s finances, so he needs a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. With this loan, he will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, Oun wants to buy more cows, renovate a proper house and support his children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 23 years old and single. Nimfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Nimfa has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Nimfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sylvia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from general store. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de 31 años de edad que trabaja como ama de casa en una finca en el municipio de Sonsón. 

Allí posee 3 vacas lecheras cuya producción diaria es vendida a sus vecinos. La cliente, con su espíritu emprendedor, con su empuje, perseverancia y con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos familiares y personales, solicita un apoyo económico a la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de 2 vacas productoras de leche para mejorar su negocio de manera independiente, aprovechar el terreno de pasto que poseen en la finca y aumentar su producción, todo esto dará como resultado el aumento en los ingresos con los que puede aportar a la economía de su hogar. 

Un objetivo muy claro que ella tiene es seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y adquirir más ganado lechero para hacer de su actividad, un negocio rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, que en un futuro le dé la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is a 31-year-old woman who works as a housewife on an estate in the municipality of Sonsón.

There, she has three dairy cows whose daily production is sold to her neighbors. The client, with her entrepreneurial spirit, with her drive, perseverance, and with the drive to complement family and personal income, requests economic help from the corporation Interactuar to invest in the purchase of two dairy cows to improve her business in an independent manner, taking advantage of the pasture they possess on the estate and augmenting the production. All this will result in the increase of income with which she can contribute to the household economics.

A clear objective that she has is to continue working to achieve the dream of paying for the university educations of her children and purchasing more dairy cows for her activity, a profitable and lasting business over time, which in the future will give her the opportunity to have a better quality of life and well-being for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows to improve her business in an independent manner.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a 51-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Judy has a business direct selling personal care products in the Philippines. Judy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell to her customers.

Judy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Judy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 65 years old and married with four children. Luz works very hard to provide for her family.

Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, and drinks.

Luz has been in this business for four years 

In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Kiranzi Development Savings & Credit Ass Group

texts.en:
Countrida M is a 55 year old farmer living in Kagadi Uganda. She is a mother of 10 children who has been doing farming of maize and groundnuts, plus rearing of goats for many years. This business enabled her to raise and educate the 10 children and build a house for the family.

With this loan Countrida M wants to buy maize produce for selling. The group members thanks Kiva for the support which has seen them improve on their standards of living and attract more members to join them having reached the fifth cycle of the loan. She is a member of Kiranzi Development Savings and credit where members guarantee each other to get a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for selling.

loans.name: Gulied Siyad

texts.en: Gulied Siyad is 24 years old, married and has three children. He has run a snack and cake bakery for the last eight years and is experienced in his business . He will use the loan to buy bakery equipment to produce more cakes and snacks and create job opportunities for youth. He wants to expand his business and produce more than 5,000 pieces of baked items daily to distribute to schools and universities..He requested a loan of (USD) $1,500 from Kaaba MFI to buy the above mentioned products. Kaaba will provide the loan and Gulied will then make monthly repayments. In the future, Gulied hopes to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To buy bakery equipment and baking products.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en:
Ion is a young man of 20 years who lives with his mother in the district of Soroca. He studies law at the University of European Political and Economic Studies. When Ion was 14, his father died and he was left as the only male in the family.

To support the family, he and his mother began to grow strawberries, tomatoes and cucumbers on an area of almost an acre. The problem is that he does not have a good irrigation system and therefore the quality of the fruits and vegetables is poor. He would like to use this money to purchase and install an irrigation system. With the irrigation system he will be able to increase his crop yield and the produce will be of higher quality, which means it can be sold at a better price. With the increase in production and quality, he will be able to increase his profit and use it to support his family and the future of his business.

loans.use: to pay for an irrigation system.

loans.name: Vichet's Group

texts.en: Vichet’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vichet works as farmer and she also does extra work as construction worker and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marselinah

texts.en:
Marselinah is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pests.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Her business goal is to be a supplier of farm products within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes, shoes

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lyn is 50 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Lyn has a business buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of peanuts to sell to her customers.

Lyn has been in this business for 29 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of peanuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita works hard to support her family. Jovita is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Jovita requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Jovita has been in this business for 3 years now.

Jovita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dina is 42 years old and has two children are still in school.

Dina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Dina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Merwin

texts.en:
Merwin is 40 years old and has seven children. Merwin is married and has six children who are currently in school.

Merwin is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Merwin requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merwin has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merwin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Dora Ligia

texts.es:
Un restaurante fue lo que con mucho esfuerzo logro esta emprendedora mujer de 45 años de edad llamada Dora, que buscando una alternativa para generar ingresos tuvo la idea de montar su negocio. 

Hoy en día por la competencia que se presenta en el sector, su negocio está viéndose afectado, pues están alejando sus clientes en estos tiempos de crisis. 

Solicita una ayuda crediticia con la Corporación Interactuar para tener capital de trabajo para invertirlo sabiamente en esta época difícil, comprando cerveza, bebidas, insumos para comidas rápidas, frituras, entre otros.

Espera lograr superar esta temporada y gozar en un futuro al lado de su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dora is a 45 year old entrepreneurial woman who put forth great effort into her restaurant. She was seeking a way to generate income when the idea to open a restaurant occurred to her. Today with competition in the restaurant business, her business is being impacted and her customers not visiting as much during this time of crisis.

She seeks a loan from Interactuar in order to have working capital to wisely invest during this difficult time. She will buy beer, soda pop, ingredients for fast food, fried food, and other items. She hopes to be able to overcome this season and enjoy a future at the side of her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda pop, ingredients to make fast food, fried food, and other items.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 45-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband runs his own business selling and supplying medicines.

Asma's husband wants to purchase different types of medicines to sell, but due to insufficient financial means he is not in a position to buy these medicines for his business. Therefore Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband to purchase these medicines and enable him to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a profitable income. Her husband also plans to make savings with the income from his business to meet uncertain events in future.

Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mosoq Wasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOQ WASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly ella es conviviente y tiene 49 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne,la socia vende en el mercado, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “MOSOQ WASI” community bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, and Cusco department.

Nelly has a partner, is 49 years old, and has 2 children. Her business is selling food, and she makes various dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and roasted meats. She sells her food in the market from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM. She has had this business for 8 years and it is going well. She dreams of having a restaurant. She seeks a loan to buy products to cook with such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The members inserted into the photo had their picture taken after the meeting as they received permission to miss because of work. The other members of the group have business selling candy, selling clothing, grocery store, and book store. Nelly is grateful to those who support this dream and promises to make the loan payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy products to cook with such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Polline

texts.en:
Polline is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her family challenge to be lack of pipes to connect water.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy water pipes for water connection.Her family will be able to access water easily for domestic use.This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy water pipes for water connection

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages and other crops and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support seven children. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Divina requested a PHP 2100 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Divina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mildred works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Mildred is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  purchase additional boxes herbal medicine to sell for her buy and sell herbal medicine business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 52 years old and has seven children. Lita is married and has one child who is still in school.

Lita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lita has been in pig fattening for 24 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: John Wilfer

texts.es:
John es un campesino de 26 años de edad, casado. Durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a ser productor agropecuario, pues posee cultivos y animales, cuyas producciones son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside; actualmente trabaja con su esposa quien es su mayor apoyo, lo que para él significa tener un negocio familiar muy bueno. 

A atravesado múltiples dificultades económicas, sin embargo, con esfuerzo, amor y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante y siempre va en busca de nuevas alternativas que le permitan continuar avanzando; es por ello que solicita un apoyo crediticio, con el que desea comprar una 2 vacas de levante, pues desea aumentar los ingresos y brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar. 

John sueña con hacer de sus actividades un negocio rentable, que perdure en el tiempo y que le garantice una estabilidad económica, pues su principal sueño es poder comprarse una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
John is a 26 year old married farmer. During all his working life he has farmed. He has crops and animals, with the products harvested and sold in the plaza market in the town where he lives. Today he works with his wife's support, which means he has a very good family business.

He has encountered multiple economic challenges, nevertheless with effort, love, and dedication he has been able to overcome and always looks for new alternatives that will enable him to continue to grow. Therefore he seeks a loan in order to buy two calves, as he wishes to increase his income and provide for his family's well-being.

John dreams of having a profitable business that endures over time and guarantees him economic stability, as his primary dream is to be able to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy two calves for his farm.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 43 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nida is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nida has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 43 years old and married with one child. Gema works very hard to provide for them.

Gema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks and etc.

Gema has been in this business for 1 year. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks and etc

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 30 years old, married with 4 children and 2 attend school, all living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He deals in motor cycle transport locally known as bodaboda and gets additional income from cocoa growing. He started the businesses four years back but with little progress due to inadequate capital, this limits his profits. However, he dreams of expanding the business and be inline to buy a second motorcycle. He used part of profits from cocoa growing to buy his first motorcycle.  Robert has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children ahead of the third promotion term.

loans.use: To pay shool fees for his children.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 31 years old and married with two children, two children are presently in school, Jenny works very hard to provide for them.

Jenny runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks etc.

Jenny has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks etc

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Srey’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Srey works as farmer and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucena is 46 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Lucena has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Lucena requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucena has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Lucena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en: Mimoza plants 4 dynym of agricultural land with corn, 2 with beans, 5 with wheat and 5 with fodder. All the land that she plants, is not hers, she rents it from others. She also has a dairy cow at the moment and wants to add another one, because rural activity is her focus and she wants to expand it.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her exceptional academic record and test scores, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. She is the first person in her family to attend university.

Lydia's plan is to study Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, she would like to work at an NGO or manage a hospital in Rwanda. Lydia also wants to earn enough to help support her mother and siblings with school fees. 

She also hopes to support children across Rwanda, possibly by managing a school or orphanage

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a bright, visionary and verbal farmer from Eldoret, an agricultural town in Kenya known for producing elite runners who have broken world records in major races and Olympic competitions in the world. She is the last born in a family of five siblings, and has been through secondary schooling but due to circumstances out of his control, she dropped out. She describes his upbringing as challenging. Mercy is hardworking and always says, “I eat from my sweat.” Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crops.

Most of the small holder farmers in her village own approximately half an acre per household and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. Mercy has been practicing mixed farming and she enjoys the income she gets, but she has been facing challenges delivering her products to the market. Eldoret town is a very remote area and the roads are in pathetic condition; this has hampered Mercy from making timely delivery of products to the market while still fresh. Mercy sells vegetables, milk and tomatoes which are very perishable and require quick delivery if you are to fetch a high price.

Mercy is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike that will help her deliver her products to the market in a timely way so she can overcome the challenge of facing losses. Through the loan she will deliver the products in a timely manner to the market, and this means she will never suffer losses, which will translate into an immediate increase in profits. Mercy plans to employ someone who will help her on the farm and deliver products to her large client base. Profits from the loan will be used to comfortably repay the loan fully and invest in a solid foundation for her family to come.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her products to the market.

loans.name: Nayfa

texts.en:
Nayfa is a 53 years old housewife; she is responsible for her daughter’s education. To be able to do so, she had to find a source of income in addition to what her son’s gives her, from his salary, working as a salesman at one of the cosmetic products companies.

So Nayfa used her son’s work and started to get cosmetic products at a good price and re-sell from home to her friends and neighbors at market price. Now she is applying for a loan in order to get a larger quantity of the products to promote and sell it to beauty salons in the area.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of cosmetic products to sell to beauty salons.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom, a farmer living in a rural village of Siem Reap province, is 52 and a married mother of nine children. Nowadays, she needs to support on four dependent children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she grows cassava and rice to earn the main sources of income. She can get supplement income via raising chicken and working as a paid worker. These days, she can earn income around 35,000KHR per day and save about 15,000KHR each day after expenses. The main challenges, her crops did not grow well as the chicken got ill.

Rom has not been with VisionFund before and this is the first time for her to get a Kiva’s loan. She leads a group of three members and she will manage her loan portion to buy seed, pay for worker fees and pay for plowing fees, which are expected to increase the crop products better. She hopes that this first loan will help her to gain high yields to get additional income so that she can update her living condition.

loans.use: to buy seed, pay for worker fees and pay for plowing fees, which are expected to increase the crop products better

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
A senhora Isabel de 57 anos de idade  é  operaria agrícola numa empresa do ramo agrícola, viúva sem filhos  e não sustenta ninguém , vive na casa do serviço.
Com este crédito pretende comprar cimento, varões, pedra, e areia  para dar continuidade da sua obra .
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar, e mudar se para a casa própria e fazer uma mercearia na sua casa.
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar,e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos. Como empréstimos anteriores legalizou o espaco onde atualmente tem a sua obra.
texts.en:
Isabel is 57 years old. She is a factory worker at an agro company. She is a widow with no children and she doesn't support anyone else. She lives in a spare bedroom. 
She will use this loan to buy concrete, beams, stone and sand to continue construction of her home.
Her dream is finish the works, and to move into her own place and open a general store out her home.
She struggles financially, but she is determined to work and her plan is to ask for more loans to cover her needs and reach her goals. With her previous loans, she was able to secure a location where she is currently building her home.

loans.use: to buy concrete, beams, stone and sand.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chibuto Província de Gaza, tem 43 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 7 filhos, dos quais 3 menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 2 netos que vivem em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2009, este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende realizar cerimónias de lóbulo do seu afilhado.
Futuramente terminar a sua obra de residência e adquirir uma viatura familiar.
texts.en:
He was born in Chibuto, Gaza province. He is 43 years old, married, and the father of seven children. Three of them are underage and all of them go to school. He is responsible for two grandchildren that live with him.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2009. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku, and he is planning to use it to pay for his godson’s wedding expenses.

In the future, he wants to finish building his house and purchase a vehicle for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his godson's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Benildo Antonio

texts.es:
Venildo es un campesino trabajador y humilde, con 28 años de edad, sigue trabajando para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 2 hijos. 

Durante 1 año se ha dedicado a la cría y comercialización de cerdos y ganado de levante, actividad que aprendió por herencia familiar y que le ha permitido generar recursos para salir adelante.

Actualmente solicita un crédito con el que desea comprar materiales para adecuación de corrales, concentrado para alimentar a sus animales y lograr tener una mejor producción que le permita generar mayor nivel de rentabilidad a la hora de vender.

Venildo manifiesta que los problemas no son impedimento para seguir realizando la labor que lo apasiona y que le ha dado de comer durante toda su vida, por ello sigue luchando incansablemente para lograr incrementar su ganado porcino y de levante y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecer a sus hijos menores la oportunidad de tener una educación de excelente calidad para que sean unos profesionales íntegros y exitosos.
texts.en:
Venildo is a hard-working, humble farmer. He is 28 years old and continuously works to meet his family's basic expenses. His family consists of his wife and 2 children. He has been raising and selling pigs and cattle for a year, work he learned through his family, and work that has generated income to get ahead.

Today he seeks a loan to buy materials to accommodate corrals and feed for his animals in order to have a better production that will generate greater profit at the point of selling. Venildo states that the there are no barriers to doing the work he loves and work that has been the source of his self-sufficiency over his lifetime. Therefore he continues to work tirelessly in order to be able to increase his pigs and calves, resulting in an improved quality of life for his family and offer his children the opportunity of an education of excellent quality so that they can grow up to be successful professional members of the community.

loans.use: to buy materials to accommodate corrals and feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 38 years old wife, mother of 8 children and is living in a small town in northern Jordan, Her husband is a builder whose business was affected by the refugees flow coming into the city. Having a big family made them think of other income sources which brought the idea of opening a small shop for selling food products and home products.

Since her husband is a builder, he built the store to save workers fees, and brought goods to sell in their small town. Having the store has helped in increasing the family income by approximately 150 Jordan Dinars.

Now Maryam is looking to increase the variety of products she sells to attract more customers and fulfill their needs, so she applied to this loan that will help her get a larger quantity at a good price of cleaning products, foods, and to add selling stationary items before schools starts.

loans.use: get a larger quantity at a good price of cleaning products, foods and to add selling stationary items before schools starts.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 53 años de edad, a pesar de su edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive solo con su esposo y él se dedica a la agricultura y es quien lleva el sustento día a día. 

Isabel, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero también le ayuda a su esposo con los trabajos en la milpa, ella sale a sembrar, a desherbar, a abonar la milpa, es un ejemplo de trabajo. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como: abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar frijoles y preparar la tierra. 
 
Isabel, desea tener fuerzas suficientes para poder seguir trabajando junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Isabel is 53 years old and despite her age, she is a determined and very hard-working woma. She lives alone with her husband who makes a living in agriculture and who provides the sustenance day to day. 

Isabel does household work, but she also helps her husband with work in the field. An example of the work she does is going out to plant, to weed, and to manure the field.

She needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies like manure, pesticides, and herbicides to plant beans and prepare the land.
 
Isabel hopes to have enough strength to be able to continue working alongside her husband.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like manure, pesticides and herbicides to plant beans and prepare the land.

loans.name: Rabije

texts.en:
Rabije is 24 years old and single, living with her entire family in the southern part of Kosovo. She is very hardworking and ambitious, loving to work a lot. She is currently working as a fast food store manager, but the salary is very low. Her parents are retired and Rabije, along with her brother who works in a coffee bar, is supporting the family.

She always dreamed of having a private business and with her hard work, she has finally managed to save a little money to start her own business. She wants to open a food market in her home. Since she will not have to pay rent for the shop, she plans to employ her mother to work as a cashier and to care for the shop. For the first time she is requesting a loan in order to purchase various food and beverages to start her business. She hopes that in the future she will be successful enough to expand her business and also sell other items such as clothing. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support in making her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase various food and beverages to start her new business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica, 45, is into small time cattle raising in their community in Polomolok, South Cotabato. She buys one or two calves and raises them for selling. She owns a farm where she pastures the calves for grass and hay. A big portion of the farm is planted with bananas which are being nurtured by her farmer husband, James. Aside from these, Jessica runs a small “sari-sari” (variety store) in front of their house. Her combined income from these livelihoods sustains their everyday needs and college expenses of her two children. However, the return of investment for cattle really takes so long, and Jessica has to be very creative on how to manage their family budget properly.

This time, Jessica wants to buy two more calves that she can raise. She will also buy fertilizer for their banana plantation and groceries for their variety store. She is requesting for a PHP 60,000 loan for this purpose. She can already sell one grown up cattle soon and she can recover a lot of her expenses. She is determined to slowly expand her cattle raising by acquiring two to three calves after selling a grown up one.

Jessica is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy two more calves that she can raise.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Merciditha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, sugar, oil, can goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane and pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Merciditha dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Omar Manuel

texts.es:
Omar, a sus 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de dos hijos.

Actualmente se encuentra dedicado, a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, pues tiene el espacio disponible en una pequeña finca y aprovecha que posee conocimientos en la labor gracias a su familia que toda la vida se ha dedicado a las labores agropecuarias. 

Su perseverancia, empeño y las ganas de salir adelante, lo motivan para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará mas lechones para cría y engorde, de esta manera podrá continuar con su proyecto productivo con el que espera obtener buenos resultados, especialmente en la temporada de fin de año, en el que aumenta el consumo de esta carne, lo que para el significa generar más ingresos económicos. 

Omar desea luchar arduamente para sacar su proyecto adelante y en un futuro sueña con pagar la educación de sus hijos, tener un negocio sostenible con diversidad de productos para ofrecer al mercado y poder garantizar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Omar at 31 years of age, lives in a common-law realtionship and is the father of two children.

At this time he is working raising and selling pigs as he has available space on a small farm. He is taking advantage of the knowledge he has in this field as his family has worked in agriculture all his life.

His perseverance, effort and desire to get ahead motivate him to request the support of a loan with which he will buy more piglets to raise and fatten. In this way he can continue with his production with which he hopes to obtain good results. Especially during the year end season when the consumption of this meat increases which for him means generating greater economic income.

Omar wants to fight hard to move his project forward. In the future he dreams of paying for the education of his children and having a sustainable business with a diversity of products to offer the market so he can guarantee better well-being and quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and fatten.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
This is Joyce. She is a hardworking woman and lives in the area of Nkubu. It is a thriving area full of people like Joyce, who, with entrepreneurship and honest work, make this remote town a better place. Joyce counts herself lucky to have had a supported childhood. She managed to clear her primary education. She studied two years of high school education before having to drop out and help her family in farm work.

She started farming in 2011 on a 3.5 acre piece of run-down land with the help of her loving husband. If you visit the farm today, you will find bananas, vegetables, cows, hens and trees. Not only is Joyce concerned about the productivity of the land today, she is also worried about the changes in climate caused by human activities. She makes it up by planting more trees always.

Joyce is seeking a loan to purchase irrigation equipment for her farm. She is planning to expand her banana farming but she cannot count on steady rainfall. However, with an irrigation kit in place, she will be able to consistently supply water to her plants on a regular basis. This will ensure the bananas grow green and healthy. This investment also reduces the risk of crop failure.

Joyce will use the income generated from this investment to pay the school boarding fees for her children. By always monitoring expenses and keeping a monthly budget, Joyce also strives to bring financial stability into her family. She knows that with the help of Kiva lenders from the Kiva portal, she will achieve this.

loans.use: to pay for irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Rasmia

texts.en:
Rasmia is 44 years old a widow with 11 children where in the oldest is 23 and the youngest is 7 years old.

Rasmia open her sari-sari store (grocery store) 12 years ago to help with their expenses. Her husband used to work as a public vehicle driver and the income was not enough even to support their basic needs. Since the store is located in front of the street, a lot of customers patronized her items, specially the soft drinks and rice.
She started with a capital of PhP 5,000 from her husband savings and today her store is gaining about PhP 2,000 net income everyday.

Rasmia has been SEED partner for 5 years and has seen the improvements on her business. She renovates her store and add shelves to better display her stocks and add more room to accommodate her items as her stock is growing.

Rasmia husband died just recently due to a heart attack and left her to support her children.
Rasmia, determined to provide for her family and rented out her husband's vehicle to produce an additional income.
Rasmia wanted to wholesale her rice and soft drinks to the community to increase her income but the lack of capital prevented from doing so.

Rasmia is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 70,000 to buy 30 cases of soft drinks, 20 sacks of rice, 2 boxes of coffee and other groceries to sell wholesale in her store.

Rasmia is hopeful that with the loan she will be able to increase her income to help more with their everyday expenses and with the schooling of her children since her biggest dream is to see her children finish their education.

loans.use: to buy 30 cases of soft drinks, 20 sacks of rice, 2 boxes of coffee and other groceries to sell  wholesale in her store.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en:
Viviane is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in difficult circumstances and cites her greatest strengths as her ability to learn new things and never waste a day without adding knowledge to her life. Her work ethic and impressive academic credentials led to her acceptance at Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. 

Viviane plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At school, she hopes to improve her public speaking and self-confidence. After graduating, she hopes to work in health care in order to help those who can't afford medical care.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
A  senhora Amélia de 46 anos de idade   é  casada, mãe  de 5 filhos  dos quais 02 no ensino primário ,03 não estudam, vive na casa própria  e não sustenta a mais ninguém.
Com o empréstimo ira comprar pintos, vitaminas, ração para ampliar o seu negocio.
O seu sonho é  crescer no seu negócio, ter grandes terras, construir  casas para cada um dos seus filhos . E ainda diz que sentirá-se muito feliz  vendo todos seus filhos realizados na vida 
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Amélia is 46 years old. She is married with 5 children, 3 of them are not in school, and the other 2 attend grade school. She lives in a house that she owns and she doesn't support anyone else.
She will use this loan to buy chicks, vitamins and feed to expland her business.
Her dream is to see her business grow, own a lot of land and build homes for each of her children. She says it will make her happy to see her children become somebody in life. 
She struggles financially, but she is a hardworker and her plan is to ask for more loans to cover her needs and reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy chicks, vitamins, feed.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru:
Марчоне 28 лет. Она мать троих детей. Детям 4, 3 и 1 лет. Марчона 6 лет своей жизни продвигает торговую деятельность. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что ее сестра работает именно в этой сфере деятельности. И сестра научила ее правильно общаться с клиентами и вести данный бизнес. 
   Марчона занимается продажей футболки, рубашек, джинсы и разной другой одежды. Марчона решила расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Она надеется с увеличением товара, увеличится доход и может позволить своим детям новые экономические возможности.
texts.en: Marjona is 28 and a mother of three. Her children are ages 1, 3, and 4. She has had a retail business for six years. She decided to get into this business because her sister also does this kind of work, and her sister was able to teach her how to properly interact with customers and how to run a business. Marjona sells t-shirts, men's shirts, jeans, and other clothing items. She decided to expand her business and increase her inventory. She hopes that increasing her inventory will increase her profits and allow her to give her children new economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clothing to increase her inventory

loans.name: Agostinho

texts.pt:
O senhor Agostinho  professor de 58 anos de idade, casado pai de 4 filhos todos já maiores de idade e já  casados,sustentando ainda 3 netos e vive  na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo  irá comprar  cimento, chapas de zinco para cobertura,varões, janelas azulejos para dar a continuidade da sua obra.
Seus projetos futuros sao a conclusão da faculdade ter aumento salarial e comprar um carro. 
O maior desafio e concluir a sua casa, mobilar vedar, criar uma fonte de rendimento para minimizar o problema da insuficiência de fundos na sua familia.
texts.en:
Agostinho is a 58-year-old professor. He is married with 4 children already of age and married, but he still supports 3 of his grandchildren. He lives in a house that he owns.
He will use this loan to buy concrete, zinc roofing sheets, beams, windows and tiles to continue building his home.
His future projects include finishing college, getting a raise and buying a car. 
His biggest challenges has been to finish his home and furnish it, as well as creating a source of income that will minimize the problem of his family's lack of funds.

loans.use: to buy concrete, zinc roofing sheets, beams, windows and tiles.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Linda is 51 years old now.

Linda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Linda requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Linda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support six children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Helen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 50 years old and has one child still in school.

Lorna has a bakery shop business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, salt and other materials for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, salt and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate used the previous loan to buy fresh foods like potatoes and onions to sell. She is still a dealer in selling fresh foods and farming. Kate was able to use the proceeds from her business to pay back the loan,pay market dues for her place of operation and repair her roof that was leaking.

She has future hopes of buying cows for zero grazing that will add her more income. Kate has asked for a loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods  like tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Juan Esteban

texts.es:
Juan, con 31 años de edad, es soltero. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a laborar como empleado de oficios varios en fincas de diferentes veredas del corregimiento. 

Desde hace unos meses cuenta con experiencia en la cría y comercialización de cerdos y, debido a ello, desea iniciar su propio negocio para generar ingresos adicionales para su familia. 

Cuenta con la ventaja de que un amigo le prestará una marranera y por esto se anima a solicitar el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de lechones para cría y engorde y el concentrado para alimentarlos, de esta manera tendrá la posibilidad de engordar los cerdos, aumentando así, el margen de ganancia por cada venta. 

Juan es un hombre pujante, activo, trabajador y se esmera por sacar adelante su familia; él sueña poder tener alrededor de 100 cerdos de engorde, para criarlos y tener una producción escalonada que le garantice la entrada constante de recursos, así tendrá la posibilidad de crecer como empresario.
texts.en:
Juan is 31 years old and single. During his productive life he has worked as an employee in various roles on farms in different parts of the small town.

For the past several months he has had experience in the breeding and selling of pigs, and due to that, he wishes to start his own business to generate additional income for his family.

He has the advantage that a friend will lend him a pig pen, and for that reason he is inspired to request the loan, which will be invested in the purchase of suckling pigs for breeding and fattening, and in the feed for them. In this way he will have the possibility of fattening the pigs, thus increasing the profit margin with every sale.

Juan is a thriving, active, hard-working man, and he goes to a lot of effort to move his family forward. He dreams of being able to have around 100 pigs for fattening, in order to raise them and have a staggered production that guarantees him the constant flow of resources. In this way, he will have the possibility of growing as a businessman.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs for breeding and fattening, and the feed for them.  In this way he will have the possibility of fattening the pigs.

loans.name: Sokhunthea's Group

texts.en:
Sokhunthea is ages 40 years old and a married mother of a small child, who is in school, living in Preah Vihear province. She is makes handicrafts and is a rice farmer to earn income for supporting her family for five years. Due to natural disaster that happened in her village, it caused her to face life with the difficulty and having not enough working capital to support her business.
Sokhunthea has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for three cycles already and completely paid back her past loans. The previous helped her to be able to support her child’s studying.

Due to having not enough electricity to use, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan to buy a solar light to brighten her house at night time. She hopes this loan will help her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a solar light to brighten her house at night time.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is a 59-year-old vigorous, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son, who has provided vehicle repair services for many years. He has established good clients and makes enough to meet the household expenses. However, due to lack of availability of funds, he is unable to meet the daily demands of his customers. For this reason, Haleema requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She will use the loan for her son to purchase more equipment such as screws, nails, and spare parts. These materials will help him provide better services to his customers. Haleema is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment such as screws, nails and spare parts for her son to provide better services to customers.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
A Sra. Laura tem 35 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de dois filhos dos quais um esta a frequentar o ensino primário e o outro a frequentar o ensino secundário.
Com o empréstimo, vai comprar pintos, ração, vitaminas para criar frangos para revender. Ela sonha em ampliar o negócio e responder as necessidades dos seus clientes. Construir uma casa melhor e virar empresaria no ramo pecuário. Neste momento enfrenta dificuldades financeiras, porem, o desafio e reembolsar o empréstimo dentro de prazo acordado.
texts.en:
Laura is 35 years old. She is a widow and mother of two children who attend grade school and high school.
She will use this loan to buy chicks, feed, vitamins and raise chicken to sell. 
Her dream is to expand her business and respond to her customer's needs. She wants to build a better home and turn to the cattle business. She struggles financially at the moment, but her goal is to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed, vitamins and raise chicken to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is aged 68 years .She is married and has nine children to support, and she has been practicing small scale farming for the last five years earning an income of KES.15, 000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES25, 000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals to spray on her crops for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals for spraying, for better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a married woman and 58 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anastacia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anastacia requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Anastacia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Anastacia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 58 years old and married with six children.  

Lorna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania works hard to support her family. Epifania is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Epifania requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Epifania has been in this business for 7 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Epifania would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Irma

texts.en:
Ma. Irma works hard to support five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Irma requested a PHP 2100 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Ma. Irma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Aidee María

texts.es: Aideé es una emprendedora de 55 años que desde muy joven descubrió su vocación por la costura de tal manera que decidió estudiar el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje donde realizó un curso sobre confecciones y posteriormente desarrolló sus habilidades trabajando en varios talleres de confección hasta que decidió abrir su propio taller desde su hogar donde ofrece a vecinos, familiares, amigos y referidos arreglos, trajes a medida y ropa en general para damas caballero y niños, negocio que tiene muy bien posicionado y que le genera una buena rentabilidad de acuerdo al grado de dificultad que implique la confección de la prenda. Actualmente Aideé trabaja sobre pedidos y dedica 8 horas diarias a su actividad, sin embargo actualmente está solicitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para financiar su proyecto de realizar una inversión en telas, encajes, hilos y demás insumos para ofrecer un inventario de productos terminados a su clientela, que planea le generará un incremento en sus ventas y sus utilidades y lograr una estabilidad económica que le permita una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Aideé is a 55-year-old entrepreneur. She discovered her vocation for sewing at a very young age, so she decided to study dressmaking through the Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje [National Training Service]. She then developed her skills by working in several dressmaking shops until she decided to open her own shop in her home. She offers neighbors, family, friends, and referrals alterations, custom suits, and general clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children. 

She has her business in a very good position and it generates good profits for her, according to the level of difficulty involved in making each garment. 
Aideé currently works by the order, and she is working 8-hour days. However, she is now requesting her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to finance her investment in fabric, lace, thread, and other supplies. This will enable her to offer an inventory of finished products to her clientele, increasing her sales and profits and reaching economic stability.

loans.use: to invest in fabric, lace, thread, and other supplies

loans.name: Edilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Edilberto es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un negocio en el que vende pescado. Inicio el negocio hace 30 años y ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospero. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de pescado y carne de pato al por mayor.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a man with all of the skills needs to face the world and have a fulfilling life thanks to his dedication. He has a business selling fish that he started thirty years ago and has been well accepted in the region.

He wants to expand his product offerings and improve his sales by investing in his business. For these reasons, he is seeking a loan in hopes of improving his business. This money will be used to purchase fish and duck meat in bulk.

Edilberto has high hopes for his business and believes that his future can be greatly improved thanks to the support of organizations such as Interactuar that make it possible for people to dream of a better, more stable life.

loans.use: purchase fish and duck meat in bulk.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a meat and frozen foods vending business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen foods and meat to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods and meat to sell

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos, de 19 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta noveno grado, pero por motivos personales no pudo seguir estudiando, está acompañado y junto a su pareja procrearon una bebé que actualmente tiene 2 meses de nacida y ambos luchan por mantener tener lo necesario para su hogar.

Marcos, se dedica a  la agricultura desde  hace varios años, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre, para que fuera hombre de bien y tuviera una fuente de ingresos; cuando se acompañó se dio cuenta que la agricultura no le bastaba para generar ingresos suficientes para sostener el hogar, por esa razón decidió dedicarse a la venta de pan, ahora tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este trabajo y su esposa también le ayuda a vender; ambos se levantan muy temprano para ir a vender y la bebé la dejan con una vecina para que la cuide; y cuando es invierno siembran maíz para vender y para consumo.

Marcos, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas, para pagar el alquiler de la tierra y para pagarle a un vecino que tiene máquina para rastrear la tierra en donde cultivará.

El Sueño de Marcos es tener un terreno propio para trabajar la agricultura y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos, 19 years old, is a farmer with a ninth grade education. Due to personal reasons, he was unable to continue going to school. He is married and has a two-month-old daughter. He and his wife strive to provide for their household.

Marcos has worked in agriculture for many years, a trade that his father taught him so that he could be a good man with a source of income. When he married, he realized that agriculture would not earn him enough to provide for his household, which is why he began to sell bread. He now has three years of experience selling bread, and his wife helps him to sell it. They both wake up very early in order to go sell, and they leave their baby with their neighbor who takes care of her. During the winter, they plant corn that they sell and consume themselves.

Marcos is in need of a loan to purchase seed, manure, pesticides, pay the lease on the land, and pay their neighbor who has a plow. Marcos's dreams are to have his own land to farm and to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase seed, manure, pesticides, pay the lease on the land, and pay his neighbor who has a plow.

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine is a first-year student at Kepler. The first of her family to attend university, she was selected from over 6,000 applicants this year. Divine chose Kepler because of the program's competitiveness and the opportunities its affords to students, such as internships and group study.

Divine plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to work in the health industry, and perhaps be the director of a hospital one day.

Having a career that benefits society is important to Divine, and her dream is to help all people get access to the best doctors at the lowest possible cost.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, onions, rice, sugar, cornmeal, flour, beer, sodas and other basic products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Dysen is 19 years old and is 6th of seven children in the family. Her mother Ma. Nita a member of NWTF, supports the family through her farming vegetables business in the Philippines.

Dysen is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in the 4th of this 4-year course.

Ma. Nita is borrowing PHP 4000 to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Dysen for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Dysen plans to graduate and gainfully employed.

loans.use: to help pay for her daughter's tuition fee.for a B. Sc. in Business Administration

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Imelda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Imelda has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetable.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Lolita has been in this business for 9 years. Lolita earns more income from vegetable vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a woman who loves to laugh and always keep a smile on her face, she says that “it is one of the ways that helps you move on and get over the difficulties of life”.
She is a 40 years old mother of seven children, she works with her husband as farmers in Dair alla where she lives, which is considered as one of the under privileged areas in Jordan.

Nawal got to finish elementary school only, which is not helping her in getting better jobs, for that she works hard beside her husband to make sure her children go through all levels of education, so they won’t suffer as she did. Not being able to find a stable job did not stop her, she started doing a side job in the evenings selling clothes and blankets which her sister helped her in starting it and taught her how to do retail business to avoid losing.
Now Nawal knows the best time to sell each type of products in her area and is working based on that.

She is applying to this loan to increase the quantity of clothing items for summer and before the Islamic holiday and blankets to prepare for the winter season, specially as buying them at this time saves a lot of money than buying it closer to the winter season.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothing items for summer and before the Islamic holiday and blankets to prepare for the winter season.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita, who is in her late 40s, is married with the three children who are grownup. She has been selling second hand clothes for ten years now. She works from 08am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Julita's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the second hand stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to take care of herself and her husband, to repay the loan, reinvest in business and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the fast moving second hand clothes to meet her customer's requirement. She dreams of building her own house.

Julita will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving second hand clothes to meet her customer's requirement.

loans.name: Grupo Trinitaria Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨Trinitaria¨, conformados por dos mujeres y 1 varón, están solicitando por primera vez a ADIM y a los miembros de KIVA, crédito para crecer sus negocios. 
Coordinado por Susana, de 24 años, soltera y con 4 hijos,  siendo dependientes de ella con edades de 12, 10,6, y 3 años. Desde hace 4 años, tiene su taller de carpintería con 8 trabajadores, con el crédito invertirá en madera de laurel, aceituna, selladores y zener.  Entre sus proyectos esta hacer el negocio más grande. 
Los demás integrantes son Gema, de 30 años, dedicada a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 3 años. Y José de 20 años, dedicado a la comercialización desde hace 2 años en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The group “Trinitaria” includes two women and one man. They are requesting their first Kiva loan through ADIM in order to grow their businesses.

Susana is the group coordinator. She is 24 years old, single, and has four children who are dependent on her. Their ages are 12, 10, 6, and 3. For the past four years, she has managed a carpentry workshop with eight workers. With this loan, she will invest in laurel and olive wood, sealant, and thinner. One of her projects is to expand her business.

The other members are as follows:
• Gema, age 30, has been raising pigs for three years.
• José, age 20, has been a salesperson in his community for two years.

loans.use: to buy laurel and olive wood, sealant, and thinner.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business: pig fattening in the Philippines. Norma requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies used to raise her pigs.

Norma has been fattening pigs for two years and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies used to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Eillen

texts.en:
Eillen is a single woman with three children. She is 32 years old and two of her children are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Eillen has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, and ice and other materials for her food production business.

Eillen has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, and ice for her food production business.

loans.name: Gerame

texts.en:
Gerame is 32 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gerame is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gerame has been pig fattening for 1 year and also earns additional income from buy and sell scrap materials.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and married with three school-aged children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, and drinks. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province, Ty is 26-year-old and a married mother of a young child. Growing cassava is the primary source of her family’s income. Moreover, she can make additional income via raising pigs and working as a paid worker. These businesses have been with her for ten years.
