She lacks funds to buy more pigs and pig feed to support her business.

This is Ty’s second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she repaid the previous loan successfully. With her past loan, she can get more income to improve her living in better conditions. As a group leader of four, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy more pigs and pig feed to support her business. She hopes that she can increase her family’s income in this second loan to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed to support her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 47 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, spices, cooking oil, and drinks. She has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, spices, cooking oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling rice. Yolanda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Yolanda has eight loans from NWTF in the past that have helped her sustain her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 52 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Rita works very hard to provide for them.

Rita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Rita has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future, Rita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Salome is 57 years old and has one child in school.

Salome has a fishing business in the Philippines. Salome requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo, gasoline and other supplies for her business.

Salome has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, gasoline and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila is 63 years old and married. Panfila works very hard to provide for them.

Panfila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Panfila has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Panfila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Moen's Group

texts.en: Moen’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Moen makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is 39 years old and she lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. She is married and she has two daughters; both of them are students. Zhanna’s husband now works in the Russian Federation and he is furniture maker there. Zhanna works at the market as a saleswoman. So together with her husband they work hard in order to cover the expanses of their daughters.

Zhanna hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders since her smaller daughter has some health problems and she needs to pass a medical exam. Zhanna asks this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams in order to solve her daughter’s health problem and she hopes to be thankful beforehand.

loans.use: to solve her daughter’s health problem and she hopes to be thankful beforehand.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in a rural province in northern Rwanda, and due to her impressive academic record, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Aline chose Kepler because it offered her the best opportunity to pursue her dream of working in management, especially overseeing financial aspects of an organization.

Aline plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She thinks her greatest contribution to Kepler will be her ability to work hard and build consensus. After graduating, she hopes to use her skills to give back to her family and the needy.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik from the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region used to work as the shepherd of his village and he never did any work other work than farming. He lives in a cute house with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Rafik says that he liked very much to be shepherd of his village and for him it was very responsible work, since all the cattle of the villagers was on his duty to take it to the fields and to bring all of it back safely and on time.

He is happy to mentions that now his son continues his work while in the farm Rafik takes care of his cattle (he has a calf, pigs, sheep and chickens). He also has large plot of land on which he cultivates potato and tomato. All the farm products, such as meat (pork, mutton and poultry), eggs, potato and tomato Rafik sells at the city’s wholesale market with the help of his wife.

Now with this loan of 400.000 Armenian drams he wants to buy some sheep for his farm and also fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for his farm and also fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.es:
Eduviges es una campesina de 58 años de edad, nacida en el seno de una familia humilde que siempre se dedicó a las actividades del campo y, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, hoy en día ella se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, actividad con la que genera ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para brindar sustento a sus hijos. 

Su espíritu de superación, la tenacidad y la fortaleza con la que se levanta día a día, la impulsan para buscar nuevas opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar materiales para mantenimiento de cocheras, lechones y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para continuar solventando algunas necesidades familiares y, seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, que se ha convertido en la principal fuente de recursos económicos para la familia. 

Eduviges desea seguir luchando con empeño, dedicación y esfuerzo, para llegar a cumplir el sueño de adquirir más cerdos y tener una producción escalonada, que le garantice la entrada de utilidades constantemente y pueda brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Eduviges is a 58-year-old farmer. She was born into a humble family that always worked in the fields. Thanks to the teachings of her parents, today she works at breeding and selling pigs, the occupation with which she generates income to support her husband with the economic load of the home and to give sustenance to her children.

Her spirit of self-improvement, the tenacity and the strength with which she rises up daily, pushes her to look for new options to permit her to move forward. Thus, she is requesting the support of the loan with which she wishes to buy material to maintain the pigpens, buy suckling pigs and feed for the animals. This will permit her to increase her production, giving as a result the securing of improved earnings in order to continue resolving some family necessities and to continue investing in her business which has become the principal source of economic resources for the family.

Eduviges wishes to continue persevering with determination, dedication and effort in order to achieve the dream of acquiring more pigs and having a staggered production that would guarantee her a constant flow of income and the ability to offer her children a better education and improved well-being.

loans.use: to buy material to maintain the pig sheds, buy suckling pigs and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz, de 46 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la confección gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fabricas donde trabajaba como operaria de maquinas de confección.

Hoy en día es una mujer independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y una pequeña línea propia.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora y su motivación más grande para trabajar es su familia.

Ella se dedica a su negocio todos los días durante 5 horas con 1 empleado.
Ella tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de una auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra de una maquina fileteadora y una plana.

Con este préstamo ella podrá mantener su actividad vigente y seguirá ofreciendo empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Luz is 46 years old and has a lot of experience sewing thanks to many jobs at different factories where she worked as a sewing machine operator.

Today, she is an independent woman and earns her own income through sewing for third party contracts and a small line she designs herself. She is an enterprising woman and her greatest motivation is working for her family. She works every day for five hours and she has one employee.

She has many projects that she wants to complete, but she needs financial help to allow her to inject capital into her business so she can purchase an overlock sewing machine and a tabletop sewing machine.

With this loan, she will be able to maintain her work and continue offering employment to people in her area.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine and a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
Asha who is in her early 30s is married with two children. She has been running a charcoal business for five years now.She works from 12am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asha's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.She used the previous loan to increase her business and has paid back all her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciated Kiva for their support .She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of expanding her business and to become international business woman.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group Mchicha which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Chapa

texts.en:
Champa is 26 years old and a married lady. She is a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). She lives in a small mud house with her family in Kandi of West Bengal. Her son is 6 years old and goes to nearby village school and her daughter is 4 years old. She is a housewife and her husband is a fish vendor.

Her husband runs a fish business. He purchases varieties of fish from the wholesale market and sells them to the local market. He has been engaged with this business for last 10 years. He has chosen this business as there is high demand for fish in their area, and in West Bengal, people are fond of eating fish. But nowadays, his sales are not that much due to a lack of variety of fish. He needs some capital to invest in their business. Chapa also wants to grow this business, as this is the sole source of income of the family.

Thus, Chapa applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase different kinds of fish from the wholesale market to sell in the local market. This will help them to meet the local people’s demand, and they can generate more income as well. She dreams that with her business profit she can build a concrete house for them in the future. She and her husband are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy varieties of fish to increase the business.

loans.name: Sokoun's Group

texts.en:
Sokoun’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokoun works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 36-year-old married lady. She lives with her husband and a son in a small village of Kandi in West Bengal. Her son reads in grade 11, and she wants to provide higher education to her only son.

Rani’s husband is an electrician by profession. He installs and maintains electrical equipment. He repairs electrical appliances and specializes in electrical wiring of buildings. He has to face tough competition in the market as there are other electricians also. But his goodwill and efficient work help him to attain many customers.

Now he needs to develop his business to attract more customers as this is the sole source of income of the family.

As a responsible lady, Rani applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use this money to increase her husband’s business through purchasing many kinds of modern electrical accessories like wires, drilling machine, bulbs, etc., in order to serve more customers.

Rani expects that this loan will help them to expand the business and will strengthen the economic condition of her family. Rani and her husband are grateful to their generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase modern electrical accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 31-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and children in Dhupguri. Her husband, Kabir, is a van puller by profession. Both of them have primary level education but give full support to their children in their studies.

They are blessed with two daughters and one son. Her son studied up to grade 10. Her younger daughter is in grade 6. Her elder daughter, 14-year-old Kabita, reads in grade 8 in Vidyashram D.V. High School. She is a good student, but during the previous year exams her grades were not good enough, and so she wants to work hard for a smooth promotion to the next grade.

For that her parents are worried and planned to provide special coaching classes to get a good result. The family’s financial condition is not good. The monthly savings of her household are not sufficient to meet the educational expenses. Noor is facing problems bearing the cost of private tuition for her daughter. Kabita also needs to purchase books and study materials.

For this reason Noor is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay her daughter’s private tuition fees and school fees, and to purchase books and other study materials for her daughter's uninterrupted education. Kabita's aim is to be a nurse in the future, and she wants to serve poor people. This loan amount will help her to progress toward her goal.

Noor and her daughter Kabita (in the photo) are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the educational costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Kituli

texts.en:
Kituli is a married man with 5 children. He describes himself to be God fearing.

Kituli operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and he also runs a taxi business. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 55 years old, and she is married with five children, one child still in school,  She works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and cooking oil.

Janice has been in this business for two years.  In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a married, with two children.  She is 30 years old and has one child in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lani has a manufacturing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more bamboo to use in her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lani has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to use in her business

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is a married woman with ten children. Basilia is 51 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Basilia has a nipa weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Basilia requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo and nipa leaves to use in her business.

In the future, Basilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and nipa leaves to use in her business

loans.name: Jocy

texts.en:
Jocy is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocy is 37 years old and five of her children are still in school.

Jocy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Jocy requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Milmark is 18 years old and is the first of three children in the family. His mother, Marissa, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her business selling flowers, in the Philippines.

Milmark is studying ffor a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education.  He is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Marissa is borrowing PHP 9,000 to pay her son's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When he graduates, Milmark plans to to have successful work so he can help his parents.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Jessie Flor

texts.en:
Jessie Flor is 32 years old, and she is married, with three children, all three in school, Jessie Flor works very hard to provide for them.

Jessie Flor runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and cooking oil.

Jessie Flor has been in this business for a year. 

In the future, Jessie Flor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 64 years old and married with six children. Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, drinks and etc. Leonila has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, drinks and etc.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 35 years old, and she is married with two children, who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, coffee, and milk.

Rachel has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, like rice, coffee, and milk.

loans.name: Orlando Javier

texts.es: Orlando es un docente de 62 años que hace 10 años decidió apoyar la idea de negocio de un familiar, dedicado a la producción y comercialización de calzado tejido; su familiar no contaba con los recursos necesarios para ampliar el negocio, así que  decidió aportar el capital requerido y sus contactos para la comercialización. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija conformada por familiares, amigos, vecinos y los compañeros de trabajo quienes adicionalmente le encargan otro tipo de productos que adquiere en el comercio de Barranquilla a buen precio para revenderlas. Orlando manifiesta que el emprendimiento se ha convertido en una oportunidad para desarrollar sus capacidades en el negocio aparte de la satisfacción de contribuir con la generación de ingresos a su familia. Hoy en día el negocio familiar requiere una nueva máquina de coser y una mayor inversión en materias primas para atender la demanda de su clientela por lo cual Orlando está gestionando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para financiar este proyecto con el que espera un incremento significativo en sus ventas. Su meta es que  en el futuro pueda comprar nueva maquinarias para organizar un equipo de trabajo y  generar empleo.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 62-year-old teacher. Ten years ago he decided to support the business idea of a relative dedicated to making and selling woven shoes. His relative did not have the resources necessary to expand the business, so he decided to contribute the required capital and his contacts for the sales. Currently he has a fixed customer base made up of family, friends, neighbors, and colleagues from work who also order other types of products that he acquires in Barranquilla at a good price to then resell them.

Orlando mentions that the undertaking has transformed into an opportunity to develop his abilities in the business apart from the satisfaction of contributing by generating income for his family. Today the family business needs a new sewing machine and a larger investment in raw materials in order to meet the demand of the customers. For this reason Orlando is requesting his first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to finance this project. With this, he expects a significant increase in his sales. His goal is that in the future he will be able to buy new machinery to orginize a work team and create jobs.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and make a larger investment in raw materials.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en:
Herminda is 28 years old and has two children. Herminda is married and has one of her children is currently in school.

Herminda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Herminda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Herminda has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Herminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 52 years old and married with two children. Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks and etc. Lina has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Lina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, drinks and etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 34 years old. With one child in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal product care, junk foods, and other groceries. Elvira has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lodeth

texts.en:
Lodeth is 30 years old and single with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lodeth is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Lodeth has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 33 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Sharon has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lordilisa

texts.en:
Lordilisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lordilisa is 23 years old and one of her children is in school.

Lordilisa has a buy-and sell-seafood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Lordilisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood like shrimp, oysters, crabs and other seafood to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood like shrimp, oysters, crabs and others to sell.

loans.name: Shirley Judith

texts.es:
Desde el año 2011 la señora Shiley encontró la fórmula para sentirse útil y poder generar sus propios ingresos y lo logro gracias a la venta de mercancía

Shiley es una responsable, trabajadora y servicial mujer de 27 años de edad que se enorgullece de no tener que pedir dinero a nadie pues ella misma se consigue sustento. 

Solicita un crédito para comprar ropa, calzado, accesorios y artículos de belleza al por mayor y así poder aumentar sus ventas, este es un negocio muy conocido en su barrio y es por eso que le dedica de 6 a 8 horas a su negocio.

Con tu ayuda Shiley podrá mejorar su capital y tener un mejor sustento, apoya hoy!
texts.en:
Since the year 2011, Señora Shirley has found the way to feel useful and be able to generate her own income, and she has achieved this thanks to the sale of merchandise.

Shirley is a responsible, hard-working, and helpful woman of 27 who is proud not to have to ask for money from anyone, since she herself can provide her sustenance.

She is applying for a loan to purchase clothing, footwear, accessories, and beauty products wholesale and thus be able to increase her sales. This is a very well known business in her neighborhood, and it is for this reason that she works from 6 to 8 hours at her business.

With your help, Shirley will be able to improve her capital and have a better livelihood. Support her today!

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, accessories and beauty products wholesale and thus be able to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 43 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs. Maria Fe has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Kely Johana

texts.es:
Kely es una mujer emprendedora que hace un tiempo decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio en casa. 

Ella trabaja en la venta de golosinas y dulces con mucha dedicación y responsabilidad, teniendo claro un objetivo y es el de poder salir adelante con su familia.

Kely utilizará el crédito solicitado a la Corporación Interactuar para comprar al por mayor surtido de comestibles, frituras, entre otros, para poder abastecer su negocio con un buen inventario y por ende mejorar sus ventas.

Ella sueña con poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Kely is an enterprising woman who, some time ago, decided to start a small business out of her home.

She works selling sweets and candies with great dedication and responsibility, with the clear objective of enabling her family to get ahead.

Kely will use the credit she is requesting from the Interactuar Corporation to buy an assortment of groceries wholesale, including fried foods, among others, so as to supply her business with a good inventory and thus increase her sales.

She dreams to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of groceries wholesale, including fried foods, among others.

loans.name: Sibia

texts.en:
Sibia, aged 47, is married and supports three children. She is a small-scale farmer. Sibia has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides for her crops to enhance quality and improve yields.


Sibia plans to use the profits she earns to venture into large-scale sugar cane farming to earn more income. She hopes to be financially stable and to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides for her crops to enhance quality and improve yields.

loans.name: Mariale

texts.en:
Mariale, aged 34, is single with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Mariale has been running a general store in the Philippines: she also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mariale has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Mariale aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Aury Estela

texts.es:
Aury, con 28 años de edad, es una mujer campesina dedicada a la cría, engorde y comercialización de pollos y cerdos, actividad que surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía del hogar, pues se encontraba desempleada y su familia pasaba por una situación económica difícil. 

Los galpones se encuentran ubicados en el patio de la casa donde vive y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos para realizar las labores. 

Aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco su negocio fue aceptado en el sector, allí los familiares, vecinos y amigos son los principales compradores de los animales despresados. 

Su empuje, decisión y positivismo le han permitido salir adelante y le han dado una nueva oportunidad para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar concentrado para alimentar a las aves, compra de mas pollos y cerdos esto le permitirá aprovechar bien el espacio que tiene disponible y podrá realizar a tiempo el engorde de las aves.

Esto se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y por ende de los ingresos que recibe, con los que podrá seguir velando por el bienestar de su familia y además tendrá la oportunidad de fortalecer más su negocio y ampliar los galpones y la cantidad de aves, para tener mayor rentabilidad; de esta manera Aury ve más cerca el cumplimiento de su sueño, que es tener su negocio bien establecido pero en un lugar independiente de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aury, who is 28 years old, is a farm woman who raises, fattens, and sells chickens and pigs, a business that arose because of the need to generate income to support the household economy, since she was unemployed and her family was going through a difficult economic situation.

The sheds are located on the patio of the house where she lives, and she has the help of her children to do the work.

She learned [this business] empirically, and little by little her business was accepted in the sector. There her relatives, neighbors, and friends are the principal buyers of the butchered animals.

Her drive, determination, and positive attitude have allowed her to get ahead and have given her a new opportunity to improve the living conditions of her family.

Now she is applying for the help of a loan in order to buy feed concentrate to feed the birds and to buy more chickens and pigs. This will allow her to take good advantage of the space that she has available, and she will be able to fatten the birds in good time.

This will be reflected in an increase in sales and in the end in the income that she receives, with which she will be able to continue watching out for the well-being of her family. In addition, she will have the opportunity to further strengthen her business and extend her sheds and the quantity of birds in order to have greater profitability. In this way, Aury will see the completion of her dream become closer, which is to have a well-established business but in a place independent from her house.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate to feed the birds and to buy more chickens and pigs to allow her to take good advantage of the space that she has available.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel, aged 43, is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past four years, Maribel has been running a general store in the Philippines: she also earns an income from pig fattening.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, drinks, etc.

Maribel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Emielyn

texts.en:
Emielyn, aged 37, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emielyn has had a general store business in the Philippines for the past four years.

Emielyn has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Emielyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris, aged 29, is a single woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. For the past four years, Maricris has had a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maricris has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell at her local market.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell at her local market.

loans.name: Mitali

texts.en:
Mitali, a 41-year-old, married woman, resides in a village of Kandi in Murshidabad district, West Bengal, with her husband and two daughters. Her daughters are studying in grade 11 and 1, respectively.

The couple is running their household by being involved in small-scale businesses of sewing work. They make different clothing like trousers, shirts, T-shirts, pants, frocks, etc., and sell to their neighborhood.

Now Mitali needs to improve their business for better earnings but lack of capital is the main hindrance. So Mitali has asked for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BJS to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics in bulk to stitch sufficient garments to satisfy her customers.

The additional income from this endeavor will contribute to her monthly savings and help them in fulfilling her dreams of giving financial stability to her family. With the increased profit she dreams to provide further education to her daughters and build a concrete house for her family.

Mitali is grateful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to improve her sewing work business.

loans.name: Yurani Cristina

texts.es:
Yurani es una joven de 23 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia de un pequeño ya muy grande tiene 4 años y es el orgullo y motor de vida de Yurani, quien tiene que quedarse en casa cuidándolo ya que no tiene capital para pagar una niñera.
Al ser una persona humilde no puede dejar de trabajar, por ello busco una forma de generar ingresos desde su casa, inicio con la venta de ropa juvenil para hombre y dama con la cual genera el dinero suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos que demanda su hijo.
Yurani pensando en mejorar los ingresos y ahora que tiene una buena clientela, quiere mejorar su portafolio de ofertas, por ello solicita un aliento económico para iniciar a promocionar ropa infantil, buscando esos pesitos de más que ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida y encaminar el sueño de pagar la educación de su pequeño.
texts.en:
Yurani is a young woman of 23, a mother who is the head of a family with a little one who is already quite big: he is 4 years old, and he is the pride and driving force of Yurani's life. She has to stay at home caring for him, because she doesn't have the capital to pay for a babysitter.

Because she is a poor person, she cannot stop working. For this reason, she looked for a way to generate income from her home. She began selling clothes for young men and women, with which she generated enough money to cover all the expenses that her son required.

Yurani, thinking of improving her income now that she has a good customer base, wants to improve her portfolio of offerings. For this she is applying for economic encouragement in order to begin promoting children's clothing, seeking this little extra money that will help to improve her quality of life and channel her dream of paying for the education of her little one.

loans.use: to begin to promote the sale of children's clothing, seeking to attract more customers and invigorate her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una empresaria pujante, verraca, alentada, una orgullosa campesina que inicio por necesidad económica un negocio de cría de ganado, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que hoy los honra ejerciéndola.
María al ser una mujer humilde y con poco conocimiento en el mundo de la ganadería han intentado timarla, ofreciéndole productos y animales a muy alto costo, pero gracias a un amigo que se preocupa por su futuro y el de su familia, aprendió como diferenciar y a que precios comprar y vender, gracias a estos consejos ha mantenido su negocio y espera que crezca y se convierta en el pilar económico de su familia.
María quiere solicitar un préstamo, la razón es que busca completar el dinero para terminar de pagar el novillo que vemos en la foto. 
Al venderlo tendrá una excelente utilidad y podrá crecer su empresa y demostrar que es una mujer que con poco ha logrado mucho y lucha por su futuro.
texts.en:
María is a thriving, driven business owner, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud countrywoman, who started a business raising livestock, out of economic necessity. She learned the business from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it.

Since María is a humble woman with little knowledge in the world of livestock, people have tried to cheat her by offering her products and animals at very high prices. But thanks to a friend concerned for her and her family's future, she learned how to differentiate, and at what prices to buy and sell. Thanks to that advice, she has maintained her business and hopes that it will grow and become the economic pillar of her family.

María wants to request a loan because she is looking to round out the money she needs to finish paying for the heifer that we see in the photo.

When she sells it, she will have profit and will be able to grow her business. She will be able to show that she is a woman who has achieved a lot from only a little, and fights for her future.

loans.use: to finish paying for the heifer in the photo

loans.name: Miranda

texts.en:
Miranda is 28 years old and she has been involved in business activities since 2014. She started with her own working capital of $500. She has a small kiosk in front of her house and she is requesting this loan because she has a plan to open a bigger business in the future.

So now Miranda is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use this loan to buy additional supplies including biscuits, noodles, candies, cigarettes, milk, soft drinks and hard drinks, as well as other things to sell. She was very happy when Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her because she can use this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, candies, cigarettes, milk, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Gitashri

texts.en:
Gitashri is a 33-year-old lady. She lives in Kandi of West Bengal. She is the mother of a daughter who studies in grade 8. Gitashri has attended school up to grade 8. Her husband is associated with a small business.

Gitashri is a beautician and has been running her own beauty parlor from her home for the past 10 years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household expenses.

Currently she needs to buy different types of good quality cosmetics and other modern accessories for her beauty parlor to attract more customers, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Thus, Gitashri has applied for a loan through BJS (Kiva’s partner).

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the better income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. Gitashri hopes she would be able to make savings for her family to lead a secured life. For this financial assistance, Gitashri is very grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to buy different types of good quality cosmetics and other modern accessories for her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Supriya

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Supriya lives in a small village of Kandi. She lives there with her husband and two children (a daughter and a son). They both are too small to attend school.

Supriya is a housewife, and her husband, Bisweswar, is involved with a fish vending business. Her husband purchases fish from nearby villages and sells them in his rural area and market at a cheaper rate. Fish is a very popular food among the people of the locality, as well as West Bengal. For family functions and festivals, crowds of customers gather at the fish markets because of the huge demand for fish. So Supriya wants to utilize the opportunity by enhancing her husband’s stock of fish, and thus, she takes a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS.

She will buy a variety of fish to sell for more income and to expand the business as well. She hopes that her husband will be able to save money now and ensure to develop their family's financial condition.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish for her husband’s existing fish vending business.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Parbati is an entrepreneur from Kandi, West Bengal. She lives with her two children (one son and one daughter). Her children are pursuing their higher education.

Enterprising Parbati and husband are engaged with stitching and selling ready-made garments business. They bring different types of fabrics from the nearby town and sew ready-made garments like blouses, petticoats, pants, etc. They sell their finished products to the market. There is a good demand for their garments in the market. Now Parbati and her husband want to develop their business.

Thus Parbati wants to avail herself of a loan from Kiva through BJS. From the loan amount, she will purchase fabrics and other stitching materials in bulk quantities. She has a dream to enlarge her business and open a garment shop in the market. Parbati wants to save money from her business profit to provide uninterrupted education to her children. She is thankful to her lenders as they extend their helping hand towards her when she needed it.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and other stitching materials for her business.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 57-year-old entrepreneur. She lives with her son in a small village in Kandi, West Bengal. She is a widow who unfortunately lost her husband a few years back. So she is responsible for earning a livelihood for her family. Her son studied up to grade 12; after his father’s death, he engaged with a bakery business to give financial support to his mother.

Minati is engaged with a sattu business. She makes sattu in her home and supplies it to the local shops and in their neighborhood. Sattu is prepared by dry roasting Bengal grams. The dry fine powder is prepared with this roasted Bengal gram with the help of chakki (a grinding machine). It is commonly served cold for breakfast as a porridge or soft dough. There is a high demand for sattu in her local area, thus she wants to develop her business to satisfy the demand of her customers. She needs financial aid to invest in the business.

Thus, Minati applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy the Bengal gram in bulk for making sattu. She hopes that this investment will give a boost in her micro-enterprise as well as generate better income with which she can easily overcome the financial constraints of her family.

Minati is really grateful toward her lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy Bengal grams in bulk for making “sattu” (flour made of roasted Bengal gram).

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is a 40-year-old, married woman from a rural village of Kandi, Mushidabad district of West Bengal. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She is married to Probhat, a farmer by profession. This couple is blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). Their son is studying in grade 10, and both daughters are married.

Her husband’s income is inconsistent and inadequate to bear the household expenses. To give financial support to her family, Dipali decided to start her dairy business to sell cow milk and cottage cheese to her neighbors. It will also help in getting cow dung, which she can sell as fertilizer to the farmers and as fuel to the local rural villagers.

With this aim, Dipali seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a dairy cow and cow fodder to keep her cow healthy.

She is expecting a better increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Dipali wants to strengthen the family economy and dreams to build a concrete house for her family’s well-being.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for starting her dairy business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Eliza works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Eliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell to her local market.

Eliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 55 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Lucia is in the agricultural business, and has been fattening pigs for four years now in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a widowed woman with three children. She is 62 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Elna is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar and other material for her food production business.

Elna has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar and other material for her food production business.

loans.name: Nymfa

texts.en:
Nymfa is a 41-year-old married woman with two children who are in school.

Nymfa is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more meat to sell.

Nymfa has been in this business for one year. In the future, Nymfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Judita

texts.en:
Judita is 49 years old and married with one child.

Judita earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been fattening pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

Judita is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индира, 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают сына, ему 10 месяцев. У Индиры - средне-специальное образование, окончила медицинское училище, по специальности - фармацевт, в настоящее время - домохозяйка. Вместе с мужем занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2013 году, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Индиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 50 овец, 2 лошади, также обрабатывает 1,85 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым покупателям. Также реализует коровье и лошадиное экологически чистое молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет 26,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Индира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 2 лошадей для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и постройку дома, так как Индира мечтает о большой семьи с большим количеством детишек.
texts.en:
Indira is 29 years old, married and has a son together with her husband. Her son is 10 months old. Indira has vocational education. She finished medicine school with specialization pharmacist. She is currently a housewife. Together with her husband, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this in 2013 with the purchase of livestock for 25,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to Indira's persistent work, her farm currently has a cow, 50 sheep and two horses. She also processes 1.85 hectares of land, where she mainly grows haricots. The harvest she gets she sells wholesale. She also sells ecological milk from the cows and horses. The monthly income is 26,800 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Indira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and two horses for increasing the volume of milk for selling. Indira plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business and build a house, as she dreams of having a large family with a large number of children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and two horses in order to increase the volume of ecological milk sales.

loans.name: Pablicia

texts.en:
Pablicia is 51 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Pablicia has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Pablicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from running a general store.  Gemma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Genilyn

texts.en:
Genilyn, 32, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Genilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Genilyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Alberto Eligio

texts.es: Alberto trabajó desde su juventud en varias empresas privadas desarrollando la actividad de soldador, experiencia que aprovechó para implementar en su vivienda su taller de herrería, ofreciendo el servicio de elaboración de cerramientos en hierro, rejas, protectores de ventanas, portones y demás protección para los hogares. Negocio con el que ha logrado un sustento económico digno y creciente para su familia. Trabaja de lunes a sábado en el horario de 8:00 a.m a 5:00 p.m. y su clientela está conformada por los vecinos del sector donde reside, familiares amigos y referidos. Actualmente Alberto planea incrementar su inventario de productos terminados para ofrecer un mayor surtido de rejas y ventanas, proyecto que financiará con el primer credikiva que está tramitando a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar listones de hierro y accesorios. Alberto espera esta inversión le genere un incremento en las ventas y en sus utilidades. Su visión para el futuro es mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su taller.
texts.en: Alberto has worked since his youth in various private enterprises, developing in the field of welding. He has taken advantage of this experience to open a blacksmith's shop in his home, offering services like iron enclosure construction, railings, window grates, gates, and other protection for the home. With this business, he has made a respectable living (which is on the rise) for his family. He works Monday to Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., and has confirmed clientele among his neighbors in the area where he lives, family, friends and referrals. Currently, Alberto plans to increase his inventory of products to offer a better selection of gates and windows, a project he will finance with the first Kiva loan, which is processed through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and which he will use to purchase strips of iron, along with accessories. Alberto hopes this loan will generate an increase in sales and in his usefulness. His vision for the future is to improve his home and expand his workshop.

loans.use: to buy strips of iron, as well as accessories.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Desde el mes de Enero del 2015 la señora Maria encontró la fórmula para sentirse útil y poder generar sus propios ingresos y lo logro gracias a la venta de pasteles.

Maria es una responsable, trabajadora y servicial mujer de 44 años de edad que se enorgullece de no tener que pedir dinero a nadie pues ella misma se consigue sustento. 

Solicita un crédito para comprar pasteles y biscochos al por mayor y así poder aumentar sus ventas, este es un negocio poco común en su barrio y es por eso que le dedica de 5 horas a su negocio.

Con tu ayuda Maria podrá mejorar su capital y tener un mejor sustento, apoya hoy!
texts.en:
In January 2015, Maria found the formula for feeling useful and being able to generate her own income. She achieved this thanks to her cake business. Maria is a responsible, hard working and accommodating, 44 year old woman. She is proud to not need to beg anybody for money since she earns her own living.

She is requesting a loan to buy cakes and biscuits wholesale and thus be able to increase her sales. This is an uncommon business in her neighborhood and this is why she works at her business for 5 hours. With your help, Maria will be able to increase her capital and improve her livelihood, support now!

loans.use: to buy cakes and biscuits wholesale and thus be able to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Norbey Alonso

texts.es:
Norbey es un empresario amoroso, sobreprotector, trabajador, amigable y honesto de 38 años de edad, un hombre que gusta del trabajo independiente y realiza con gran orgullo su profesión de cría de ganado porcino.

Es padre de 3 hijos, un adolecente de 20 años, otro de 15 y la menor de 13, todos ellos viven y dependen de Norbey y su madre, y el motivo por el cual este hombre coloca tanto empeño y amor a su trabajo es que desea pagar una buena educación universitaria a sus muchachos, que estudien y se capaciten para ser exitosos en la vida.

Debido al alto costos de insumos, la competencia en el sector para Norbey ha sido muy difícil progresar y más aún expandirse, en gran parte por esta problemática y la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio.
Todas estas situaciones lo han llevado a tomar la decisión de buscar un apoyo económico para fortalecer su empresa, dicho apoyo lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y comprara 45 gallinas para extender su portafolio de servicios, teniendo dos animales en su negocio.
texts.en:
Norbey is a loving, overprotective, hard-working, friendly, honest businessman. He is 38 years old. He likes working independently and he takes great pride in his profession, which is raising pigs.

He is the father of three children: a 20-year-old son, a 15-year-old son, and a 13-year-old daughter. All of the children live with Norbey and their mother. The reason why this man puts so much effort and love into his work is because he wants to pay for a good university education for his children so they can study and have success in life.

Due to the high cost of supplies and the competition in the sector, as well as a lack of money to invest in his business, it has been very difficult for Norbey to get ahead and expand.

All of these circumstances have led him to make the decision to seek financial support so he can strengthen his business. He will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs and he will buy 45 hens to extend his portfolio of services by offering two different types of animals for sale.

loans.use: to strengthen his business by buying pigs and 45 hens

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Harriet, a 38-year-old smallholder farmer who always brings a pleasant feeling when she is at home. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, an area that is a city of champions because of producing so many elite athletes. Being a mother comes with lots of responsibility, and feeding her large family requires a lot of hard work; hence, Harriet has to put in extra effort to comfortably take care of her family. 

Harriet started farming just after finishing high school since she never advanced her education. Because of the high unemployment rate, she ventured into farming, and she has never regretted this because of the profits she has been making. Harriet practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardest working farmers in her village because she is able to juggle between keeping pigs and also doing crop farming. 

Harriet is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do pig farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges she has faces is lack of capital.
 
That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy additional pigs. The Chuka area has the highest demand for pork meat and through this loan, Harriet is going to sell her pork meat to the nearby market and also to her neighbours. 

Other than pork meat, she will also benefit from the manure from the pigs waste which will save her the cost that she used to incur buying fertilizers.

Through the loan, Harriet is confident that her life will be transformed and her dream of providing a secure future for her family will be achieved. Harriet is relieved to know that her life can be secured through partners such as Kiva who help small-scale and aspiring women such as Harriet.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells caps, torches, bulbs, umbrellas and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bulbs, caps, umbrellas, torches and other items. 

Her business goal is to have a big shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more items for her retail store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 45 years old and has one child in school.

She has an agricultural business, growing rice in the Philippines. Lucia has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cindis Paola

texts.es:
Cindis es una joven de 21 años de edad, una joven que ya contrajo matrimonio y ahora con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes busca un sostenimiento de su nueva familia, quiero poner todo su empeño y esfuerzo para que todo marche bien con su esposo.
El deseo que tiene Cindis es comprar una vivienda propia, un sueño a largo plazo, pero que está decidida por cumplir.
Como apenas está iniciando su empresa no cuenta con mucho capital, ella es una persona humilde y tampoco tiene historial crediticio, por ello se llevo una grata alegría que una entidad financiera la quiera apoyar en toda su gestión.
Cindis solicita un préstamo para la compra de víveres y abarrotes para abastecer y ampliar su surtido.
texts.en:
Cindis is a 21-year-old young woman who is already married. Now she is trying to support her new family with her business, which is a grocery store. She wants to put all of her effort into ensuring that everything goes well with her husband.

Cindis wishes to buy her own house; this is a long-term dream, but she is determined to achieve it.

Since she is just starting out in her business, she does not have much capital. She is a humble person and she doesn’t have a credit history; for this reason, she was so grateful and happy that a financial entity wanted to help her out.

Cindis is requesting a loan to purchase supplies and groceries so she can restock and expand her inventory.

loans.use: to buy supplies and groceries to restock and expand her inventory

loans.name: Arna

texts.en:
Arna is 46 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is currently in school.

Arna is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in fattening pigs for four years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Arna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Arna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are still in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks, etc. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 54 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is still in school.

Ivy is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ivy requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for ten years. 

Teresita has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ana Clarilda

texts.es:
Clarilda es toda una guerrera,  ella a sus 58 años de edad trabaja en la agricultura, actividad que desempeña para mantener su hogar, es casada y no tiene hijos, el pasar de los años la han privado de realizar ciertas actividades tales como la asistencia de su cultivo que necesita gran esfuerzo físico entre otras, pero sin importar las dificultades esta luchadora mujer sigue en pie.
De momento Clarilda se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como; abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas y el resto del capital lo usara para pagar la mano de obra para la asistencia de su cultivo.
El dinero lo necesita Clarilda es porque no tiene capital, dado que no anda en temporada, será un impulso muy importante para lograr una cosecha abundante y tener el terreno listo para una próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Clarilda is a fighter. She is 58 years old and works in agriculture in order to support her household. She is married and does not have any children. The passing of the years has resulted in her having to stop doing certain activities, such as tending her crops, because they require great physical exertion, but this determined woman remains standing despite the difficulties.

Clarilda is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies, such as compost, irrigation, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides. She will use the remaining capital to pay workers to tend her crops.

Clarilda needs the money because she doesn’t have capital. It will be a very significant push towards obtaining an abundant harvest and preparing the land for the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as compost, irrigation, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides, and pay workers to apply the aforementioned products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food to sell, like sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 49 years old, married and is blessed with eight children. She is from Oscariz Ramon. Her husband is a carpenter and at the same time a farmer. The couple own 2,500 square meters of of ricefield and a piggery with two sows and 25 piglets.

Mercedita also sells a variety of vegetables like okra, squash, bitter gourd and string beans. She started selling of vegetables when she was 17. Due to  high demand, Mercedita requests a loan of PHP10,000 to buy four sacks of feed and medicine for her pigs. She believes that if the pigs are raised well, she can sell them at a higher price that can help their daily living.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old and has three children. With two children in school, Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, junk food, cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, junk food, cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 50 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband(also shown in the photo) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 4 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 20 years old and lives in Liquiça. 

Regina has plans to change her business, so now she is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a small kiosk, so she will use this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as biscuits, noodles, shampoo, nuts, note books, candies and other things to sell. 

Regina started her kiosk a few years ago, with her own working capital of $ 500. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, shampoo, nuts, note books, candies and other things to sell.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yuliana. Yuliana lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She is happily married. Yuliana owns a stall where she sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She wanted to join Ruma because as a woman, she wants to help her husband improving their life, as well as give more contribution to her community.

As the business grows, Yuliana is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Yuliana improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Yuliana is the one who is sitting in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 54 years old and she lives with her big family in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. Larisa has 6 children; her 5 daughters are married and they live with their families and her son is now at the army and passed his military service. Larisa in her native village with her husband runs faming and agriculture. In the farm she has cows, a calf, a heifer, lambs, sheep and chickens. Her farm products that she sells during the week are milk, meat, cheese, eggs and also her land’s harvest such as potato, cucumber, tomato, greens and onions. She mentions that she is happy with her farm works which are a lot every day and seems to be endless, but she does every work with pleasure.

This loan of 600.000 Armenian drams Larisa asks for the purchase of a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle, as her cattle has lack of fodder, because of a very hot summer, there is no green grass in the fields and so the pastures are not full with grass any more.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Joe Felix

texts.en:
Joe Felix is a first-year student at Kepler. He is one of the school's first international students, coming from the neighboring country of Burundi. Because of his exceptional academic record and test scores, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. 

Joe Felix plans to study Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, he would like to work at an NGO that focuses on education and health. Joe also wants to earn enough to support his younger brothers and sisters through school.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sweets and other items to add in his retail shop to sell.

loans.name: Barjam

texts.en:
Bajram is 49 years old and a father of three children ranging in age from 10 to 25 years old. The loan that he is requesting from you will be used in his rural activity, to buy fertilizers and perform some other plowing/harvesting work on the land where he's been planting almost every year for the past ten years.

He produces white and red beets in 4 dynym,wheat in 4 more dynym and medicinal flowers on the rest 4. He has also orchards as seen in the background of the picture. The annual income he receives from the agriculture is as follows: $1000 from selling the beets and $900 from selling the medicinal flowers. He doesn't sell wheat because it is used to make bread.

In addition, he makes about $10/day from some vehicle tire repair activity.

loans.use: to improve his farm, which needs some work in order to have a good production

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 51 years old married mother of four children, who has been working as a tailor since 2012.
Her business is going on just fine, but her family's increasing living needs forced her to provide special cleaning services to laundries to increase her income.
Zeinab runs her business from her house. She is well known in her region with a very good reputation and skilled in her domain. Her living needs are increasing and her combined incomes are barely enough to cover her increasing living needs, especially the requested medication expenses.
Thus, for this reason, Zeinab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her personal medical expenses.
Zeinab is working hard to open her own separate tailoring shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her personal medical expenses.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annie is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Annie has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Annie requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell.

Annie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Annie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sirasi

texts.en:
Sirasi, a forty one year old married man previously became a Hofokam borrower after borrowing 2,000,000/= to buy more coffee to sell. He thanks the lenders for the support as he was able to earn some profits and pay back the loan.

He intends to re invest more in farming but doesn’t have adequate capital. He tried to run other small businesses but failed to keep them on board since they never earned him enough outputs due to high price fluctuations. That’s why he has decided to come back to Hofokam for more money of 2,200,000/= so that he could re-invest in farming and increase his profits.

He intends to use the requested loan to buy more coffee and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
