The lady in the photo is Grace, thirty three years old, married and a mother of four children. She has undergone the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training that has enabled her to start her own enterprises.

She does dairy farming to earn her living and she is taking a Kiva loan to buy a calf in order to increase her milk production. Grace hopes to get more profit that will enable her to provide better clothing for her family and also pay school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a calf in readiness for more milk production on maturity. This will enable her provide for her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Young Heart Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Agnes, twenty nine years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 where she has benefited through the training that has enabled her manage her finances well. She does dairy farming to earn a living and is taking a Kiva loan to renovate her cow shed and buy animal feeds to increase her milk production.
She hopes this will enable her provide balanced diet and better clothing for her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and contruct a cow shed. This will increase production and enable her to provide a balanced diet to her family.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops and she has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be floods. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia manages farming and livestock business.She raises fingerlings and pigs for sale.Leticia is 44 years old,married and has ten children. She and her husband has been working together to sustain their family basic needs.

Leticia would like to take out for a loan of PHP50,000 to be use in purchasing 22 sacks of feeds and vitamins. She knows that through having this hog supplies,she could improve the growth of her hogs and also with her fingerlings. Leticia is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount. In this way,she could gain greater income and let her three children still in school finish their studies and also save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to be use in purchasing 22 sacks of feeds and vitamins to raise hogs.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he  offers transport services using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be increase in fuel prices. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy materials to finish constructing his house. He hopes that in the future, he will own a fleetof matatus for transport. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy materials to finish constructing his house

loans.name: Kyambi

texts.en:
Kyambi is a married woman with 8 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, onions, cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, onions and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals, onions and other items

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. He grew up in Kigali with his father, who was his role model. He was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because it offers the opportunity to gain work experience while also earning a prestigious degree that will set him apart from other applicants in the workforce.

An outstanding student, Philippe plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He also hopes to improve his fluency with technology and professional skills. After graduating, his dream is to work in business, possibly as an auditor. Philippe especially wants to be in a position to give back to his family one day.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Thy works as farmer and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kirinya Parents School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is James. He is the Head teacher of Kirinya Parents School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kampala with 300 students. Kirinya School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kirinya School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. James ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
This nice and charming woman’s name is Sona and she lives in the village Verin Khotanan of Syunik region. Sona has higher education and she works at the school as a teacher of mathematics. Sona is very patient and clever teacher who is ready to help each of her pupils to learn more and to have better scores at the end of the semester. Sona also manages to run farming and she is perfect in this sphere also. Sona is married and she has three daughters (they are married and they live with their families).

Sona now asks this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature. These she greatly needs in order to make her courses more informative and interesting for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature, to make her mathematics courses more interesting to her pupils

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 24 years old, married woman and a mother of 2 children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.   She with her husband is doing work of agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Naseem has applied a loan of 40000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a first-year student at Kepler. She is one of 8 children and grew up with her family in rural Rwanda. Because of Florence's impressive academic credentials, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Florence plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to work in hospitals and clinics in order to give back to her family and her country.

Her educational goals are to gain the technology and professional skills needed to be a succesessful manager at an organization.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет, 32 года, не замужем,есть дочь. По характеру Бермет очень ответственная и спокойная женщина. У нее среднее образование, занимается торговлей продуктами питания и прохладительными напитками. Начала Бермет свой бизнес с 50,000 сом (KGS). В данный момент в обороте есть товар на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход Бермет составляет до 19,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание семьи и воспитание дочери, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения продуктов питания для увеличения товарооборота в магазине. В будущем Бермет собирается увеличивать свой бизнес, чтобы улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Bermet is 32 years old, single, with a daughter. Bermet is a very responsible and calm woman. She has completed secondary school. Now she sells groceries and cold beverages for a living. Bermet's seed capital when starting this business was 50,000 som (KGS). Her current turnover is 100,000 som (KGS) with the monthly income of 19,000 som (KGS) which is not enough to support herself and her daughter. That's why she turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy groceries to increase her store's turnover. Bermet plans to further develop her business in the future to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase groceries supply for retail sale in her shop in order to help bolster her income

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура 26 летняя жительница района Файзабад. Она развелась мужем и имеет одного ребенка. У нее маленький сыночек. Мастура теперь одна воспитывает, и кормить сына. Она 1 год работает в салоне красоты. Она предоставляет услуги стилиста, визажиста, также услуги маникюра и педикюра, и еще она арендует свадебные одежды для невестки. Мастура всесторонний специалист. Сейчас она собирается купить новые инструменты для работы, в том числе расчески, средства для укладки волос, косметику (пудра, тени, помада) и разное другое. Для приобретения всех принадлежностей и инструментов она обратилась за кредитом. Мастура верит и надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Mastura is a 26-year-old resident of Fayzabad region. She is divorced, a mother of one. She has a little boy. Now Mastura is a single mom raising her son alone. She has been working in a beauty salon for a year. She is a stylist, visagiste, does manicure and pedicure. She also rents wedding clothes. 

Mastura wears many hats, she is a very multi-faceted person. She is now planning to to buy more supplies for work, including hair brushes, hair gels, beauty aids (powder, eye shadows, lipstick), etc. She requested a loan to purchase these items. Mastura believes in you and hopes for your support!

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies (hair brushes, hair gels, cosmetics)

loans.name: Muhsina

texts.ru:
Мухсина молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Её 31 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Мухсина  очень жизнерадостная и любящая мать. Мухсина очень трудолюбивая  женщина. У неё высшее образование. Она работает учительницей в средней школе. У неё очень дружная семья. 
Мухсина обратилась в Арванд  когда узнала что есть возможность получить кредит на образование. Мухсина желает получить кредит для оплаты обучения своего сына. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhsina is a young and hard-working woman. She is 31 years old. She is married, with three kids. Muhsina is a happy and loving mother. She has completed higher education and works as a secondary school teacher. Her family is very united. 

When she learned about the opportunity to get a student loan, Muhsina applied to Arvand for it. She requested a loan to fund her son's education. She is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial assistance!

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et est composé de femmes qui jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadiatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 25 ans, mariée et mère 04 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de sucre.

 Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 03 sacs de sucre à 18000f le sac pour le revendre en détails.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper ses enfants et aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 17, 2011 at the launch of its banc villageois. The group just took out its ninth loan. It is composed of women who have a good rapport and a team spirit. They mainly work as vendors. Mrs. Kadiatou (the one standing on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 25 years old, married and the mother of four. She sells sugar. 

With this new loan, Kadiatou plans to buy three bags of sugar at 18,000 West African francs per bag to sell at retail prices. With her revenues, she plans to provide for her children and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new clothing material to sell.

loans.name: Mutirithia Women Group

texts.en:
Ruth, raising her hand in the photo, is 40 years old ,married and blessed with 4 children. One child is still attending primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 in order to benefit from the trainings, especially in enterprise development.

Ruth is involved in selling fruits. She also farms maize, beans and potatoes. She has applied for a loan to buy more fruit as additional stock for her business. This will enable her meet the increasing customer demand and hence earn more income to pay school fees for her child.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more fruit as stock for her fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Alirio

texts.es:
Pagar la educación de sus dos hijos es el sueño y anhelo de este humilde campesino llamado Alirio quien hoy necesita de tu apoyo para fortalecer su profesión como agricultor, dado que en el momento no cuenta con capital para comprar los insumos agrícolas que necesita su negocio, por ello con el aliento económico quiere comprar insecticidas, fungicidas, fertilizantes, además de pagar la mano de obra para regar y aplicar los productos.
Este impulso económico será muy importante para el sostenimiento de los cultivos, esperando una pronta abundante cosecha y teniendo la tierra lista para regar semillas.
texts.en: Paying for the education of his two children is the dream and desire of this humble countryman named Alirio. He needs your help to strengthen his profession as a farmer, given that at the moment he does not have enough money to buy the agricultural products that his business needs. Therefore, with the economic relief of the loan, he wants to buy insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers, and to pay labor to water and apply the products to the crops. This economic impulse will be very important for sustaining the crops. He is hoping for an abundant, early harvest and having the land ready to water the seeds.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies: insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers, and to pay labor to apply the products.

loans.name: Kigata Kwesigangana Group

texts.en:
Dezideranta is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda who has been a farmer most of her life. For over twenty years she has been growing maize and beans for commercial and subsistence purposes. She has managed to save up money to educate her six children, though some are still in school.  In the future, she would like to start taking her produce to the city and she also wants to buy a car for transport.
 
Dezideranta is seeking a loan to clear some land and plant maize and beans for the coming season. She is a member of the Kigata Kwesigangana Group - where members guarantee each other to get a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to clear land and plant crops for the coming season.

loans.name: Oscar Dario

texts.es:
Oscar es un noble campesino de 36 años de edad, el cual recibió una herencia de trabajo de su padre, un cultivo de caña y frijol. Un padre de familia que busca un mejor futuro para su muchacho y para los miembros de su hogar. 
Oscar no solo quiere trabajar lo que le dejo su padre, quiere aportar su granito de arena y desea plantar tomates de aliño, un proyecto para el cual necesita capital que de momento no tiene, por ello quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de 1.500 plantas de tomate de aliño, fertilizantes y venenos. 
Este proyecto lo realiza, por crecimiento, por buscar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y pro dejarle a su hijo una linda y abundante herencia, espera que solo sea el comienzo de una gran ampliación y variación de cultivos.
texts.en: Oscar is a noble 36 year old countryman. He received a work inheritance of cane and bean crops from his father. He is the father of a family and is looking for a better future for his son and the members of his home. Oscar does not only want to work with what his father left him, he wants to contribute his part and plant tomatoes. It is a project that he needs money for and he does not have any money at the moment, so he is asking for financial support to buy 1,500 tomato plants, fertilizers and pesticides. This project is carried out for growth and to look for a better quality of life for his family and leave his son a good and abundant inheritance. He hopes that this is only the beginning of a major expansion and variation of crops.

loans.use: to buy 1,500 tomato plants, fertilizers and pesticides. He is making a big bet for progress.

loans.name: Samir Esteban

texts.es:
Samir es un joven de 26 años de edad, habilidoso y recursivo que tomó los recursos que tenía a su alcance y monto una empresa. Inicio en el año 2014 una cría de ganado porcino, profesión que aprendió de su padre y que emplea por necesidad económica ante la falta de oportunidades para trabajar en alguna empresa. 
La fuerte competencia en el sector amenaza a las pequeñas empresas como la de Samir, debido a la pelea de precios que hay para vender un cerdo, pero este ingenioso hombre busca ayudas y alternativas para superar estas adversidades, por tal motivo quiere solicitar un aliento económico para la compra de alimento de engorde, vitaminas y lechones.

Este préstamo será un enorme impulso para el crecimiento y sostenimiento de la empresa del joven Samir.
texts.en:
Samir is a young 26 year old man. He is skilled and resourceful, and took the resources that he had within his reach and set up a business. He started a pig breeding business in 2014, which is a profession that he learned from his father and which he uses for economic need due to the lack of opportunities to work in a company.

The strong competition in the area is a threat to the small businesses like Samir's, due to the price war for selling a pig, but this witty man is looking for aid and alternatives to overcome these adversities.

That is the reason he is asking for financial support to buy fattening food, vitamins and piglets. This loan will be a huge momentum for the growth and sustainability of young Samir's business.

loans.use: to buy fattening food, vitamins and piglets, in order to increase his production.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 29 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidido a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

El desea desempeñarse como vendedor de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros, en el municipio de Taraza.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de su hogar.
Es un hombre emprendedor y muy disciplinado.

El solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresario y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Carlos, 29 years old, clearly knows what he wants from life and is determined to improve his financial situation and live a good life.

He wants to be a seller of mixed merchandise such as clothes, accessories like wallets, and some cosmetics in the city of Taraza.

He wants to start this business with the eagerness to make the necessary income to sustain himself and his home.

He is an enterprising and very disciplined man.

He is requesting this loan to buy a wide range of clothes at wholesale and this way make use of the opportunity presented by the Interacturar Corporation of being independent.

He is hoping to be able to progress as an entrepreneur and to have have a more stable income and he thanks all the people who can contribute to his dream.

loans.use: to buy a wide range of clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Eduin Manuel

texts.es:
Eduin es un agricultor, trabajador, honesto, sonriente y amigable, vive en la zona de puerto escondido la cual en el momento presenta una situación complicada para los agricultores ya que hay una sequía prolongada.
Para Eduin esto es un problema de grandes proporciones ya que vive y come del cultivo y de su negocio depende además su familia. 
Por ello para luchar contra esta problemática, quiere recurrir a un apoyo económico para la comprar de insumos agrícolas que ayuden a su cultivo a soportar las inclemencias del clima. 
El sueño es seguir realizando su profesión y trabajar por el progreso diario de su familia.
texts.en:
Eduin is a farmer, hard-worker, honest, smiling and friendly. He lives in the area of Puerto Escondido, which, at the moment, is in a complicated situation with the famers because there has been a prolonged drought. This is a problem for Eduin in great proportions because he lives and eats from the crops and his family depends on the business.

For this reason, to fight against this problem, he wants to rely on financial support to buy the agricultural supplies that help his crops to withstand inclement weather. His dream is to keep doing his job and work for the daily progression of his family.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural supplies that help his crops to withstand inclement weather.

loans.name: Vilma Marisol

texts.es: Vilma de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive muy feliz junto a su hijo de 6 años de edad en casa propia y humilde. Ella es una madre muy trabajadora y responsable que se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su hijo, por lo que  en su hogar cuenta con una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad desde hace 3 años es así como cubre las necesidades básicas de su hijo. Anteriormente, Vilma solicito un crédito a FUSAI para poder construir un muro de lo cual está muy agradecida pues poco a poco va mejorando las condiciones habitacionales en su hogar. Vilma solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder construir una pequeña habitación de bloque en su propiedad  para lo que invertirá en: ladrillos, cemento, grava, arena y pago de mano de obra para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Vilma is 32 years old. She is a single mother and lives very happily with her 6 year old son in her own humble house. She is a very hard-working and responsible mother who strives to give her son the best. She has a store in her house where she has sold staple products for 3 years. This is how she covers the basic necessities of her son.

Previously, Vilma asked for a loan through FUSAI to be able to build a wall, and she is very thankful because little-by-little she is improving the conditions of her home.

Vilma is asking for a loan through FUSAI to be able to build a small cement block bedroom on her property. She will invest in bricks, cement, gravel, sand, and labor to build a bedroom in her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, gravel, sand and to pay labor to build a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: Miryam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miryam tiene 48 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos. 

Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió desde muy joven, las labores agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres; esto le ha servido para generar ingresos que solventan las necesidades básicas del hogar, ya que posee un galpón, donde cría y engorda pollos para luego venderlos. 

La cliente es una mujer enérgica, activa y trabajadora, siempre va en busca de mejores opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando. 

Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de materiales para construcción de cocheras, ampliación de galpón, compra de concentrados y vitaminas para alimentar los animales, con lo que podrá venderlos a un mejor precio de acuerdo al peso; así mejorará los ingresos que recibe para seguir aportando a la economía de su familia y velar por el bienestar de sus hijos. 

Miryam sueña con ampliar su galpón y adquirir más animales, para tener una producción escalonada, que le brinde una estabilidad económica, además desea disfrutar junto a sus hijos de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Miryam is 48 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has 3 children.

She has spent her whole life in the countryside, where she learned, from very young, the agricultural tasks, thanks to her parents' instruction. This has served her to generate income which pays for the basic necessities of the household, since she has a chicken coop where she raises and fattens chickens to later sell them.

The client is an energetic, active and hard-working woman who always seeks out better options that will allow her to continue advancing.

She asks for the loan with the end of investing it in the purchase of materials to build sheds, expand the chicken coop, and purchase concentrated feed and vitamins to feed the animals, with which she will be able to sell them at a better price by weight. In this way, she will increase the income that she gets to continue supporting her family's economy and watching over her children's well-being.

Miryam dreams of expanding her chicken coop and getting more animals to have a tiered production, which offers economic stability. In addition she wants to enjoy better living conditions with her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build sheds, expand the chicken coop, and purchase concentrated feed and vitamins to feed the animals.

loans.name: Virgilia De Los Santos

texts.es:
Virgilia es una pujante y responsable agricultora de 45 años de edad, empresaria que inicio su negocio pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, todo lo que ven en la foto es el fruto del trabajo duró de esta grandiosa empresaria que empezó con un sueño cultivando unas semillas y hoy distribuye sus productos en la plaza de mercado.
Ella trabaja por un sueño, pagar la educación de sus muchachos, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y ampliar el número de productos cultivados en su tierra.
Debido a las sequías que azota a montería, Virgilia debe abonar y regar ciertos insumos para contrarrestar este problema climático, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos, riegos y venenos para proteger su cultivo y tener una aceptable venta para el sostenimiento de su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Virgilia is a strong and responsible farmer, 45 years old. She is a businesswoman who began her business by enjoyment and the vocation to work independently. All of what is seen in the photo is the fruit of the hard work of this impressive businesswoman who began with a dream, planting some seeds and today sells her products in the market square.

She works for a dream, to pay for her children's education, improve her family's living conditions and expand the number of products grown on her land.

Due to the drought that batters Montería, Virgilia has to manure and irrigate certain supplies to counteract this climactic problem, so she asks for a loan to purchase manure, irrigation supplies, and pesticides to protect her crop and have an acceptable sale to sustain her family and her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to irrigate his crops and bear the wave of drought.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, con 21 años de edad, es soltero. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a laborar como empleado de oficios varios en fincas de diferentes veredas del corregimiento. 

Desde hace unos meses cuenta con experiencia en la cría y comercialización de bovinos y, debido a ello, desea iniciar su propio negocio para generar ingresos adicionales para su familia. 

Cuenta con la ventaja de tener un terreno para sostenerlos y por esto se anima a solicitar el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de 6 terneros, de esta manera tendrá la posibilidad de producir unos ejemplares de buena calidad obteniendo asi un negocio rentable.

William es un hombre pujante, activo, trabajador y se esmera por sacar adelante su familia; él sueña poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda
texts.en:
William, 21 years old, is single. During his work life, he has worked as an employee in various jobs on farms on different paths in the town.

For some months, he has had experience raising and selling cattle and, due to that, he wants to begin his own business to generate additional income for his family.

He has the advantage of having a plot of land to support them and, for this, he is excited to ask for a loan which will be invested in the purchase of 6 calves. In this way, he will have the possibility of producing some examples of good quality, getting in this way a profitable business.

William is a strong, active, and hard-working man and he goes to a lot of effort to get his family ahead. He dreams of being able to improve the conditions of his house.

loans.use: to purchase 6 calves.

loans.name: Mercedes Leonor

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer con carácter fuerte, una empresaria con un firme propósito, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su vivienda, algo que con el pasar del tiempo ha ido logrando con su humilde negocio de cría de cerdos un negocio que heredó de su familia y que trabaja 8 horas todos los días de la semana. 

Mercedes necesita un apoyo para su negocio, quiere volverse competitiva y luchar contra la competencia, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para abastecer las cocheras.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a woman with a strong character, a businesswoman with a strong goal, to improve the living conditions of her home, something that, with the passing of time, she has been managing with her humble business raising pigs, which she inherited from her family and which she works 8 hours every day of the week.

Mercedes needs support for her business. She wants to become competitive and fight against the competition, so she asks for a loan to purchase pigs to stock the sheds.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to stock the sheds, she wants to keep herself in the market and be a strong competitor.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un carismático empresario de 50 años de edad que diariamente sale a atender su negocio de cría de ganando de porcino con la esperanza de mejorar y vender muchos más para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
A lo largo de su profesión ha aprendido a sobrevivir, no ha encontrado mucho apoyo para crecer pero se las ingenia para producir el dinero suficiente para pagar todas las deudas que generan mantener un hogar.
Gracias a le llegada de Interactuar a la vida de Víctor, este hombre cambio su mentalidad, ahora quiere ve oportunidades de crecer, de generar mayores ingresos, de ser competitivos y trabajar ya no pro sobrevivir, pasar a un siguiente nivel. Por estos motivos el empresario quiere solicitar un apoyo económico que lo usara para la compra de lechones, vitaminas, vacunas, alimento de engorde y materiales para la construcción de una chiquera ya que se ampliara.
texts.en:
Victor is a 50-year-old charismatic entrepreneur who tends his business of breeding pigs everyday with the goal to improve a lot and sell much more to have a better quality of life.

Throughout his career he has learned to survive. He has never gotten much support to grow but managed to make the enough money to pay all his bills, coming from maintaining his home.

Thanks to Interactuar stepping into Victor's life, this man changed his mind set. He now wants to use opportunities for growth, for generating income, for being competitive and not work for his survival, but for making it to the next level.

Because of these entrepreneurial motives he is requesting financial support, which he will use to buy piglets, vitamins, vaccination, fattening food, and material to extend his pigsties.

loans.use: to buy piglets, vitamins, vaccination, fattening food, and material to extend his pigsties.

loans.name: Nurys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es Nurys es una empresaria agrícola de 58 años de edad, toda una guerrera y luchadora que mantiene tres profesiones, la agricultura, la cría de gallinas y la cría de ganado porcino, es una mujer muy polivalente, que entrega cuerpo y alma a su profesión, la ayuda su esposo y juntos trabajan por el progreso de su familia. 
Esta grandiosa y talentosa empresaria necesita un apoyo económico para mejorar las condiciones de sus galpones, las chiqueras, cercar su cultivo ya que ha tenido problemas de terreno y robo comprar cerdos, gallinas, pollos.
Anímate a apoyar esta empresaria agrícola, una persona que con trabajo honesto y humilde sale adelante y superar sus adversidades.
texts.en:
This is Nurys, an agricultural entrepreneur, 58 years old, a warrior and fighter who maintains three professions - agriculture, raising chickens, and raising pigs. She is a very versatile woman who gives her body and soul to her profession. Her husband helps her and together they work for their family's progress.

This impressive and talented businesswoman needs a loan to improve the conditions of her chicken coops and her pig sties, to enclose her crops since she has had land problems and robbery, and to purchase pigs, hens and chicks.

Come on and support this agricultural entrepreneur, a person who with honest and humble work gets ahead and overcomes her adversities.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, hens, chicks, to enclose her crops and purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati, 35, hails from a small village and has a poor family background. She is married and has two daughters in her care. Bharati is visually impaired but has never lost her hope of succeeding in her life.

She owns a small betel shop where she sells betel, cold drinks, candies and snacks. Her husband works as a carpenter in the same village. Bharati's family is very poor and they do not have access to all the basic resources. Still, Bharati struggles very hard in order to fulfill the necessities of her two daughters.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 INR to increase the stock of her store and add more soft drinks, chips, biscuits and candies. The loan will enable her in getting more income and uplifting her livelihood.

Bharati is in dire need of your help. Your help can fulfill her wish.

She dreams of getting her daughters married in a very rich, reputed and well settled house.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her store and add more soft drinks, chips, biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Diba Luz

texts.es:
Diba es una mujer sonriente, amable, amorosa, ella es madre de un pequeño de 2 años de edad. Generalmente Diba se desempeña como madre cabeza de familia, pero a su vez ejerce su vida como independiente con un negocio de cría de pollos una actividad que ha traído felicidad as u vida y progreso a su familia, por ello desea continuar con la profesión, darle un impulso y producir  mayor ganancia, este préstamo ha cambiado la mentalidad de su familia, ahora sueñan con una mejor vida, con estudiar, tener hogar propio, proyectos que con paciencia pro con perseverancia esperan cumplir.

Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, alimento de engorde, vacunas, alimentos y aves.
texts.en:
Diba is a smiling, friendly, loving woman. She is the mother of a little one, 2 years old. Generally, Diba works as a female head of household, but she also runs her life as an independent person with a business raising chickens, work that has brought happiness to her life and progress to her family. So, she wants to continue with her profession, give it a boost and produce more earnings. This loan has changed the family's mentality. Now they dream of a better life, with education, having their own home, projects that with patience and with perseverance they hope to achieve.

She asks for a loan to purchase chickens, feed for fattening, vaccines, feed and poultry.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, fattening feed, vaccines, feed and poultry to stock up and maintain her production.

loans.name: Shukla

texts.en:
Shukla is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the small village of Jatrapur in Khagrabari, West Bengal. She is a careful mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She attended school up to grade 8, but she has a great determination to provide her children a good education. Thus she works hard to provide every support to her children.

Her husband is engaged in a paddy rice business. The money he earns is totally spent on the family's food expenses. So Shukla does “bidi” binding (cigarette rolling) to support her husband financially in managing the educational costs of her daughter.

Shukla's daughter, 21-year-old Esha, is studying in Thakur Panchanan Mahila Maha Vidyalaya in Khagrabari. She is a second-year student of B.A. (Bachelor in Arts) and doing her graduation in geography. She is serious about her studies and tries hard to score good marks in her coming examinations.

Shukla faces difficulties to cover the education expenses of her daughter after meeting the household costs with their joint income, yet she is striving to provide uninterrupted education to her daughter.

Hence, as a responsible mother, Shukla is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the educational expenses of her daughter. She plans to pay educational fees and buy study materials so that her daughter can give attention on her studies. The loan will help this bright young woman continue her education without any obstacles.

Shukla and Esha (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To cover her daughter's educational expenses.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Ser la única farmacia en el sector de Puerto Escondido es una gran reto que asume el señor Manuel con mucha responsabilidad, y es que su negocio ha ido en aumento ya que poco a poco la gente va dejando los remedios caseros y optan por una valoración médica donde le recomienda medicamentos para curar rápidamente su enfermedad. 
El principal reto de Manuel es tener siempre un abundante surtido de medicamentos, su principal problema es que debe traer su producto de una zona muy lejana,  asumir mayores gastos, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de medicamentos en general, su propósito es comprar al por mayor para reducir costos a largo plazo y seguir creciendo su negocio.
Su compromiso es atender  oportunamente cada eventualidad y tener siempre a la disposición del cliente medicamentos para tratar su enfermedad.
texts.en:
Having the only pharmacy in the area of Puerto Escondido is a great challenge, which Manuel takes on with great responsibility. This is why his business has been increasing little by little. People are dropping their home remedies and opt for a medical assessment, where he recommends drugs to quickly cure their illness.

Manuel's biggest challenge is to always have an abundant supply of medicine. His main problem is having to pick up the medicines in area far away, resulting in higher costs.

This is why he is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of general medication. His aim is to buy at wholesale to reduce the costs in the long run and continue to grow his business.

His commitment is to timely meet every eventuality and always have the medications to treat his clients' illness at disposal.

loans.use: to buy an assortment for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Yulis

texts.es:
Yulis es una empresaria de 33 años de edad, residente de la zona de Montería.
Ella con su trabajo trata de mostrar sus ganas de progresar, de que es una mujer capacitada para mantener su familia, que ella puede ser útil y se enorgullece de que su profesión sea el motivo por el cual están progresando en su hogar y no piensa detenerse. A pesar de que no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos, tiene amigos como Interactuar que junto con su aliado Kiva, pueden ayudarle a crecer y vender mucho más, es por este motivo que solicita un crédito para la compra de 100 aves y alimento de engorde. 
El incremento de producción en su negocio será muy significativo y le permitirá ubicarse como una fuerte competidora en la zona de Montería y lo que más la motiva es que traerá mucho más progreso y calidad de vida para sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Yulis is a 33-year-old business woman who lives in the zone of Montería.

She, with her work, tries to show her desire for progress, that she is a woman capable of supporting her family, that she can be useful and that she is proud that her profession is the reason for which she is progressing in her home and she doesn't think of stopping. Despite not having many economic resources, she has friends such as Interactuar who, with its ally Kiva, can help her to grow and sell a lot more so, for this reason, she asks for a loan to purchase 100 birds and feed for fattening.

The increase of production in her business will be significant and will allow her to place herself as a strong competitor in the zone of Montería and, motivating her more, it will bring a lot more progress and quality of life to her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase 100 birds and feed for fattening, she wants to continue bringing progress and happiness to her family.

loans.name: Tanushree

texts.en:
Tanushree lives in a small village of Khagrabari in the district Cooch Behar. She is 37 years old and a housewife. She is a courageous woman and a mother of two sons. Tanushree is determined to give her sons good education at any cost. They are reading in grades 6 and 12.

Tanushree's husband owns a small business of stationery goods. Due to insufficient business capital, he can't purchase stock in bulk, and as a result, his income is hardly sufficient to even afford their family expenses. Therefore, it has been very much difficult to meet the educational expenses of their sons.

Their elder son, Sangram, is a very meritorious student of grade 12 in Baneshwar Khapsa High School. He desires to continue his studies and wants to be a teacher in future. He is now very serious about his studies. He needs educational help and the guidance of private tutors to secure good marks in his forthcoming higher secondary Board Exam.

Thus his mother, Tanushree, has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase study materials like pens, pencils, books, notebooks, reference books and most important, to engage a private tutor who can guide Sangram properly so that he can continue his studies further with brilliant result.

Now Tanushree is very much relaxed about her son's education. Tanushree and her son Sangram (in the picture) give their hearty thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase educational materials and pay all educational fees for her elder son.

loans.name: Shibani

texts.en:
Shibani is a rural woman from Dhupguri. She is a very courageous woman. She is 40 years old and is striving to provide a good education to her children. She is a housewife who stays with her husband and children. They have three children (two sons and one daughter). All are students.

Shibani's son, 17-year-old Ratan, is a student of class 11 at Dhupguri High School. Ratan is an average student. He passed his last Board exam this year securing average marks. He wants to join in the coaching classes because he and his family know how important the higher secondary course is to building a career.

His father is engaged in a betel nuts business and his mother is a housewife. What his father earns mostly is spent on the household expenses. The income is insufficient to provide all the required educational materials.

Ratan wants to focus on his academic performance and achievement. So his mother, Shibani, wants to provide him with all necessary education articles and enroll him in a coaching center. This is why she is approaching BJS for an education loan.

With the help of the Kiva education loan, she will pay all educational fees of her son and buy textbooks, stationery, and other expenses for the year. She hopes that this will bring a sense of confidence to her son.

Shibani and her son, Ratan (in the photo), thank Kiva and BJS for the education loan support.

loans.use: to purchase educational equipment and pay all educational fees of her son.

loans.name: Leonardo Fabio

texts.es:
Sonreír es una regla inquebrantable del señor Leonardo, siempre ha dicho que hay que disfrutar de su profesión. 
Leonardo se dedica a la cría de cerdos, un trabajo que le permite generar ingresos para su familia conformada por su pareja y sus dos amados hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, ellos son su adoración, su alegría, han despertado esa pasión por el campo e incluso lo ayudan a cuidar los cerdos, ve en ellos un enorme potencial y quiere trabajar para que puedan explotarlo y fortalecerlo con estudio.
Ya que Leonardo quiere tener un negocio más rentable, con un buen volumen de clientes y prepararse para la temporada alta que es en el mes de diciembre, Solicita un préstamo para la compra de lechones y alimento de engorde, esperando tenerlos listos para dicho mes.
texts.en:
To smile is an unyielding gift of Leonardo, he has always said that one has to enjoy one's profession.

Leonardo works raising pigs, work that allows him to generate income for his family, made up of his partner and his two beloved children, ages 4 and 2. They, with their adoration and their happiness, have awakened this passion for the countryside and even help him take care of the pigs. He sees in them an enormous potential and wants to work so that they can take advantage of it and strengthen it with education.

Since Leonardo wants to have a more profitable business, with a good volume of customers and to prepare himself for the high season which is the month of December, he asks for a loan to purchase piglets and feed for fattening. He hopes to have them ready for that month.

loans.use: to prepare himself for the high season, he needs to purchase piglets and feed for fattening.

loans.name: Billy Jhon

texts.es: Billy es un joven emprendedor de la ciudad de Barranquilla que por recomendación de un amigo hace cuatro años incursionó en el negocio de las comidas rápidas con muy buenos resultados; su amigo le comentó que el negocio  generaba una buena rentabilidad, así que en compañía de su cónyuge invirtió todos sus ahorros en la adquisición de los equipos básicos y capitalizando las utilidades han logrado adecuar el local donde ofrece a vecinos y transeúntes del sector donde reside, hamburguesas, hot dogs, pinchos y todo tipo de comidas rápidas. Su horario laboral es de 4:00 a 12:00 P.M. y está convencido que el negocio de los alimentos puede proporcionarle a cualquiera un ingreso mensual atractivo y seguro. Por lo cual ya está proyectando la apertura de un nuevo punto de venta el cual planea financiar con los recursos de su primer credikiva que está tramitando con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y se abastecerá de materias primas y adecuaciones al nuevo local. Billy tiene como visión para el futuro el ser propietario de una cadena de restaurantes que le generen los ingresos suficientes para brindar una educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en: Billy is a young entrepreneur from the city of Barranquilla who, from the recommendation of a friend four years ago, entered into a fast food business with very good results. His friend commented to him that the business generated a good profitability so, accompanied by his spouse, he invested all his savings in getting the basic equipment and capitalizing the profits they have managed to outfit the space where they sell, to neighbors and passers-by in the are where he lives, hamburgers, hot dogs, snacks and all sorts of fast food. His work schedule is from 4:00 to 12:00 pm and he is convinced that the food business can give anyone an attractive and secure monthly income. For this, he is planning to open a new sales location which he plans to finance with the resources from his first Kiva loan that he is filing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will stock up on raw materials and outfitting the new space. Billy has as his vision for the future to be the owner of a chain of restaurants that will generate sufficient income to offer a quality education to his children.

loans.use: to stock up on raw materials and make adjustments to the new space.

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Albeiro es un cultivador de flores que está dando sus primeros pasos como independiente y necesita de tu apoyo para mantener un negocio que requiere de tantos gastos y cuidados y calidad como lo es  el cultivo de flores que por lo general son material de exportación.
Albeiro es padre de dos hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad, su propósito es mantener su profesión y a partir de esta crear progreso para su familia y empleados.
Como anteriormente se había mencionado Albeiro está en proceso de construcción de su negocio, por ello solicita un apoyo económico para la adecuación de un cuarto de post-cosecha, cerrar su cultivo en plástico, adecuación de un baño para realizar la limpieza de las flores.
texts.en:
Albeiro is a flower grower who is taking his first steps as an independent businessman and needs your support to maintain a business that needs a lot of expenses and care and quality such as flower growing which, in general, are exported materials.

Albeiro is the father of two children, ages 12 and 18. His goal is to maintain his profession and after that, make progress for his family and employees.

As previously mentioned, Alberio is in the process of building his business. For this, he asks for a loan to outfit a post-harvest room, enclose his crops in plastic, and outfit a bath to clean the flowers.

loans.use: to outfit a post-harvest room, enclose his crops in plastics, and outfit a bath to clean flowers.

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
Pinki is a married woman of 25 years. She lives with her husband and three children (two daughters and one son) in a small village, Kalirhat, in the district of Jalpaiguri. Pinki's husband is engaged in cultivation. Both Pinki and her husband could not complete their secondary education, so they try their hardest to provide education to their children. Pinki's elder daughter, Sumitra, reads in class 8 at Kalirhat D.C. High School. Her other two children are also studying.

Pinki's husband's meager income is the main hindrance in the education of her children. Her daughter Sumitra was promoted to grade 8 securing average grades. Her parents plan to provide better educational help to her so as to enable her to progress in her study. With an aim to be a teacher in the future, Sumitra wants to score good marks in her examination. But their household income is not sufficient to meet all her educational expenses.

Pinki heard that BJS (Kiva's partner) gives education loans to students so that they can keep on with their studies. So she has taken a loan for her daughter from them. She plans to use the total loan amount for paying coaching and school fees and purchasing necessary educational materials for her daughter.

Pinki and her daughter Sumitra (in the photo) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's educational costs.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
The previous loan of 800,000 helped Bashir to buy farm inputs like manure and seedlings, and he has made more profits from his farm. Bashir has continued with his crop production business and with that he has been able to look after his six children.

He is requesting a loan to pay laborers and to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

Although he has continued to face a challenge of price fluctuations, pests and diseases, he still has hope that someday he will a model farmer in his village.

loans.use: to pay laborers and to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Regina; she is 42 years old and married, with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 and has been trained on enterprise and financial management. She does dairy goat rearing as her main economic activity.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more goats and repair the goat shed. This will increase her milk produce, which will earn her income to provide food for her family and pay school fees for her child.

She thanks Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more dairy goats and repair the goat shed. This will ensure increased income thus enabling her to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats for trading.

loans.name: Ukulima Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising their hand in the photo is Alice. She is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She is a member of Ukulima Women Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. They have undergone enterprise management training.

Alice does crop and poultry farming, a business she has been doing for the past year.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more chicks and chicken feed so that she can increase her egg and chicken sales, hence boosting her income. She plans to use profits generated from sale of her produce to cater to her family's basic needs, save money for future use and re-invest to expand her business.

She is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make payment promptly.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed so that she can increase her egg and chicken sales, hence boosting her income.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita, 45 years old, is the mother of three children (two daughters and one son). All are students. She lives in a small village Konamalli of Khagrabari, West Bengal. In spite of having only primary education, she is highly interested to provide her children a good education.

Sabita is a housewife as well as engaged in a small home-based business of “bidi” binding (cigarette rolling). Her husband is a farmer.

Her son, Samir, is a student of grade 11 in Rajarhat Bidya Bhaban High School. He is 16 years old. Due to low family income, his parents are facing difficulties bearing his educational expenses. Samir is sincere about his studies and school curriculum. As Sabita has been unable to take care of all the educational materials he needs to continue his studies, she applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan to buy education materials and pay the educational fees for her son, Samir. Sabita hopes this educational support will give a boost to her son’s education.

So Sabita and Samir (as seen in the picture) are now very thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase study materials and pay educational fees of her son.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
The member that appears in the photo is called Flora. She is 39 years old, married and has four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in 2015 to be trained on saving and enterprise development. She does dairy and cereal farming and sells second hand shoes. Her main purpose for applying for this Kiva loan is to buy more stock for her shoe selling business. She believes this loan will improve her business sales and the income will enable her meet her family's basic requirements e.g. food and clothing.

Flora is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second hand shoes for her business so she can meet the cost of basic needs like food and clothing.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer who raises livestock and cultivates sorghum. He also sells porridge as a side business. Charles lives in Kamwenge and is very hardworking. His business challenges include price fluctuations and prolonged droughts that lead to a low market value for his products.

Charles is requesting a loan to buy seedlings and hire labor for his farm. He used a previous loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his gardens. Charles plans to educate his children and also re-invest his profits into his business. In the future, he hopes to improve his living standards and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and hire labor

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a very hardworking married lady charged with the responsibility of taking care of 3 children of ages ranging from 2 to 18 years. She deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize and rice supplemented by an income from operating a drug shop. She desires to develop and expand her business so as to raise her income to support her family. She will use the loan to buy more rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Ukulima Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margaret; she is fifty eight years old, married and blessed with seven children. She is a member of Ukulima women group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has undergone enterprise management training. Margaret does maize, beans, potatoes and dairy farming. This business has been running for the last fifteen years.

Margaret has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer for top dressing and animal feed so that she can increase her farm's production. She plans to use the profits generated by her businesses to cater to her family'a basic needs, save money for future use and reinvest and expand her business.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to make prompt payments.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing and animal feed so that she can increase her farm's production.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Con su gran manera de trabajar, su amor por sus padres, su convicción de salir adelante y la fe que tiene en sus sueños, Jonatan ha tenido la fortaleza para trabajar en su finca con la cría de cerdos.

Esta es una actividad que le ha dado muchas oportunidades y que le ha permitido poder tener un sustento.

Hoy en día necesita aumentar su capacidad y capital de trabajo, por eso, con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lechones de cria y de engorde y es por eso que busca ayuda en los prestadores de kiva y en el apoyo de Interactuar.
texts.en:
With a great deal of hard work, his love for his parents, his commitment to get ahead, and the faith that he has in his dreams, Jonathan has had the strength to work on his pig farm.

This is a trade that has given him many opportunities and has allowed him to be able to earn a living.

Currently, he needs to increase his capacity and working capital. For this reason, with the support of a loan he will be able to  purchase pigs to raise and that is why he is looking for help from Kiva lenders and the support of Interactuar.

loans.use: to parchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Jenifer. She is fifty four years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in September 2014.

Jenifer does maize and bean farming, and she also rears sheep. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise better and more profitably than before. She is taking out a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and animal feed. This will increase her farm production and meet the demand for cereals. The enterprise will earn her more income hence go a long way in supporting her family's basic needs and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and animal feed. This will increase her farm production.

loans.name: Kithuluni Farmers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in this photo is Nzisa. She is 39 years old and married with five children. She works selling clothes in the nearby market. Nzisa joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 with the aim of learning more about financial savings, enterprise, and financial management. 

Nzisa is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more clothes to boost her stock and increase her income. She will use the profit from her loan to pay school fees without difficulties. Nzisa promises to repay her loan well.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 29 years old, married, and blessed with one child who is in primary school.  She works as a tailor and also is employed in a shoe factory. Veronica joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially those in enterprise development.

Veronica is requesting a Kiva loan to buy tailoring materials to meet customer demands. Her loan will enable her earn more income and be able to pay her child’s tuition fees. Veronica is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Sin’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sin makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because of Kepler’s reputation as a place for students to become critical, creative thinkers—while also providing the financial support that is often unavailable to students like Immaculee.

The first in his family to attend college, Immaculee plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and she will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, her dream is to start her own business someday and help lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en:
Sabha is a 31 years old who has been married for nine years and almost lost the hope of having children. To avoid thinking of it, Sabha insisted on starting a small home business selling blankets, clothes, toys, accessories, birthday decoration items, etc. Having this business helped in filling her time. It also helped in improving their living conditions by adding another source of income to the family.

Sabha is now applying for a loan to increase the quantity of clothes she is selling to prepare for the upcoming Adha holiday season.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes she is selling to prepare for the upcoming Adha holiday season.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is from Quezon City, Philippines and is the mother of six. She’s a long time member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Araneta branch. 

Mina is engaged in different types of businesses. One is an internet shop with four computer units. Basically, every unit is like a vending machine where the user will drop a P 1.00 coin for it to operate. This is known as “piso net” in the Philippines where P 1.00 is equivalent to 5 minutes usage of the computer. She also sells Virgin coconut oil and owns a four-unit apartment that she rents out. She earns P 12,000 from the computer shop, P 7,000 for selling Virgin coconut oil and P 8,000 from the apartment rental each month.

Her total monthly earnings are just enough to sustain the family's monthly expenses. She’s thinking of strategies on how to earn more profit each month for her to buy necessities for the business.  She wants to buy another computer, more stock of virgin coconut oil, and renovate her apartment. 

However, without more capital she will need to wait for years to make those happen. That’s why she has applied for a P 30,000 loan to buy the necessary things. She is hoping that God will touch the hearts of people who will read her story.

Mina believes that if you want success, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony. She also shares her own experience of God’s love. During this weekly fellowship, members pay their Micro Finance loans after hearing the message of God’s words.

loans.use: to buy another computer, more stock of virgin coconut oil, and to renovate her apartment.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita and she's a sari-sari (variety) store owner in Oton, Iloilo. She's been running her store business for 11 years already. Different circumstances tested her faith as she manages her business that long. Some of her neighbors pay after several weeks, but Nenita remains strong and she focuses on her goal to acquire a water buffalo or carabao as an alternative source of income. She can rent it out to her farmer friends in their community.

Nenita is a 66-year-old widow with grown children. She is supporting herself because she doesn’t want to depend on her children, who are raising their own families. It’s her desire to extend financial help to her grandchildren as often as possible. This is why she aspires to improve her business further. She applied for PHP 50,000 loan to buy more dry goods and beverages for her store. She will set aside part of the loan as seed money that she can use to acquire a water buffalo.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods and beverages

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Vuthy is aged 53 years old and a father of three dependent children, one of whom is in school. Growing cassava and work on his co-villager’s farm for fee are the main sources of his family’s income for six years.

Due to having not enough working capital to support his current business, he is now leading a group of two to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Vuthy and his group member will apply for the loan amount 1,400,000KHR for each and this is the first loan for them. As a group leader, he is going to use his entire loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to increase productivity of his crop yields. He hopes to earn more income to improve his family’s living condition and able to keep sending his child to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to increase productivity of his crop yields.

loans.name: Nebigname Bea

texts.fr: Bea est une jeune femme mariée âgée de 28 ans résidant à Agoè. Avec deux enfants à charge, Bea achète des mèches et  robes quatre fois par mois au marché et les revendent à la devanture de sa boutique. Bea demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat de robes de nuit et gagner plus de bénéfices pour venir en aide aux diverses charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Bea is a 28-year old married woman who lives in Agoe. She has two dependent children. Bea stocks up on hair extensions and clothing at the market four times a months and put them up for sale  at the entrance of her shop. Bea is requesting this loan to buy night shirts and increase her revenues in order to cover various household needs.

loans.use: to buy two dozens of night shirts for resale.

loans.name: Pembe

texts.en:
In the photograph is Pembe and her husband, Agim who are parents of three children. They have just turned 60, however, as they stated, they both don't feel very well. " Here and there, for some reasons, we always manage to have some health problems,but thank God, VisionFund Albania has been there for us all these past almost ten years. And this is a blessing to us," said Pembe to the loan officer who visited her at the home.

Pembe, was born with some disability and so was Agim and the loan that they are requesting from you will be used for their medical expenses. Their income is as follows: disability income of Pembe in the amount of $231/monthly and $112/monthly of Agim and some $200/monthly cash he makes from working in a bakery.

loans.use: to pay for the clinic and other medical expenses for herself and also her husband

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24 years-old-single man, the sole breadwinner to another member of his family. Eight years ago Mohammad started working as a car electrician to support his family, since he was the only one who can do handle this responsibility.

Mohammad updated his skills through enrolling in a vocational school where he took the necessary techniques to up his skills. Since May 2014, Mohammad establish his own car electronic repairs shop, and he is working hard to stay capable of developing it.

This business development, requests a good capital, thus for this reason Mohammad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to update his business tools with newly released electronic devices necessary for his business development.
He hopes that in the future he can open a larger place to increase and diversify his provided services.

loans.use: to update his business tools with newly released electronic devices necessary for his business development

loans.name: Paruyr

texts.en:
Paruyr is so happy and greatly pleased of his first Kiva partnership thanks to which he managed to enlarge his farm with more cattle and also receive more profit for his large family.

Paruyr lives in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region, with his wife, three children and his retired mother. After many years of abroad work Paruyr established his farm and now he never leaves his native village and cute farm which is the only source of income for the family. On his farm he has cows, calves and heifers. He manages to sell a lot of milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curd and also meat. Simultaneously with his farming he also sells his orchard’s fruits (apple, apricot, plum, pear, peach and grapes) at the city’s wholesale market.

This time Paruyr needs this Kiva loan as he his farm cattle has great lack of fodder and he will able to buy a lot of fodder for it.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Dúo Alejandra De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Alejandra de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Miriam Alejandra quien se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace dos años, es vendedora ambulante, casada y tiene 22 años.  Le han hecho pedido de varias  blusas de tela típico en diferentes colores y tamaños, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza para comprar lo que le hace falta.  Por esa razón ella pide otro préstamo para comprar blusas y asi no quedarles mal a sus clientes y tener mucha venta.
texts.en:
Dúo Alejandra de Vista Hermosa

Miriam Alejandra is in charge of this group. She has been selling typical clothes in an itinerant manner for two years. She is 22 years old and married.

People have ordered various blouses made from typical fabric in different colors and sizes. However, she does not have enough money to buy what she needs. That is the reason that she is requesting another loan to buy blouses. This way she will not disappoint her customers, and she will have a lot of sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Ni el alto costo de los insumos, ni la competencia que se vive en sector porcicola, hacen que Luz se rinda en el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

Luz es una madre de una hija que trabaja fuertemente en beneficio de ella, pudiendo así darle el sustento y educación que necesita sin descuidar en ningún momento el amor y el cuidado que una madre puede ofrecer.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la adecuación de sus cocheras en la alberga cierta cantidad de cerdos para la venta, ya que es este su único medio de trabajo y supervivencia.

Con este crédito podrá sacar adelante a su familia y su actividad.
texts.en:
Neither the cost of supplies or the competition she experiences in the pork industry make Luz give up in her search to fulfill her dreams and goals. Luz has one daughter, and she works very hard for her sake. She does this so that she can support her and give her the education she needs. At all times she gives her daughter the love and care that a mother can provide.

Luz is requesting a loan to buy materials to improve the pig pens where she keeps the pigs she sells. This is her only means of work and surviving. With this loan she will be able to get her family and her business activity ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the pig pens where she keeps the pigs that she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add stock of soap, sugar, bread and other items to sell.

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en:
Qamar is 46 years old, married woman and a mother of 3 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Mwigulu

texts.en:
Mwigulu who is in her early 50s is married with one child who is still in school. She has been selling natural medicines, clothes and cosmetics for seven years now. She works from 08am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwigulu’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep to increase the natural medicines stock, cosmetics and clothes and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, reinvest in business and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase stock on cosmetics, to buy up to date clothes and to buy more natural medicines. She dreams of expanding her business.

Mwigulu will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics, to buy up to date clothes and to buy more natural medicines.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 31 and charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children of ages ranging from 2 to 8 years; only two attend school in Hoima, Uganda.

He deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of beans, maize and rice. He gets additional income from earning a salary as a government worker.

He is faced with a difficulty of bad weather changes which has seen him not living up to his desires.

He is seeking a loan to buy more maize to sell ahead of the peak season.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Martin Yeral

texts.es: Martin es un pequeño agricultor que poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante junto al apoyo de su familia y los créditos obtenidos a través de KIVA y MiCrédito. Con los créditos otorgados ha logrado mejorar los cercos de su potrero y ha comprado una ternera. En esta temporada se acerca la siembra de maíz de postrera y por esta razón solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar alambre para reparar las cercas donde realizara la siembra del maíz y también comprara dos cerdos para engordarlos, con estas nuevas adquisiciones podrá obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Martin is a small farmer who, little by little, has managed to get ahead with the support of his family and the loans from Kiva and MiCrédito. With the loans that were granted he has managed to improve the fences of his pasture, and he has purchased a calf.

The rainy season for planting corn is approaching. For this reason he is requesting a new loan to buy wire to repair the fences where he grows corn. He will also buy two pigs to fatten. With these new acquisitions he will be able to get better earnings.

loans.use: to buy wire to repair the fences where he grows corn and to buy two pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Dúo Margaritas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Margaritas de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Lidia Verónica quien se dedica a la venta de joyería en  oro y plata como cadenas, anillos, argollas, desde hace 25 años.  Vive al lado de su hija quien le ayuda a vender en su colonia, y es muy conocida porque su mercadería es de buena calidad.  La fecha de graduaciones se acerca y tiene varios pedidos de anillos de graduación, ella necesita otro préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus compradoras y dar buenos precios, pero no tiene el dinero suficiente para comprar.  Pide otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta en joyas y poder venderles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dúo Margaritas de Vista Hermosa

The leader of this group is Ms. Lidia Verónica, who has been making a living selling gold and silver jewelry—such as chain necklaces, rings, and hoop earings—for the last 25 years.
