She lives next door to her daughter, who helps her sell through the neighborhood. Lidia is well-known for her high-quality merchandise. Graduation season is approaching and thus she has several orders for graduation rings. She needs another loan to satisfy her clients and be able to offer good prices, since she does not have enough money to purchase merchandise. Lidia is requesting another loan to purchase the jewelry she needs and be able to sell it to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry for re-sale.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Erneidy Andres

texts.es:
Erneidy tiene 21 años y es soltero. Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a las labores del campo, pues ha sido una tradición familiar y sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que hoy sabe. 

Actualmente posee cultivos en la finca donde reside, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo, de esta manera ha obtenido los ingresos para apoyar al sustento a su familia. 

El cliente es un joven pujante, trabajador y cada día lucha con esmero para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente los que afectan sus cultivos, como por ejemplo el clima cambiante y los altos costos de los insumos que requiere para cuidar sus siembras, sin embargo ha sabido salir adelante y seguir progresando. 

Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y semillas de café con lo que podrá seguir cuidando sus tierras y para que la cosecha sea más productiva, así aumentará sus ingresos y podrá brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Erneidy is 21 years old and single. He has worked on a farm since he was very young, since it is the family tradition and his parents taught him everything that he knows today.

Currently he has planted crops on the plantation where he lives. The harvest is collected and sold at the town market. This allows him to bring in income to support and sustain his family.

Erneidy is a young, vigorous worker and he fights hard every day. He takes great pains to overcome the obstacles presented to him, especially those that affect his crops, such as climate change and the high cost of the supplies that he needs to care for his plants. He has figured out how to continue to move forwards and progress despite these obstacles.

He is currently applying for a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, pesticides, fertilizer, and coffee seeds. These will allow him to continue taking care of his land and so that his harvest will be more productive and he can augment his income and be able to provide his family with a better quality life and a more stable economic situation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, pesticides, fertilizer, and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, de 49 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, está casada, su pareja se dedica a apoyarle en los trabajos que realiza ella, tienen 3 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad y no viven con ella. 

Concepción, se dedica a comprar cerdos, para cuidarlos y luego destazarlos, también vende pasteles de carne, tamales y empanadas; tiene 20 años de dedicarse a estas actividades, por lo que tiene muchísima experiencia y muchos clientes que le hacen pedidos.- Todo esto lo aprendió de su madre, su horario para vender es de 5:00 a.m. a 9:00 a.m. todos los días.   

El préstamo será invertido para comprar tres cerdos para engordarlos y luego vender la carne, con este préstamo ella podrá continuar con su negocio y podrá generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Los sueños de Concepción son, continuar con su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción is 49 years old and she didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She is married and her partner is dedicated to supporting her in her work. They have 3 adult children who don't live with her.

Concepción makes a living buying pigs to raise them and butcher later. She also sells meat pies, tamales and empanadas. She has been doing this business for 20 years, so she has a great amount of experience and many customers who place orders with her. She learned everything about running this business from her mother. She sells her goods from 5:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. every day.

The loan will go towards buying three pigs to fatten and later sell the meat. This loan will allow her to continue forwards with her business and be able to generate income to cover the household expenses.

Concepción's dreams are to continue her business and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to fatten and later sell their meat.

loans.name: Amitié

texts.en:
Amitie is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because she thinks it will provide the highest quality education opportunity.

Amitie plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and she will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She hopes to focus on work at the intersection of business and design, and would like to work in marketing after graduating. She is also interested in how logos communicate to potential customers of a business.  

A patient, hard worker, Amitie wants to be successful enough in life to lift up others, as many in her life have done for her.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Mehta S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kenneth. He is the Director of Studies of Mehta S. School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Lugazi with 600 students. Mehta S. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mehta S. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kenneth ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en:
Jharna, a 33-year-old woman, hails from Khagrabari. She is a rural housewife living with her family of three: her husband and two sons. One of her sons is a student of grade 11 in Cooch Behar Rambhola High School. The other son is too small for going to school.

Jharna's husband runs a sweetmeat shop in their locality and sells Indian sweets made of cottage cheese. Jharna tries to help him after finishing her household jobs, but the income from this business is uncertain and is only enough to meet the daily needs of the four members of his family, so it is becoming difficult for them to finance their elder son’s education.

Jharna's elder son, 16-year-old Amit, is a good student. He wants to complete his higher secondary level education but dislikes burdening his parents with the cost of his education. He will appear for his Board Examination, so he needs private tutors and other educational help. But due to lack of money, his family is not in a position to continue to support his studies. It is for this reason that his mother, Jharna, is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for Amit's educational expenditures.

She will use the loan amount to provide her son with necessary educational articles and pay education-related fees, etc., so that he can continue his uninterrupted education.

Jharna and Amit (in the photograph) are grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear all the education-related costs of her son.

loans.name: Upendo Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year- old lady and a member of Upendo Tumaini Group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She is involved in selling vegetables and also tailoring. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more vegetables hence add stock to her business. This will enable her to increase sales and income and also meet customer’s demands. With increased income, she will be able to pay for her house rent.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell for increased income to pay for her family's house rent.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 46-year-old widow woman with three children. She runs a business of milk selling along with her son. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her son sells the milk in nearby areas.  Robina ’s job is to look after the buffalo and collect the milk from them. Both are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Robina has requested for 45000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, thus providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, thus providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 54-year-old married woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to ell to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to sell to more customers.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up on a farm in a rural area of eastern Rwanda. Because of his impressive academic credentials, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. James chose to attend Kepler because he wants an internationally competitive degree while staying in Rwanda.
 
James will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. An effective communicator, James hopes to start an agricultural business that will manufacture and deliver food products across East Africa.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Dúo Guadalupe De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Guadalupe de San Pedro La señora Guadalupe es la encargada de este grupo y es vendedora ambulante de joyería en oro y plata desde hace 2 años.  Tiene varios pedidos de aretes, anillos y argollas de sus clientes, pero no tiene mucho que ofrecer a sus clientes.  Por eso ella necesita un préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta y no quedarles mal a sus clientes que han sido sus compradores desde hace muchos años.  Pide otro préstamo esperando su ayuda y apoyo.
texts.en:
Dúo Guadalupe de San Pedro

Guadalupe is in charge of this group. She has been selling gold and silver jewelry in an itinerant manner for two years. She has various orders for earrings, rings, and wedding rings from her customers. However, she does not have much to offer her customers.

That is why she needs a loan to buy what she needs and to not disappoint her customers. They have been buying from her for many years. She is requesting another loan, hoping for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 54-year-old woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Zareena expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Joser Aldenis

texts.es:
Joser, de 21 años, inicio con un negocio de reparación de electrodomésticos hace aproximadamente 3 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus padres y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para continuar con su servicio y compra de electrodomésticos de segunda mano para revenderlos o sacarle piezas para arreglar otros equipos.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y podrá llegar a cumplir su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Joser is 21 years old. He established his business—an electric appliance repair service—three years ago, in the search for a pursuit that would generate enough income to live from. Currently he is motivated to work incessantly by his parents, as he would like to provide for them in the best way he can. Joser is requesting a loan to purchase repair parts to continue offering his service and to purchase second-hand electric appliances for re-sale or to use their parts to repair other appliances. He will be able to sustain his business and fulfill his dream of improving the condition of his house.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts in order to continue offering his service and to purchase second-hand electric appliances for re-sale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 35 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, rears them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40000 to purchase more animals to strengthen her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to strengthen her sales.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is 42 years old, a married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Tasleem makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Tasleem wishes to utilize part of her revenues for providing a good quality of life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers

loans.name: Susislia

texts.en:
Susislia is 40 years old, a married woman. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces to meet the orders on time.

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Susislia hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces to meet orders on time.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 61 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. She practices dairy, tea and potato farming.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy building materials to construct a cow shed. She also plans to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production, hence creating more income to cater for the family's daily expenses.

Tabitha is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials for a cow shed and buy an additional cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Dina, one of Ruma's agents. Dina lives in North Bogor, located about a one hour and thirty minute drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her daughter.

Dina owns a stall where she sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services for her community. She wanted to join Ruma because as a woman, she wants to help her husband improve their lives and learn about how to manage a business opportunity, as well as give more contribution to her community.

As the business grows, Dina is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends.

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Dina improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Dina is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking, married lady with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a business of growing bananas and tomatoes to sell. Alongside that, she has another income of earning a salary.

She has hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. Jeniffer needs a loan to help her pay school fees for her children this third term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Una salsamentaría es lo que mantiene viva la ilusión de Antonio, ya que su sueño es salir adelante, mejorar su situación económica y sostener a su familia, pues considera que lo más importante en la vida es el trabajo duro y la perseverancia.
Trabaja incansablemente todos durante 12 horas para generar su propio sustento. 

El nunca pensó en que podía crecer y ahora que interactuar le da la oportunidad de prestarle dinero, quiere aprovechar para realizar la compra de un tanque de agua, realizar adecuaciones locativas, construir una zona de asadero de carne y comprar insumos para su negocio.
texts.en: A deli is what keeps Antonio's hope alive. His dream is to get ahead, improve his finances, and support his family. For him, the most important things in life are hard work and perseverance. Antonio works tirelessly for 12 hours every day in order to earn his own livelihood. He never thought that he would be able to grow his business. Now that Interactuar is giving him the opportunity to take out a loan, he would like  to purchase a water tank, perform on-site adjustments, build a meat roasting area, and purchase supplies for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank, perform on-site adjustments, build a meat roasting area, and purchase supplies for his business.

loans.name: Bhabani

texts.en:
Bhabani is a 26-year-old married woman from Kandi. She studied up to grade 8 and, being a housewife, is doing all her household chores. She is married to Dhananjay, who is engaged with farming. His income is inconsistent. This couple is blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter reads in grade 7, and her son is in grade 2.

To give financial support to her family, Bhabani now wants to start her own milk-selling business. She plans to sells cow milk to her neighbors. She wants to buy one cow. The cow will grow her asset base and increase her income through milk production. It will also help in getting cow dung, which she can sell as fertilizer to the farmers.

With the aim to start this business, Bhabani seeks to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a dairy cow. With the starting of the business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Bhabani wants to strengthen the family economy and dreams to build a concrete house for her family’s well-being.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk-selling business.

loans.name: Ubaney

texts.es:
Ubaney, a sus 26 años de edad es casado y padre de una hija. 
Nació y creció en el campo, donde su familia le enseñó todas las labores agrícolas y, gracias a ello hoy en día posee cultivos de papa, ubicados en unos terrenos de su familia, los productos que cosecha los vende en el mercado, convirtiéndose esta en su principal fuente de ingresos, lo que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia. 

El cliente es un hombre activo, pujante, emprendedor y diariamente lucha para velar por el bienestar de sus hija y su esposa, pues ellos son su principal motivación para seguir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos, pues esta actividad es muy inestable e incierta. 

Esto lo lleva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (semillas de papa, abonos, riegos, fertilizantes), que son necesarios para poder sacar la cosecha actual, preparar el terreno para sembrar nuevamente y así continuar con su labor. 

Ubaney sueña con hacer crecer sus cultivos y hacer de su actividad un negocio más rentable, con el que pueda ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor.
texts.en:
Ubaney is 26 years old and married. He has one daughter.

He was born and raised in the country, where his family taught him about all kinds of agricultural work. Thanks to their teachings, today he plants potatoes on some of his family's land. He sells the harvest at the market, converting it into his principal source of income that allows him to bring daily sustenance to his family.

Ubaney is an active man and a powerful entrepreneur who fights every day to ensure the wellbeing of his daughter and his wife, since they are his main motivation to continue forwards, overcoming various obstacles because his business is very unstable and uncertain.

These obstacles have caused him to request the support of a loan that he will use to buy agricultural inputs (potato seeds, manure, irrigation, and fertilizer) that are necessary to be able to harvest his current crops and prepare the land to plant again and therefore continue with his work.

Ubaney's dreams are to grow his crops and make his business more profitable so that he will be able to offer his family better living conditions and enjoy the fruits of his hard labor.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (potato seeds, manure, irrigation, and fertilizer).

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Anjana is a rural housewife She is married to Amal. They are blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter). Anjana is illiterate but knows how to sign her name.

They live in the small village of Khagrabari in the district Cooch Behar. Anjana is very much concerned about her children's education. Her two sons are students of grade 11 and grade 7, and her only daughter reads in grade 10.

Anjana's husband is associated with a centering business, making the fundamental structure of houses in his rural area, but his income is hardly sufficient to cover the household expenses. Whatever he earns is spent on family expenses, so he finds it difficult to cover the cost of their children's education. To supplement his income, Anjana does agricultural activities to bear her children's educational costs.

Anjana always tries to promote the well-being of her children and their education. Her elder son Anup is in grade 11 in Rajarhat Bidya Bhaban High School. He is not only meritorious but studious, too. But he needs guidance in his studies. So his mother, Anjana, is accessing this loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to pay her son's educational fees and purchase textbooks and stationery for her son.

She and her son (in the picture) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay her elder son's educational costs.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelina is 45 years old and has five children who are in school.

Adelina has a buy and sell coconut business in the Philippines. Adelina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconut and other supplies to use in her business.

Adelina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Adelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Leonora is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and married with ten children. With three children in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is 49 years old and he lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. He is divorced and now lives alone. Sasun has higher military education and started from 1994 till today he works at the school as a teacher of military skills and education. He mentions that he finds this subject in the schools very much as the boys, our future soldiers and defenders of our motherland, from a very young age, must realize and learn all the skills and theory connected with military service.

So this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Sasun asks as he wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature to make his lessons more informative and interesting for his pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, with accessories and also professional literature to make his lessons in Military Skills and Education more informative and interesting.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. He was raised by his mother in a village outside Kigali. Because of his exceptional academic record and dedication, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Joseph chose Kepler because it offers exposure to international courses and a rigorous academic curriculum.

An outstanding student, Joseph plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to manage a hospital or international health organization.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a married woman with one child who attends school. For the past three years, she has run a beauty salon. Fridah’s potential customers are her neighbors and people in the marketplace. She lives in a rental house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. Fridah decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

Fridah is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon. She dreams of earning more income and expanding her hairdressing skills in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin es un campesino de 48 años de edad, casado y padre de 2 hijos. 

Nació en el seno de una familia campesina muy humilde y desde pequeño conoció todas las labores del campo, pues es una tradición familiar; hace algún tiempo trabajó como empleado en una finca lechera y luego pasó a ser mayordomo de otra finca de la región, allí aplica todos sus conocimientos en las labores agrícolas; adicionalmente trabaja como independiente, pues posee cerdos de levante ubicado en su finca; allí cuida y engorda los animales para luego venderlos y así complementar su salario para llevar el sustento a su familia. 

El cliente es un hombre pujante, activo y luchador, su perseverancia le ha permitido conseguir nuevas alternativas para salir adelante, es por ello que se motiva a solicitar un crédito; el dinero será destinado para la compra de más cerdos de levante y materiales para adecuación de sus cocheras; esto le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y aumentar su producción. 

Benjamin sueña con fortalecer y ampliar su negocio, generando nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida para disfrutar al lado de su esposa e hijos de un mejor bienestar.
texts.en: Benjamin is a 48-year-old farmer. He is married and the father of two children. Benjamin was born to a very modest farming family and since he has been familiar with farm work since he was little, as farming is a family tradition. Some time ago he was employed by a dairy farm. Later, he became the administrator of another farm in the region, where he applies all his farming knowledge. He also works independently, as he has pigs for fattening on a farm of his own. There, he cares for and fattens the animals, which he later sells to supplement his salary and support his family. Benjamin is a strong man—an active man and a fighter—and his perseverance has enabled him to achieve new ways to forge ahead. This is why he is requesting a loan. The money will be used  to purchase more pigs for fattening  and materials for customizing his barns. This will enable him to increase his working capital and improve production. Benjamin dreams with improving and expanding his business to generate new employment opportunities and improve his quality of life and wellbeing together with his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for fattening  and materials for customizing his barns.

loans.name: Tulio Cesar

texts.es:
Tulio nació y creció en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia, que toda la vida se dedicó a las tareas del campo. 

Hoy en día posee unas hectáreas de tierra de su propiedad y en de ellas posee cultivos de flores, cuya cosecha es recolectada y vendida en el mercado del municipio donde reside. 

El cliente es un señor activo, pujante y trabajador, diariamente se levanta temprano para comenzar con el cuidado de sus cultivos que son su principal fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos y necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

Se motiva para solicitar el crédito, con la intención de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, riegos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, entre otros para preparar el terreno que tiene disponible y sembrar más cultivos, con esto le dará continuidad a su negocio aumentando su producción, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos. 

De esta manera, Tulio se permite soñar con tener muchos más cultivos y ser un gran comerciante de sus productos, para poder tener mejores condiciones de vida y brindar una estabilidad económica y calidad de vida a todo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Tulio was born and raised in the country, where he learned how to do agricultural work thanks to the teachings of his family who worked on a farm their entire lives.

Today, he owns a few hectares of land and grows flowers on them. He collects the harvest and sells it at the municipal market in the town where he lives.

Tulio is an active man and a vigorous worker who gets up early every day to care for his crops, which are his principal source of income and allow him to cover the expenses and basic necessities of his home.

He wants to take out a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, irrigation, fertilizer, and pesticides, among other things, to prepare the available land and plant more crops. This will give continuity to his business and increase his production, which will lead to an increase in his income.

In this way, Tulio will allow himself to dream of planting many more crops and being a great salesman so that he can have better living conditions and provide economic stability and quality of life to all of his nuclear family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, irrigation, fertilizer, and pesticides, among other things.

loans.name: Wega Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in this photo is Hannah. She is 70 years old and a widow with one child. Hannah is a member of the Wega Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. For the past 12 years, Hannah has been a farmer who cultivates maize, beans, and potatoes and raises sheep. She has undergone all of Hand in Hand Eastern Africa trainings. 

Hannah is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase fertilizer for top-dressing so that she can increase her farm produce. She plans to use the profits from her loan to cater for her family’s basic needs and save for future use. Hannah is grateful to Kiva lenders and she promises to make payment promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in tomatoes, onions, green chilies, apples, mangoes, and other products needed to improve his business.

loans.name: Changawa

texts.en:
Changawa is a married woman who has been blessed with three children who go to school. For the past ten years, she has operated a dairy farm. Changawa sells retail at the local market and to restaurants and restaurant operators. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Changawa’s major business challenge is seasonality. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.  

Changawa is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase medicine for her livestock and feed for her cow.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for her livestock and feed for her cow

loans.name: Pedro Claver

texts.es:
Pedro a sus 57 años de edad, es viudo. Se ha dedicado a las labores del campo desde que tenía 12 años, pues viene de una familia campesina muy humilde, con quien aprendió todo lo relacionado con el cuidado de animales y la agricultura. 

Actualmente comercializa cerdos y además posee cultivos en la finca donde vive; de estas actividades percibe los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Es un hombre pujante, activo y trabajador, lucha diariamente con esmero y dedicación para sacar adelante a su familia. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con sus labores, con el dinero comprará insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas, entre otros, para que la cosecha sea más productiva y pueda ser vendida con mayor facilidad en el mercado, generando así un margen de utilidad más amplio. 

Pedro con su humildad y su sencillez sólo desea poder tener una estabilidad económica favorable, lo que para él significa disfrutar de buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 57-year-old widower. He has made a living doing farm work since he was 12 years old, since he comes from a humble farming family who taught him everything related to agriculture and animal husbandry.

Currently, he sells pigs and also plants crops on the farm where he lives. He is able to bring in sufficient income to sustain his household with these activities.

Pedro is an active man and a vigorous worker, who fights daily and takes great care and dedication to move his family forwards. He is requesting a loan for support to continue with his work. He will use the money to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, fertilizer, and fungicide, among other things, so that his harvest will be more productive and can be sold more easily at the market, therefore generating a larger profit margin.

Pedro is a humble and simple man and only wants to be able to have favorable and stable economic conditions so that he can enjoy good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, fertilizer, and fungicide, among other things.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling wholesale coconuts to local neighbors. She faces the major challenge a high cost of transportation in the business.

With the Kshs. 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more salon equipment for sale.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married mother with three children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She has operated a business of selling potatoes for the past five years, selling from home .

She mentioned major challenges from seasonality and transportation in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of potatoes for resale. She decide to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married mother of five children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes. 30,000 she wants to purchase more stock of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Sally; she is 43 years old and married with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and learned skills on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

She has been doing dairy farming for the past two years. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fodder for her cows and an additional cow. This income will enable her to provide her family with food and also pay for household expenses.

Sally appreciates Kiva and its lenders for the support and help and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fodder and a dairy cow that will help boost milk production.

loans.name: Saeedan

texts.en: Saeedan is 40 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to augment her sales.

loans.name: Chitsitsa

texts.en:
Chitsitsa is a married mother of seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes. 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en:
Rabecca is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Rabecca operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity, but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothing business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food. 

She has operated a milk business for the past 15 years, selling milk door-to-door to neighbors. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase milk for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale.

loans.name: Tumu

texts.en:
Tumu is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past four years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: Mwangome

texts.en:
Mwangome is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a cashew nut business for the past seven years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.  

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase four sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity. 

For the past four years, she has operated a coconut business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
At the tender age of 20, Mary's passion for farming and education drove her to start practicing mixed farming. Right now, she is 31 and a very industrious, honest, and hardworking mother from the Nkubu area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya.

Mary has been farming for the past 11 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been from selling milk, eggs, crops, and from some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Mary is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying bananas seeds so that she can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy seeds of banana. Kenya's Nkubu area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for bananas. This means that Mary could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Mary, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like herself turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Mary believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for food.

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Mary to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start banana farming.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with one child who is still too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Lucy has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gentlemen. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs. 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Beatrice has operated a kiosk business from home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase iron sheets for renovating her kiosk. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets for renovating  her kiosk.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married woman and she owns a house that has no piped water but has electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mesalim has operated a tailoring business for the past eight years. She makes womens' suits and mens' suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a cashew nut business for the past ten years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a cashew nut business for the past four years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With the Kshs 5,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Women Of Faith Victory Group

texts.en:
Rahab, raising her hand in the photo, is 51 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 so as to benefit from the training, especially those in enterprise development.

She is involved in mixed farming and is also a primary school teacher. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy more chicken and poultry feed to increase production and hence meet her customer’s demands. This will enable her meet her family's basic needs (e.g food and clothing).

Rahab is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and poultry feed to increase production.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a cashew nut business for the last six years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Penina, 61 years old and married with ten children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 and has undergone training on enterprise and financial management. This has has helped her in running her enterprise and accounting for her finances. 

She grows maize, mangoes and oranges alongside goat rearing. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy goats and pesticide to spray her crops. She anticipates an increased yield which will earn her more income, thus enabling her to provide a better diet and clothing to her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promise to pay well.

loans.use: To buy goats as well as pesticides for higher production and be able to provide a better diet and clothing for her family.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
The person featured in the picture is David. He is 54 years old, married and has three children. David joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 with the aim of acquiring skills in enterprise development and financial management. He is a maize and beans farmer and he is borrowing from Kiva to enable him buy pesticides and fertilizer so as to boost his yield and also help him in harvesting his current crop. He plans to grow his business and open a maize mill in his locality that will serve to mill maize for him and his customers. This will enable him to increase his sales and boost his productivity for the next harvest. He will utilize his extra income to get better clothing and schooling for his children and better healthcare for himself and his family.
David is thankful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one child who is still young to attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge in transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married mother of one child who is too young to attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. With the loan of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers shop. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, Hence, perishable goods lead to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of six children, five of whom attend school. The other one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of wheat flour, rice and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of wheat flour, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a divorced woman with ten children, six of whom attend school. The other four are grown-ups. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a fruit juice business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transporting raw materials. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, such as mangoes and passion fruit, for making fruit juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, such as mangoes, and passion fruit, for making juice to sell.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married with five children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a cashew nut business for the past six years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.  

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a divorced woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her children, she lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over seven years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 so as to benefit from trainings, especially enterprise development.

She operates a second-hand clothing shop. She also sells plastic items such basins, mugs and plates as well as plastic sandals. She is borrowing from Kiva so that she can purchase more second-hand clothes (mainly children's outfits) to boost her income and meet customers' demands. With the increased income, she will be able to cover her family's basic expenses such as food, medical and school fees. 

Florence is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 50 years old, and the married mother of two children. She is a Palestinian refugee who has been living and working in a Palestinian camp since she was born. She used to work in agriculture, but age and her weakening body have forced her to open her current grocery store.
 
The income she earns running the store is necessary to help her husband, who works as a fisherman with a very low income, to support the family and  their children's increasing needs.

Her business is going just fine, but she does not earn enough to cover unexpected living expenses. Since Iman is continuing to build her house, she is acquiring her seventh loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for the construction materials needed.

Her previous loans helped her a lot in developing her newly-established business, and she has proven to be reliable in paying back her loans.

Iman is working hard to keep developing and expanding her business properly, with hopes to start wholesale trading in the future.

loans.use: To pay for construction material needs to continue building her house.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 31 years old, married and has two grade school children. His wife is engaged in buying and selling of bananas. With his desire to provide enough food for his family, he cultivates two hectares of rice field. His inspiration to work hard is their children. He wants them to have enough food to take, and able to send them in school until finishing college education.

With regards to his farming business, Wilfredo is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his rice crops. Wilfredo hopes to harvest plenty, earns bigger income for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his rice crops.

loans.name: Mwanatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu is married, and has four kids who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle transport business. Her major challenge in her business is seasonality.

She wants to add the Ksh 10,000 to her savings to purchase new tires for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a widowed woman with four children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past seven years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of competition and transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter  and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Meet Rebecca who is a tenacious, determined, and very resourceful woman who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a proud mother and has been doing mixed farming for the past four years. Her primary sources of income are egg selling, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. The Nkubu area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming; that is, good soil, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products.

Rebecca wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. She intends to buy good vegetable and fruits seeds that she will use in horticultural farming. With more income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits. With your support, this noble farmer will be able to produce more crops. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothing business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chanty's Group

texts.en:
Chanty, 25, is a mother of a young kid who lives in Battambang province. In order to support her living condition, she grows rice and works for others for a fee for two years. She can get more income via raising pigs. These days, she could earn income around 37,000KHR per day to support the family. Because of drought, her crop did not grow well.

She lacks capital to support her business, so she decides to apply for a Kiva’s loan, which will be her first time with VisionFund. For this first loan, Chanty and her group will get a loan of 1,000,000KHR for each. As the leader, she is going to use the loan portion to buy more pigs and pig feeds to support her business. She hopes to make extra income to expand her business so that she can improve the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feeds to support her business.

loans.name: Nga'raria Golden Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Lilian. She is twenty three years old, married, and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and with them she has benefited from business management trainings that have enabled her to manage her enterprises prudently.

Lilian does dairy farming to earn her living and she is taking a Kiva loan to buy animal feeds to increase her milk productivity. She hopes to get higher returns to enable her to pay school fees for her children without any difficulties.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds to increase milk production and hence be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina wants to move her passengers safely and with comfort. She manages a motorcycle for passenger’s transportation. Her motorcycle is operated by somebody and agreed to have some portion of their daily income. Josefina receive P150 daily as a rent of her motorcycle.

With her desire to guarantee that passengers will move safely, Josefina wants to renew the motorcycle sidecar. With this, she is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy a new sidecar. She hopes that by having the new sidecar, her desires become real.

loans.use: to buy a new sidecar for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is an entrepreneur operating on a three and a half-acre piece of land in the Nkubu region of Kenya. She keeps dairy cows, poultry, and trees. Her highest annual expense for her child's education alone is over 30,000 KES. To keep providing adequately for her family, she decided to think outside the box and come up with a good business plan with a favorable return on investment.

She is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to start a farm inputs store. Her vision is for the business to be a leading enterprise in its category in the Nkubu area, offering farm inputs and animal feeds at affordable prices. She is anticipating many customers, as there is little competition in the area. She has already invested some of her own savings to get the business started. She plans to use your loan investment to purchase more items to stock the farm inputs store. Through the income she projects from the farm input store, she will be able to pay school fees and meet other needs of her family without much straining. Evangeline is a great client of Juhudi Kilimo; she has a perfect credit risk score. She has successfully serviced her previous loan. A single lending from you to Evangeline is a big demonstration of your vote of confidence in the future of a great woman with the strong mental fortitude of putting her family first and overcoming all other obstacles in her way to a better life.

loans.use: to start a business selling farm inputs

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a 44 years old married mother of two children, who has been working as a French language tutor from home since 1994, to support her husband in covering their family's living needs and developing their living.
Hanady is a hardworking mother who puts so much effort to provide her children with the best education. This is Hanady's third loan cycle as Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing paying back history, her previous loans were acquired to cover most of her family's living needs, and children education expenses.

Through Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, Hanady will invest her acquired loan in paying for her son's Pharmacy's second year university tuition fees, hoping to see him a graduated Pharmacist in the coming three years, since his major requests five years to graduate, and he already finished his first year and continued to the second.
She will also use part of the loan for necessary medication expenses that has to do with her mom's health.
Hanady's dream is to open a kindergarten in the future and hopes she can make this dream come true as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for her son's second year university tuition fees in Pharmacy, hoping to see him a graduated pharmacist in the coming three years.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath, 29, is a farmer living in Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province and a mother of two young children. Growing rice is the primary source of her income for 9 years. Moreover, she works as a paid worker to get more income in order to make her family’s living to get better. She can manage to earn about 40,000KHR per day to support her family condition. Unfortunately, her hard-working on farming business has been ruined by flooding, insects and pests.

This is the third loan of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she repaid all the previous loans completely. She can get more income from her previous loans with a decent household supplies and keeps her children in school. In a group of two, she is the group leader. Sambath will use her third loan to buy fertilizer and seed to produce good yield from her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to produce good yield from her rice farm.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal a 42 years old housewife and a mother for 6 children. She lives in a small town of Irbid northern Jordan. Her husband works in construction but the business was affected by the Syrian conflict since where they live and work is close to the Syrian border, where it had a lot of refugees coming to Irbid cities and start competing with the locals for jobs.

For that Amal started to do side jobs at home, making pickles and yogurt to sell. Now Amal wants to buy a small machine that can help in the production of yogurt, instead of making it by herself by hand, for that she is applying to this loan.

loans.use: to buy a small machine that can help in the production of yogurt instead of making it by herself by hand,.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 50-year-old housewife who lives in Khagrabari in the Cooch Behar district of West Bengal. She lives with her husband Subhash and two sons. Sabita is a housewife while her husband works in a motor garage. Having a secondary level education, Sabita is fully concerned about establishing her children in this modern era. She gives much inspiration to her younger son for his education.

Her younger son Shubhajit is studying in grade 12 in Cooch Behar Rambhola High School. He is a very studious and diligent student. However, because of the financial crisis, Sabita and her husband are facing difficulties in paying her son’s upcoming educational fees. The income totally depends on her husband's business, which is at present running into a hard time.

For this reason, Sabita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay the education costs for her son’s grade 12 level studies, so that he is no longer excluded from his classes throughout the academic year. She dreams of her son’s further education as much as possible to make him established to contribute to her family.

She and Shubhajit (in the picture ) thank BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase study materials and pay educational fees for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her four siblings in the countryside of Rwanda. Due to her tremendous academic potential and work ethic, Clementine was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Clementine plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She is unsure of her exact career path, but dreams of starting her own business by using the skills learned at Kepler. She also plans to use her success to support her family, and potentially to adopt children in need.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna of Oton, Iloilo dreams that her variety store will develop into a grocery or convenience store someday. Unlike a grocery store where customers instantly pay in cash or through credit card, a community store like Juna’s has many debtors. Most of her debtors are her neighbors. She is a kind-hearted person who cannot refuse them because she understands that there are times when it’s really hard to earn money. However, it shakes the stability of her business and depletes her capital. Because of this, she appeals for additional capital to cover the delayed payments of her neighbors. A PhP 12,000 loan would be enough to buy more stocks for her inventory and stabilize her business despite those debts. She’s praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to her. It will surely go a long way. 

Juna is a 54-year-old widow who is supporting a child in college. She prays that her child will receive a college diploma soon and eventually obtain a stable job. She also prays for good health and full happiness. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pipes, faucets, water meter, shower, etc. to install running water and electric energy in her house.

loans.name: Babelyn

texts.en:
Babelyn is 29 years old and has three children. Babelyn is married and has two children are currently in school.

Babelyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. Babelyn requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

Babelyn has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 30 years old and married with two children. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks and etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks and etc

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
In the village Lachashen of Gegharkunik region lives Norayr with his wife and their single son. Norayr always has been farmer and now also he takes care of his farm and cattle in it. He has cows, calves, heifers, bulls and pigs on the farm. He also has plot of land on which he cultivates potato, tomato, cucumber, onion, greens and he also has very sweet harvest of strawberries.

Norayr likes and cares of his farm greatly as it is the only source of income for his family and it also provides fresh and tasty food for his family. Norayr is worried of his cattle fodder since this year because of hot summer the grass in the fields very early was poor and not enough for his farm cattle. So this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Noryar decided to spend on the purchase of a lot of fodder for his cattle that will be enough for a long time.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his cattle that will be enough for a long time.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province, Sokha is 41 years old and a married mother of two children. She sells grocery items as her single main source of her income. She has been involved her current business for 23 years. The heavy rain affected her business so she can earn less income than before. Sokha has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) so this is the first time for her to take a Kiva loan.

She is the group leader of four and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale, so that she can get more income. She hopes that this first loan will improve her business larger than before, so she can improve her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale, so that she can get more income

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Makerere Business School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Wynand. He is the Director of Makerere University Business School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nakawa in Kampala with over 1000 students. Makerere Business School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Makerere Business School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each semester.
