Wynand ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ahalya

texts.en:
Ahalya lives with her husband Krishna and two grown up children (one son and one daughter) in Falakata. She is a 35-year-old housewife. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Her daughter is doing her master’s degree and her son is in college. Her son currently reads in the second year of the B.A.

Ahalya's husband's is the breadwinner of the family and his income hardly covers all the family expenses in this era of rising prices. So he is facing difficulties in bearing his son's educational expenses after meeting his domestic needs and his daughter’s educational costs.

Their 23-year-old son Bhabatosh is a student of the B.A. (second year) in Siliguri College. He is very studious and keen to graduate and after that he wants to go for higher study. He wants to be a teacher in the future, but his parents can not provide him with private tuition and other educational articles due to their financial problems.

Ahalya heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) gives education loans to needy meritorious students. She does not want her son's educational expenses to be a burden on her husband, so she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase necessary educational articles and a bicycle and to pay the private tuition fees, college fees, and exam fees for her son. She hopes the loan will help her son a lot to complete his education and reach his goal.

Ahalya and her son Bhabatosh (in the picture) are very thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to pay the private tuition fees and college fees and to buy educational articles for her son.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is a 61 years old, married woman and mother of 2 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Mwanasiti has operated a coconut business for the past five years, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and a mother of six children and lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She sells green groceries, helped by her family. Rose is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Rose is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business .

loans.use: to purchase  vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: La Prosperidad Group

texts.es: Maria de 28 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “la prosperidad” la cual lo conforman 06 socias que trabajan honradamente para mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella hace más de 2 años que puso una bodega donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes el cual le va bien. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es de poder terminar de poder ampliar su negocio .solicito el crédito para la compra de fideos aceite arroz lentejas. La Alcancía “la prosperidad” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Maria se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one dependent child. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Prosperidad” (Prosperity), which consists of six members who work honestly in order to improve their quality of life. More than two years ago, she opened a store where she sells all types of groceries and it has been doing well. Thanks to her constant dedication, she has been able to help her family move forward. Her greatest challenge is to finish the expansion of her business. Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy noodles, oil, rice, and lentils.

The Communal Bank “La Prosperidad” is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they have given. In the photo, Maria is seated in the first position on the left side.

loans.use: to buy noodles, oil, rice, and lentils.

loans.name: Asina

texts.en:
Asina is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Asina operates a vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase crates of tomatoes, onions and potatoes for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase crates of tomatoes, onions and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is 47 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 45000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Sujata

texts.en:
Sujata, 40 years old, is a rural woman from Khagrabari. Her family is comprised of her husband and two daughters. Sujata had an opportunity to study till grade 8 in her childhood and could not continue further because of her parental financial issues.

Her husband works in a motor garage and the nature of his work is very irregular. The small and inconsistent income Sujata's husband earns is mostly spent on their household expenses. Yet Sujata and her husband try their utmost to give their children a good education.

Sujata's elder daughter, 16-year-old Gayetree, is attending Cooch Behar Suniti Academy. She has been promoted into grade 12 with a brilliant result. So far she has neither any private tutor nor was she provided with enough study materials. But Gayetree wants to continue her studies to do well in the forthcoming Higher Secondary Board exam. For this, she has to take good private tuition, and she needs books and other study materials which are not affordable by her parents with their present income. Her education seems like a financial burden to her parents.

Hence Sujata applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to pay the private tuition fees and other educational fees and to purchase textbooks for grade 12 for her daughter. This financial help will help the girl to continue getting success in her career.

Sujata and Gayetree convey their heartiest thanks to their lenders.

loans.use: To afford her elder daughter's educational expenses.

loans.name: Mwaleso

texts.en:
Mwaleso is a married woman with three children who all attend school. She owns a house that has no piped water but has electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwaleso has operated a tailoring business for the past five years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. In addition, she also operates a soft drink business that is another source of income for her. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children, four of them are grown up and one is still at college. She has been running several projects, selling charcoal, running retail shop and selling vegetables, all of which are in the same area. She works from 06am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on charcoal stock, to increase on the shop inventory and has been selling vegetables for six years now. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to in crease on shop inventory, to buy sacks of charcoal and to buy vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, cucumber etc. She dreams of expending her business.

Fatuma will make sure she pays back the loan according to loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase on her shop inventory, to buy sacks of charcoal and to buy vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers,  cucumber etc

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is 56 years old and has nine children. Erminda is married and has one child who is still in school.

Erminda is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Erminda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Erminda has been farming sugarcane for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Erminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush from Vanadzor city of Lori region feels great respects towards the Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon since already twice she has been supported in her business by the help of Kiva loan.

Anush rents a stall in a central market of Vanadzor where she sells women shoes. She lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. Her beloved husband helps her greatly with her business and together they bring merchandise from Yerevan city for her stall. So having this business already 21 years she has great number of regular customers whom she is always happy to meet at her stall and with her kind way of service she manages to have good sale.

This time again this loan she asks for developing her shoe selling business; she wants to buy new assortment of shoes of autumn season for women and also for school-aged children as well.

loans.use: to buy new assortment of shoes of autumn season for women and also for school-aged children as well.

loans.name: Glecita

texts.en:
Glecita is a single woman, 47 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Glecita has a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines. Glecita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell.

Glecita has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a cashew nuts business for the past six years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Terisia

texts.en:
Terisia is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, Terisia has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, Terisia wants to purchase a stock of new clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
33 year-old Purnima is a rural woman and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). All are students. She lives in a small village at Khagrabari.

Her husband is a greengrocer in the local market and Purnima works in a nursing home. Their total monthly income is barely enough to cover the educational costs of their children after managing all the household expenses.

Purnima's elder daughter Rimpa, 15 years old, is studying in grade 11 at Khagrabari Mahendra Chandra Bidyamandir. She is a brilliant student and passed her last secondary board exam with good marks. She has a long-cherished dream to be a teacher by profession, so she wants to continue her study further and needs all the necessary educational materials of grade 11, which her parents are unable to afford.

Thus her mother Purnima is requesting an educational loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to bear the educational expenses of her daughter. She will pay the tuition fees and private tuition fees and purchase other necessary study materials and a bicycle for her daughter to save on her conveyance charges.

Purnima and Rimpa (in photo) express their gratitude towards BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To bear the education expenses of grade 11 for her daughter.

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en:
Jharna lives in a small village in Kandi in the Murshidabad district. She is an energetic and hardworking woman of 47 years. She has two sons. She received education up to grade 9. Her husband and her two sons are workers in a jewelery shop.

Jharna is associated with the clothing business. She purchases varieties of clothing from the wholesale market and sells them in her locality. She sells clothing like saris, petticoats, blouses, pants, shirts, etc. She has been involved with this business for the past 12 years and has long experience in this area of business. In the upcoming festive season, the demands of her valuable customers are increasing, so she likes to expand her business.

She would like to refurbish her collection of clothing items and with this aim she requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan amount to buy more stocks of clothing. As festival season is knocking at the door, she needs more supply for her clients. She hopes the expansion of her business will earn more revenue to provide her proper economical provisions.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is married and has two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still young for schooling. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers shop. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients. Hence, perishable of goods lead to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
Ange is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive academic record and hard work, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Ange chose Kepler because its curriculum is directly tied to the use and mastery of technology.

Ange plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She hopes that after graduating, she will have the skills and preparation to start her own business. 

While at Kepler, Ange would like to focus on her English language skills as well as her core professional competencies.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 27 years old, married and mother of two children, who has been providing hairdressing and makeup services from her house since 2102, to support her husband in their living and develop their family's social and financial situation.

Today, and since Manal is and ambitious woman, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to support her newly established fruits and vegetables selling business in parallel to her hairdressing and makeup services she provides from her house.
Her new business was established two months ago, and she is very optimistic about its future development.
She is working hard to develop both business in a well managed way.

loans.use: to support her newly established fruits and vegetables selling business, in parallel to her hairdressing and makeup services she provides from her house.

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Janet tiene 38 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas hace muchos años. Y a la vez vende gaseosas. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas frutas mandarinas plátanos manzanas y demás frutas al por mayor para poder expenderlo por kilos y obtener una mejor ganancia. Ella cumple la función de presidenta en el grupo “ESFUERZO DE MUJERES”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Janet es la que tiene al bebe de una de la integrantes de grupo.Y de la misma manera el grupo tiene como invitada a la hija de una se las socias. ella es la que se encuentra en medio de las dos persona en cuclillas
texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old, and is single with a dependent child. She has been working in fruit sales for many years. And, at the same time, she sells soft drinks.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of more fruits: tangerines, plantains, apples, and other fruits, at wholesale prices. This was she can spend per kilo and obtain better profit.

She serves as president in the group called "Esfuerzo de Mujeres". The group is grateful for KIVA lenders for their offered loan.

In the photo, Janet is the group member holding the baby of another group member. And, similarly, one of the other group member's daughters is between the two people who are crouching.

loans.use: with the purchase of more fruits: tangerines, plantains and apples.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Tatu has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gentlemen. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Yobanny

texts.es:
Yobanny es un empresario con mucha energía, una persona que siempre tiene dibujada una sonrisa en su rostro, desde el año 2000 ejerce como independiente la profesión de agricultor, cultiva zanahoria, lechuga, cilantro y repollo, las cuales distribuye en la plaza de mercado y con el dinero genera el sustento y la calidad de vida de su familia.
Este humilde trabajador tiene un sueño de comprar una vivienda, por ello pone todo su empeño y esfuerzo en su negocio, pues es la manera fácil y honesta de conseguirla.
Para desempeñar su labor Yobanny ha tenido que enfrentarse a ciertos inconvenientes, tales como depredadores, altos costos de insumos y fala de capital para comprar productos, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como; insecticidas, fungicidas, fertilizantes y además compra de semillas de zanahoria, lechuga, cilantro y repollo para un nuevo cultivo de verduras.
texts.en:
Yobanny is an energetic entrepreneur, a person who always has a smile drawn on his face. Since the year 2000 he has worked as an independent farmer, cultivating carrots, lettuce, cilantro and cabbage, which he sells in the marketplace, and with the money generated he ensures and improves the quality of life for his family.

This humble worker has a dream of buying a home. He puts all of his determination and effort into his business, which is the simple and honest way to achieve this dream.

To perform his work Yobanny has had to face certain obstacles; such as predators, high input costs, and insufficient capital to buy products. This is why he wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs such as insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers and also to buy seeds for carrots, lettuce, cilantro and cabbage for a new crop of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, including: insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers and also to buy seeds for carrots, lettuce, cilantro and cabbage for a new crop of vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Edilma

texts.es:
Luz desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Tiene 4 hijos que son su más grande adoración.
Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.

Madruga todos los días para trabajar en sus negocio durante 8 horas.

Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos de confección como tela, hilos y agujas; además desea realizar el mantenimiento preventivo a sus maquinas.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz learned the art of sewing at an early age, thanks to her mother who was a seamstress all of her life. This is how she learned, little by little, to understand and implement this knowledge. She has 4 children who are her greatest loves. She is an enterprising woman; affectionate and always prepared to give her customers the highest level of attention. She is very grateful for everything she has been able to build thanks to Corporación Interactuar. 

She gets up every day to work at her business for 8 hours. She is asking for financial support to sewing supplies such as cloth, thread and needles. She also wants to perform preventive maintenance on her sewing machines. She has many hopes for her business, and dreams of having a much bigger workshop where she can provide employment and increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as cloth, thread and needles. She also wants to perform preventive maintenance on her sewing machines.

loans.name: Maria Edith

texts.es:
María es propietaria de un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas en su hogar, tiene de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 4 hijos que dependen únicamente de este negocio para poder sobrevivir, comer, pagar sus deudas etc. 

Su negocio viene operando desde hace 2 años y ahora quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra insumos como carne, pollo, queso, arroz, aceite, verduras, entre otros ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Este crédito le permitirá continuar con la venta de comidas y seguir manteniéndose en el mercado, pues es quien genera los mayores ingresos en su hogar. 

Su sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
maría is the owner of a small business selling meals at her home. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children who depend uniquely on this business to survive, eat, pay their debts, etc.

She has been operating her business for two years and now wants to request a loan to buy supplies like meat, chicken, cheese, rice, oil and vegetables amongst others to prepare her food.

This loan will allow her to continue with her food sales and keep her in the market as she is the person who generates the most income in her household.

Her dream is to be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, cheese, rice, oil and vegetables amongst others to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora de 49  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 13  años al negocio de venta de comida como desayunos, almuerzos, baleadas, pupusas, tajaditas, papas fritas, frescos, agua en bolsa, etc.
Doña Aurora vive en un municipio de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Aurora está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de papas, salsas, queso, arroz, refrescos, frijoles, aceite, etc. producto que son la materia prima para elaborar sus comidas y también quiere reparar  el techo del puesto de su negocio.
 Uno de sus sueños es tener un buen negocio bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2015
texts.en:
Aurora is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in her own house. She has worked for 13 years in her business selling foods like breakfast, lunch, baleadas (traditional Honduran food made with a flour tortilla), pupusas, plantain chips, french fries, soft drinks, bags of water etc.

Aurora lives in the municipality of San Lorenzo, in the South of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with desires to get ahead and strives day by day to improve her quality of living.

Aurora is requesting the loan to buy potatoes, sauces, cheese, rice, soft drinks, beans, oil, etc. products which are the raw materials to make her food. She also needs to repair the roof of her business stall.

One of her dreams is to have a good, well-stocked business and at the same time improve her future together with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sauces, cheese, rice, soft drinks, beans, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ngombe

texts.en:
Ngombe is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Ngombe operates a stall where she sells grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, a crate of tomatoes, and french beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  sacks of potatoes, a crate of tomatoes, and french beans for resale.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is a 56-year-old man with seven children. He has two dependents, ages 16 and 18.

Dionesio is fishing to earn a living. He struggles when the weather is not good because he catches less fish than desired.

He is asking for a loan to buy a new set of fishing nets, kitchen utensils for his family, and food.

He hopes to expand his business and earn a better income, so he can provide for his family's needs and live in comfort. His profit will be used for healthy meals and the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy a set of fishing nets, kitchen utensils for his family, and food.

loans.name: Fatima Guadalupe

texts.es:
Fátima, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, en su casa viven sus abuelos y solo ellos dependen económicamente de ella. 

Fátima, vende hojas de plátano desde hace 6 años, pero también vende leche, antes solo estudiaba, su platanera está a 100 metros de su casa, su mamá también se involucra en las ventas, su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar ingredientes para hacer almuerzos para vender, ha decidido dedicarse también a este negocio porque en la venta de comida quedan muy buenas ganancias.

Sus sueño son, tener éxito en la venta de almuerzos y en el futuro colocar un comedor.
texts.en:
Fátima is 29 years old and is a High school graduate. She is single and has no children. Her grandparents live in her house and only they are dependent on her economically.

Fátima has been selling banana leaves for six years and she also sells milk. Before that she only studied. Her banana plantation is 100 meters from her house. Her mother is also involved in the sales. Her working hours are from 5 am until 12 noon.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make lunches to sell. She decided to also work in this business as selling food generates good profits.

Her dream is to be successful selling lunches and in the future open an eatery.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make lunches to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 29-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale. It is a thriving area full of people like Lilian, who, with hard work and honest work, make this town a very productive town. Lilian is a woman eager to get ahead. She is married and lives with her family. She is blessed with children, who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide for them a better future. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and maize. Lilian has been relying on agriculture to make all of her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Lilian remains positive and passionate about her economic activity.

Lilian is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This loan will enable her to expand the section of her business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Lilian will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her is timely, since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Lilian’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standards indirectly. Kindly support the dream of a Kenyan woman with a loan today!

loans.use: To purchase poultry to increase her farming business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and she lives with his husband and smallest son in the village Lachashen of Gegharkunik region. Her elder son is at the army passing his military service. Maria has higher pedagogical education and for 18 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. Maria also at her house helps some pupils to prepare their lessons and overcome any hardships in learning process that they do not manage during the lessons at the school. Maria mentions that she likes her work and her pupils very much and with their each achievement she becomes as happy as they are.

With this loan Mari wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also some new methodological literature for her private course at her house. These will make her courses more productive and interesting for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also some new methodological literature for her private courses at her house.

loans.name: Nurije

texts.en:
The ethnic Egyptian Albanian family in the photograph that is consisted of Nurije, her husband, Ahmet and the daughter Entela, is vulnerable indeed. Some years back Ahmet,became semi-paralyzed; he's been photographed undressed because it was way too hot in their room (as per loan officer statement) due to the fact that they lack the means of living properly.

While Ahmet receives a disability income of $150/monthly and his wife a retirement pension of $140/monthly, their daughter who is single and lives with them, works in a fish factory and makes $145 a month. However, Ahmet's medical cost is not cheap and they struggle all the time.
The reason for this loan is to continue making some basic repairs to the home.

loans.use: to continue making basic repairs to the home.

loans.name: Twin Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Rachael, a member of Twin Women group. She is twenty six years old and blessed with one child.
Rachael earns a living by selling second hand clothing. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training she received which equipped her with skill to manage her business well. The high demand in the market has made her to
apply for a loan to boost her business by adding more stock of clothes. This will increase sales thus more profits and earn more income.She will thus be in a position to meet her family needs and pay school fees for her kid.
Rachael is very grateful to kiva and their lenders and promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second hand clothes, thus more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive academic record and strong character, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because it because of its reputation for helping its students find job opportunities while they learn.
 
Melissa plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She loves to work in teams and to draw. She hopes to use her business skills she gains at Kepler to pursue a career in the arts after graduating.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 34 years old, a married woman with three children and running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income and fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Feliciana De Los Angeles

texts.es: Feliciana, mujer emprendedora, de 30 años, soltera y con dos hijos, quienes son sus fuentes de superación, su hijo de 14 años estudia en secundaria y el de 11 en primaria. Solicitando crédito  por primera vez a ADIM y a los miembros de KIVA. Ella tiene su microempresa donde producen pan dulce y pan simple. Desde hace 14 años, comenzó su negocio ahorrando dinero de su trabajo anterior donde le daban mercancía para vender. Ahora requiere del préstamo para invertirlo en materias de insumos como harina, sartenes, margarina, palas, y mejorar una parte del taller para que haya un producción de calidad y efectiva.
texts.en:
Feliciana is an enterprising woman who is 30 years old, single, and has two children who provide her the motivation to succeed. She has a 14-year-old child in secondary school and an 11-year-old child in primary school. Feliciana is requesting a loan for the first time from the Kiva lenders through ADIM. She has a small business where she produces sweet bread and plain bread. Fourteen years ago, she started her business with the money she saved from her previous job selling merchandise that was given to her.

Feliciana is now requesting a loan so that she can invest in supplies such as flour, baking tins, margarine, and spatulas. Part of the loan will also be used to improve her shop so that she can achieve high-quality and effective production.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking tins, margarine, spatulas, and to make improvements to her shop.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira is 45 years old married woman and the mother of 4 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: galvanised sheet, timber, nails and wire to replace the walls of his home.

loans.name: Zulma Elizabeth

texts.es: Zulma tiene 24 años de edad, es una joven que vive muy feliz junto a su madre y su padre desde muy pequeña. Zulma es muy trabajadora y ayuda a sus padres económicamente, ya que brinda sus servicios a una institución como promotora de educación en la cual apoya  a la educación permanente de las personas jóvenes y adultas, es así como cubre las necesidades de sus padres y las personales. Zulma siempre ha deseado mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su hogar, es por ello que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada y clavos para reparar su vivienda y encementar el piso que es de tierra lo que causa enfermedades respiratorias a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Zulma is 24 years old. She is a young person who has lived very happily with her mother and father since she was very little. Zulma is a very hard-worker and helps her parents economically since she provides her services to an institution as a promoter of education which supports on-going education for young people and adults. This is how she covers the expenses for her parent's necessities and her own.

Zulma has always wanted to improve the living conditions of her home. For this reason she has decided to request a loan with FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and nails to repair her home and to cement the dirt floor which causes respiratory illnesses in her family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and nails to repair her home and to cement the dirt floor.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with 8 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and other vegetables which she has been involved in for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will open another business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita buys and sells silver accessories. This is her alternative business aside from her food stall business that sells cooked viands and snacks. She’s grateful that Center for Community Transformation has partnered with Kiva to help new entrepreneurs on their business. The previous loan that was granted enabled her to buy different silver accessories and added items for her buy and sell business. It resulted to her increased daily sales; and now she wants to thank you, kindhearted lenders, for your donations. She’s praying for a blissful life for people like you with compassionate hearts.

Most of Teresita’s customers are her neighbors and friends that’s why she can’t avoid lending products to them. She finds the job challenging since there are customers who give delayed payments and it’s somehow difficult to collect debts each day. She wants to have supplementary capital so she can buy more silver accessories to display and sell. It will surely entice more customers and will eventually bring higher profit for her. To attain this, she applied for a P34, 000 loan that would help her business grow. She wants to thank you in advance for giving your precious time to read her story and for your generous hearts willing to help others in need.

On a weekly basis, Teresita regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more silver accessories.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pablita is 55 years old now.

Pablita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Pablita requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other material for fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.
Pablita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Pablita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 46 years old and with his nice wife he lives in Yerevan city. Gagik has vocational education and he now works at the factory of champagnes and wines and here he is a distributer and manager. His wife is also is employed and she is a saleswoman at the children clothes department.

Gagik loves and cares of his wife very much and now that his wife has some health problem is great anxiety for him. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Gagik asks, as he will use it to solve his beloved wife’s health problem. He is thankful beforehand and greatly hopes for urgent support.

loans.use: to solve his beloved wife’s health problem.

loans.name: Amaly

texts.en:
Amaly is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up alongside her three sisters and one brother in rural Rwanda. Because of Amaly's tremendous academic record, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Amaly plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She chose Kepler because she wanted to learn the professional skills that will help her stand out as an entrepreneur. After graduating, Amaly hopes to start her own company and eventually to employ people in her community.

In her free time, Amaly likes to read and study theater.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of more maize to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she keeps chickens, cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 36, is engaged in “sari-sari” or variety store business in her community in Polomolok, South Cotabato. She sells various commodities that are essential to everyday living of the people in their area. These include sachets of shampoo, toothpaste, soap, snacks, candies, bread, repacked condiments and many others. She and her husband, Edgardo, work diligently to raise their children well. Edgardo is a farmer and a part-time driver. Basically, they can provide some of their basic needs but there are times that their income is not sufficient. Josephine is not content to just make a daily living because she aspires to save more for the future. 

With this forward-looking mindset, she wants to make her business more profitable. She would like to avail of a loan amounting to PhP 8,000 to buy more quantities of dry goods and grocery items for her store. She is hoping that additional income from this loan will sufficiently sustain their everyday needs and boost her savings for her children’s future and education. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of dry goods and grocery items

loans.name: Jealyn

texts.en:
According to Jealyn, 53, she wants to live a peaceful life and see herself worthy in the sight of God. She tries to be honest in all undertakings including management of her business. She runs a variety store in Oton, Iloilo. Just like other business owners, she also experiences stiff competition and lack of capital. Besides, she has many debtors who just fled and left behind their debts. Sometimes her honesty and consideration for others doesn’t always come back to her. This faith-testing situation hampers the continuous operation of her business and consequently affects her income.

Now she is the one who needs additional capital of PhP 15,000 which she can use to buy added items for sale in her variety store. Her profit will supplement her husband’s income as construction worker. They are both working hard to support their children who are still studying in college. Later on she plans to expand her sari-sari into a grocery store.

She gains inspiration from her co-fellowship members who regularly meet every week to share stories about life and reflect on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy added items for sale in her variety store

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean from Oton, Iloilo. She is 40 years old, single, who shoulders some responsibilities for her siblings, nephews and nieces. She extends financial assistance to them regularly. They are the reason for her perseverance as she doesn’t want to work for herself alone. She runs a small “sari-sari” or variety store that sells usual commodities like snacks, repacked condiments, toiletries, and others. She has limited stock as you can see, because she just started her business two years ago. Somehow her income helps provide for her everyday needs and some financial assistance for her relatives.

Jean dreams of expanding her business so she can effectively help her relatives. She needs additional supplies to meet the demand of customers who prefer a store with wide selections. She knocks at your kind hearts for a loan assistance of PhP 10,000 which she can use as additional capital for her enterprise. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for her store

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 55 years old and married with four children. Chona works very hard to provide for them.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks and etc.

Chona has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 47 years old and married with six children, four of them are still in school, Guadalupe works very hard to provide for them.

Guadalupe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks etc.

Guadalupe has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, drinks etc.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, 41, is a mother of five dependent kids who lives in Banteay Meanchey province. To support her family condition, she raises pigs and works for a labor fee to get additional money for 21 years. Her pigs have not grown well so that she could earn income only about 40,000KHR per day.

With VisionFund, this is Sary’s first time to take a Kiva loan. As a group leader of three, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy more pigs and pigs feed to support her business. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn good income and update her living standard.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pigs feed to support her business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with seven children, three of whom attend school. For the past 15 years, she has operated a business selling farm produce. She sells items from her home to her neighbors. Tabu lives in her own house that does not have electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. Her major business challenge is the seasonality of her products. Tabu decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

Tabu is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to use in her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Delmis

texts.es:
La señora Delmis de 33  años de edad, vive con su mama  e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de maricos,  vende productos como camarones, pescado, robalo, pargo rojo, lisa, ruco, palometa, etc.
Doña Delmis sus clientes son personas de las aldeas y colonias aledañas de San Lorenzo, Radica en la ciudad  de san Lorenzo al sur de honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Delmis está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como camarones, pescado rojo, robalo, lisa, ruco, etc.  También piensa comprar  2 termos o hieleras para la venta de estos productos,  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente sub-siguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Delmis is 33 years old and lives with her mother and her children in her own house. She has worked in her business selling fish for 10 years. She sells products like shrimp, fish, bass, red snapper, mullet, grunt, harvest-fish, etc.

Delmis' clients are people from the villages and neighborhoods around San Lorenzo. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in the South of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead and strives day by day to improve her quality of living. .

Delmis is requesting this loan to buy shrimp, red snapper, bass, mullet, grunt, etc. She is also thinking of buying two coolers or fridges to sell these products. With the help of this loan she hopes to increase her income and also her quality of living. She has had previous loans with Prisma and wants to continue to work with them.

Her dream is to have a good, well-stocked business and at the same time improve her future together with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, red snapper, bass, mullet, grunt, etc for her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children. For the past 20 years, she has been a farmer who sells her produce at the market. Rehema lives in her own house that does not have electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. Rehema’s greatest business challenge is transporting her products to market. She decided to join Yehu to improve her business. 

Rehema is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She is a farmer who sells her products from home and at the market. Caroline’s major business challenge is seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. Caroline decided to join Yehu to improve her farm.

Caroline is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Bukhuti

texts.en:
Bukhuti is 67 years old married man. He lives in Ozurgeti district with his wife, both of them are pensioners. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and Bukhuti's wife produces dairy products every day. In addition they own a small plot of agricultural land, where they grow nut trees.

Bukhuti decided to start taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan. With the received credit Bukhuti will purchase a car and will serve people as a taxi driver. He will generate stable income and will use to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Javier Enrique

texts.es: Javier en su microempresa de adornos decorativos en porcelanicrón es muy solicitado para realizar recordatorios en diferentes eventos familiares; cumpleaños infantiles, baby showers, bodas, primeras comuniones y bautizos.  Este arte lo aprendió de su madre quien por años se ha dedicado a esta actividad que ha sido parte del sustento en su hogar, ella le enseñó todos los trucos, secretos y técnicas necesarias para obtener un hermoso trabajo.  Hace siete años realiza adornos elaborados por sus manos y todos tienen algún detalle que los hace únicos,  gracias a ello ha consolidado una amplia clientela que recibe en su punto de venta y les ofrece por medio de su catálogo la gama de sus productos. Javier siempre está en búsqueda constante de nuevas  ideas para para su negocio y apoyar la economía familiar, es por eso que está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo domingo, recurso que planea invertir en la compra de nuevos moldes y materia prima para la incorporación de nuevos modelos que diversifiquen su catálogo.  Su meta es abrir una tienda de manualidades pues considera que existen amplias posibilidades para triunfar con un negocio de este tipo porque para cualquier evento la gente busca algún motivo conmemorativo.
texts.en:
Javier has a small business that produces decorative ornaments. He is in high-demand to make souvenirs for family events, children's birthday parties, baby showers, weddings, first communions and christenings. He learned this occupation from his mother, who supported her family for years through this activity. She taught Javier all the tricks, secrets and techniques necessary to do a beautiful job. 

He has made ornaments for seven years, all of which have a detail that makes them unique. This has allowed him to develop a large clientele that he receives at his point of sale. Javier is always looking for new ideas for his business and to support his family's finances. This is why he is requesting his first Kiva loan with the Mario Santodomingo Foundation. He plans to use the loan to buy new molds and supplies to incorporate new models that will diversify his catalog. His goal is to open a store, as he considers there are ample possibilities to be successful because of the demand for his products for different events.

loans.use: to buy new molds and supplies.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is 21 years old single Palestinian refugee, who works hard to develop her social and financial living through educating herself for a better future.
Three years ago, Aya started working as a tutor from her parent's house so that she can manage to pay for the education she seeks to acquire.

Today, Aya is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her French Language College tuition expenses, this is her first year and still one more to go.
She hopes that in the future she can open her special education center and invest her teaching hobby and experience in a spreading education as a good cause she will fight for.

loans.use: to pay for her French Language College tuition expenses.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a la falta de recursos y no pudo seguir estudiando,   está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad.

José, tiene un negocio de reparación de llantas en el pueblo, este negocio lo aprendió trabajando en otro taller, además de tener el taller se dedica a la albañilería, el negocio lo tiene en su propia casa.

El crédito sera utilizado como capital de trabajo para comprar más llantas para taller de reparación.

José, siempre ha soñado con comprar un pick-up, para poder realizar viajes y poder obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
José, who is 26 years old, studied through the ninth grade. Due to his lack of resources, he could not continue his studies. He cohabits with his partner, who does housework and has two children, of 4 and 5 years of age.

José, has a tire repair shop in town. He learned this business working in another shop. In addition to having this shop, he works in construction. He handles this business from his home.

This loan will be used as a working capital to buy more tires for the repair shop.

José has always dreamed of buying a pickup truck in order to travel and earn a greater income.

loans.use: to buy more tires for a repair shop.

loans.name: Elda Beatriz

texts.es: Elda es una emprendedora con un don para la costura que decidió hace 25 años, hacer de su vocación su profesión y dedicarse de lleno a la confección de  prendas de vestir.  De tal manera que a la fecha cuenta con una clientela definida, compuesta por familiares, vecinas y referidas  a  quienes les confecciona ropa para damas para toda ocasión y se dedica doce horas a esta actividad de lunes a domingo.  Ella elabora las prendas  de acuerdo a las especificaciones de sus clientes; para Elda el negocio de la costura es creativo y agradable aunque a veces hay clientes difíciles de convencer, pero su dedicación y profesionalismo le permiten dejarlos satisfechos. Ella está aspirando actualmente a su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual requiere invertir en la compra de una máquina fileteadora para ofrecer una mejor calidad a su trabajo que a futuro se traduzca en la captura de una mayor clientela y por lo tanto en mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y lograr ampliar su taller que es su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Elda is an entrepreneur with a gift for dressmaking. She decided 25 years ago to make her vocation into her profession and to dedicate herself full time to making clothing. She has a well-defined clientele made up of family members, neighbors and people referred to her. She makes women's clothing for all occasions and works at this occupation twelve hours from Monday to Sunday.

She makes the outfits in accordance to the specifications of her clients. For Elda, the dressmaking business is creative and pleasant although sometimes there are clients who are difficult to please, but her dedication and professionalism allow them to leave satisfied. She is now aspiring to her first Kiva loan with the "Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo." She requires it to invest in the purchase of an overlock sewing machine [serger] to offer better quality in her work. In the future this will translate into capturing a larger clientele and therefore in increased earnings. This will permit her to improve the quality of her life and to achieve the expansion of her workshop, which is her dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine (serger)

loans.name: Edgar Javier

texts.es: Don Edgar trabaja en su plantación de chayotes. Él solicita un préstamo de doscientos cincuenta dólares($250), esto para la compra de postes, alambre e insumos necesarios para el buen desarrollo de dicho cultivo.
texts.en: Edgar works on his vegetable pear plantation. He is applying for a loan of US$250 in order to buy posts, wire and necessary supplies for his crops to grow well.

loans.use: to buy posts and supplies for growing vegetable pear.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a hard working married mother of three children. She is 41 years old, and has been working as a teacher since 27 years.
Today, and because she cares a lot about her children education, Hanan is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children increasing school tuition fees.

This is Hanan's first experience as Al Majmoua borrower, and since her limited monthly salary combined with her husband's aren't enough to cover the increasing living unexpected expenses, she hopes to stay capable of acquiring future loans to make her dream of providing her children with the best education come true.
She hopes to stay in good health and capable of raising educated generation for a better future

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Exitosos De Carapongo Group

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 22 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de edredones zapatillas  y ropa sobre pedidos hace más de un año. Y en horas de la tarde trabaja como ayudante de verduras. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más edredones zapatillas. El grupo “EXITOSOS DE CARAPONGO” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.  Rebeca es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 22 years old and single.

She makes a living selling duvets, trainers and clothes on order. She has been doing this work for more than a year, and in the afternoon she works as a vegetable helper.

Rebeca will use this loan to buy more duvets and trainers.

The "Exitosos de Carapongo" group is grateful to Kiva investors for this loan. In the photo, Rebeca is second from the left.

loans.use: to buy more duvets and trainers.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William who has been practicing cattle fattening for the last seven years is a married man with 6 children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He has another source of income from banana growing and selling. The business of cattle fattening has enabled him to explore the existing market and construct a buy land for settlement. He dreams of living a happy life with his family despite the difficulty of drought which lowers the price of his animals since they are of poor quality during this season. William intends to use the loan to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Gome

texts.en:
Gome  is a married woman and staying together with her husband and one child. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past one year, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 42 years old, married and a father of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the training, mainly enterprise development.

He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat; beef and mutton. He is taking Kiva loan so as to buy a modern weighing machine hence improve efficiency in his butchery operations. He currently uses a old weighing machine which breaks regularly resulting to high maintenance cost. He believes this will help him improve his income and consequently be able to support his children's education.

Joshua is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy a modern weighing machine for increased income to support children's education.

loans.name: Kulmat

texts.ru: Кулмат, 31 год, женат, живут с родителями, они на пенсии. У Кулмата среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, он занимается сельским хозяйством. Есть корова, 10 овец, на 0,60 Га земли выращивает картофель для реализации. Также семья Кулмат занимается выпечкой хлебобулочных изделий и лепешек на продажу. Имеется духовая печь. У Кулмат наработаны постоянные клиенты - магазины, кафе. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса  - 16,700 сом (KGS). Кулмат обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку и заготовку муки для выпечки хлеба. Доходы от бизнеса он планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kulmat is 31 and married and lives with his parents, who are retired. He has a high school education and works in agriculture as the primary source of income for his family. He has a cow and 10 sheep as well as 0.6 hectares of land where he grows potatoes for sale. His family also works baking various kinds of bread for sale in their bread oven. He has regular clients including shops and cafes, with a monthly business income of 16,700 KGS.

Kulmat has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase flour for bread-making. He plans to put profits from the loan into further developing his business.

loans.use: to buy flour for his bread-making business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past eight years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Trabajar en el campo es la labor más noble que puede existir, porque trabajar la tierra con las manos y producir buenos vegetales y frutas es un orgullo, es por ello que Diego desde hace 15 años trabaja de sol a sol en las amplias tierras que tiene la capacidad de producir los mejores bananos de su región, él tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 9 y 17 años, ellos viven en una comunidad denominada Nahualá. Diego tiene la satisfacción de ser agricultor y sus años de experiencia lo han ayudado mucho a mejorar su calidad de producto, pero ahora con el afán de incrementar su cultivo a decidido comprar una cuerda de terreno, entonces a raíz de esta necesidad él solicita un préstamo y lo hace en Adicla por ser una institución que fomenta el cuidado de la naturaleza. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Working in the field is the most noble job that there is, because working on the land with your hands and producing good vegetables and fruits is pride. For that reason, Diego has worked from sun up to sun down for the last 15 years on the ample lands that have the capacity of producing the best bananas in the region. He is 42 years old, single and has a beautiful family of three children who are between 9 and 17 years old. They live in a Nahualá dominated community.

Diego has the satisfaction of being a farmer and his years of experience have helped him a lot to improve the quality of his product. Now, with the eagerness to increase his crops, he has decided to buy a block of land. So, because of this need, he is asking for a loan through Adicla, because it is an institution that promotes caring for nature. His biggest wish is that his children are great professionals.

loans.use: to buy a block of land.

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es:
La Sra. Isolina está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo, está luchando y es por eso que estudia la carrera de enfermería.
Su deseo es ser una buena profesional de enfermería  y que de ese modo pueda seguir formándose. Comenta que le inspiran las personas necesitadas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Isolina is studying and working at the same time. She is struggling, and because of that she is studying nursing. Her desire is to be a good nursing professional, and thereby be able to continue to educate herself. She tells that people in need inspire her.

She asks for this loan to be able to make payments on her degree, and in that way be able to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to make payments on her university degree.

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en:
Mr. Baatar, 54 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for 10 years. His wife sells meat and meat products at outdoor market. Their daughter helps the meat sales business by working as a seller.

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent repair. So he is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so his family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, then releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes has been farming rice for the past fourteen years. She lives in the community of Bien Unido in Bohol. Cultivating land is hard work, but Lourdes perseveres because she needs to earn a living. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides so she can continue her farming. Upon harvest, Lourdes will earn an income and she will also have rice for consumption for herself and her husband. Lourdes dreams of living an abundant life in her old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sell movie dvd's and also runs M-pesa business. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of movie DVD'S and CD's. His business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of movie DVD'S and CD's

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cristina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials for fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cristina has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Agela

texts.en:
In 2005, Agela ventured into farming as a way of life so that she would be able to produce food for her family. Ten years down the line, Agela is deep into commercial dairy and horticultural farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments has helped elevate the quality of life of her children who are in school.

Agela is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more income.

With KES 20,000 she is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her horticulture production. She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her children's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life. You can be a part of this dream: contribute with a loan.

loans.use: To  buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Kenya Canners Retired Shg Gachagi Group

texts.en:
The person featured in the photo raising her hand is Jacinta. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children.
She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to access financial management and enterprise development training. Since then Jacinta has been able to grow these skills by adding more food stuff and is also able to account for money by keeping proper records.

She operates a hotel in her locality where she sells tea and African dishes. Jacinta is applying for a loan to enable her buy more stock of floor, sugar, tea leaves etc. This will in turn lead to an increase in her income. A portion of the income will be re invested in the business and the rest in catering for their basic needs and getting better education for her children.
She is thankful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay back promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her hotel which will increase her sales and income. She will be able to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mikalu

texts.en:
Mikalu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tashar Kashin Miya Village. Mikalu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Mikalu suffered from poor yields that inhibited his ability to purchase improved inputs to increase his yield.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mikalu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mikalu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
In this picture, you see Esther. She is 49 years of age. She is married to a trader and has three children. Esther sells sachet water, and she has done this business for five years. Esther would like to expand her business by buying more water to resell.

She will use this loan to buy more sachet water to sell. She is hopeful that in five years' time her business will expand and she will be able to make more sales.

loans.use: to expand her sachet water business.

loans.name: Robson Josiane

texts.fr:
Josiane est une femme débrouillarde de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont tous encore à sa charge et scolarisés. 
Son mari est électricien et quant à elle, elle exerce une activité de fabrication des arts malagasy, elle est donc artisane comme nous pouvons voir sur sa photo. Elle hérite la connaissance de ce métier de ses parents et puis elle a suivi de formation en tissage. Elle demande un crédit pour pouvoir renforcer son fonds de roulement, augmenter les stocks des matières premières car en ce moment, elle a des commandes supplémentaires. Elle a des clients étrangers qui exigent de temps en temps des modèles uniques.
Son objectif est de pouvoir améliorer et développer autant que possible son activité
texts.en:
Josiane is a resourceful woman. She is the 37-year-old married mother of five dependent children who all go to school. Her husband is an electrician.

Josiane is an artisan who makes Malagasy crafts, as shown in the photo. She learned these skills from her parents and continued her training with weaving lessons.

She is seeking this loan to strengthen her working capital and stock up on supplies, as she is currently fulfilling additional orders. She has foreign customers who sometimes require unique designs.

Her goal is to improve and expand her activity as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy glue, raffia, faux leather, lining, and wooden handles.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa, la socia sigue  con su  negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue elaborando  chompas, chalinas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
