Los socios en general  agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas de colores entre otros.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Las Palmeras" communal bank in the Cusco district of the province and department of the same name.

One member is Teresa, who continues at her business selling handicraft products. She has had the business for some time and it is going well thanks to her determination every day. Teresa continues to make sweaters, scarves and more for her customers who look for these products. Teresa wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

The group's members thank those who are part of this dream through Kiva. They promise to make their repayments on time.

Teresa is applying for a loan in order to buy coloured wool and more.

The members in the separate photos arrived late to the meeting when the photo was taken owing to work commitments.

The person with their face covered is not a member of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy coloured wool and more.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old and married with eight children. With two children in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Emma has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 60 years old and widowed with three children. Francisca works very hard to provide for them.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like noodles, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Francisca has been in this business for 6 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.
In the future, Francisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like noodles, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 68 years old pensioner from Ozurgeti district. She lives with her son and his family. Nadia works at local kindergarten and gets small monthly salary. She decided to start an animal husbandry business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 5000 GEL to renovate a shed and purchase 2 cows. Nadia will produce dairy products and will sell locally. She hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and renovate their shed.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is really excited with the work she has done to her house and the great improvements to the quality of life this has bring to her family. She was able to prepay her credit and get done with the previous debt and now she is asking for a new credit to build a wall around her house. This construction work will help keep her animals inside her property and bring more security and safety to her family. Maria is looking forward to this and future opportunities

loans.use: to build a wall around her house so that her domestic animals cannot escape and her family feels safe.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Beth; she is fifty three years old, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has undergone enterprise management training. She farms maize, beans and potatoes, a business she has been doing for the last thirty two years.
She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase fertilizer for top dressing so that she can increase her farm produce. She plans to use the profits generated from cereals sales to cater for her family basic needs, save money for future use and also plough back some profits for business expansion.
She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to make payment promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing so that she can increase her farm produce.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
20-year-old Lucy looks up to her sister Gertrude, who runs her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. She has been working for Gertrude helping her serve customers for six months. Lucy enjoys the interaction with customers and is eager to follow her sister’s footsteps and open her own business. She is requesting for a loan from Kiva in order to open her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Lilongwe, Malawi.

Lucy completed her high school education in 2014. She says her life will change once she starts running her own business because she will be able to contribute to her household. She lives with her parents and her four siblings and even though she enjoys working with her sister, starting her own business will help her earn more money and employ other people. She is very excited to start contributing to her community through job creation.
The loan will be used to provide essential funds needed for her to serve her customers who need to access financial services. She will also use the loan to purchase a small trolley, a cashbox and a mobile phone, all these items are necessary for her to start her business. Lucy has big dreams for the future. Her dream is to run a successful business and take herself to school so that she can be able to re-take her high school examination. She would also like to own her own house one day.

loans.use: to start running her own business so that she can serve people who need to access financial services.

loans.name: Persida

texts.en: Persida is a 61-year-old from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her youngest is 22 and currently attends college. Persida works hard so she can help her daughter. She sells snacks such as popsicles, pancakes, deep-fried bananas in caramelized sugar and biscuits. She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, bananas, flour, and cooking oil and to pay for tuition fees. She hopes to increase her income so she can better support her daughter's schooling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bananas, flour, and cooking oil and pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando para poder obtener su título en licenciatura en matemáticas, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por ser una buena profesional.
A ella le inspiran sus hijos, ya que quiere darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lourdes is from the city of San Ignacio. She is studying in order to obtain a degree in Mathematics. Lourdes is a hardworking individual who strives to become a successful professional. Her children inspire her and she wants to provide them a decent life without hardship.

Lourdes is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 57 years old now.

Brigida has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Brigida has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy coffee and maize for selling.

loans.name: Tiana Vololona

texts.fr:
Tiana Vololona est une femme travailleuse de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants universitaires de 18 et 20 ans. Ces derniers ont encore besoin de son soutien (moralement et surtout financièrement) maintenant, et de plus son désir est de pouvoir les faire réussir dans leurs études. 
Tiana Vololona dirige une gargote avec son mari depuis 2002. Cette gargote appartenait à sa belle-sœur qui était décédée en cette année. Avant ça, elle vendait des confections. Elle est actuellement en cours de conclure un contrat de livraison de déjeuner (cantine) avec une société qui emploie une centaine de personnes. De ce fait, elle a besoin d'un coup de pouce pour pouvoir honorer ce dit contrat. A part ça, elle projette de réhabiliter  et réaménager son lieu de vente quotidien.
texts.en:
Tiana Vololona is a hard-working woman. She is the 41-year-old married mother of two children ages 18 and 20 who are attending university. They still need her to support them morally and especially financially, and her wish is to help them achieve success in their education.

Tiana Vololona has been running a food counter with her husband since 2002. This business used to belong to her sister-in-law who passed away that year. Prior to this activity, she was selling sweets. She is currently in the process of getting a lunch delivery contract (canteen) with a company of about 100 employees, and she needs a bit of help to ensure that she can meet her obligations. Other than that, she plans to update and rearrange her regular work place.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, flour and table oil.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De La Region Group

texts.es:
La Socia Margarita pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE LA REGION, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia continua trabajando para una empresa privada en el área de limpieza, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien y le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vivieres para su hogar.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos y con socios adicionales por motivos de trabajo y salud.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the "Señor de los Milagros de la Región" in the province of Cusco.

Margarita continues to work at a private business as a cleaner. She is responsible and persevering. She has been with the communal bank for some time. Her work is going well and is satisfying as it allows her to help her family to move forward. Margarita is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

Margarita is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies for her home.

The photo was taken in two groups and with extra members owing to work and health reasons.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her home.

loans.name: Elmer Yoel

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y un menor hijo en casa familiar con su suegra, en el sector La Chacarilla- Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, región Costa de Perú.

Elmer se dedica a la actividad de jornaleria agricola en la zona de La Chacarilla y anexos del distrito de Cayalti y Zaña,con buenas referencias laborales y personales de parte de sus clientes, solicita préstamo para invertir en la siembra de Arroz de una parcela alquilada, con esto generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is 22 years old and lives with his spouse and young son in a family home with his mother in the La Chacarilla- Cayalti sector, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the coastal region of Peru.

Elmer is an agricultural day laborer in the La Chacarilla zone and annexes of the Cayalti and Zaña district, with good working and personal references from his customers. He is requesting this loan to invest in planting rice on a rented plot of land. In this way, he will generate more income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: invest in planting rice on a rented plot of land.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with one child who attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarita is 55 years old.

Clarita has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like nail polish, etc.

Clarita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with six children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past four years, she has operated a mat weaving for sale business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials

loans.name: Kakala

texts.en:
Kakala  is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Twine Okunihira Group

texts.en: Josephine is a 38-year-old married woman who lives is Kagadi, Uganda. She has 4 children aged between 8 and 19 years old. She is a farmer and sells produce in her community to earn income. She hopes to continue working and to build a permanent house for her family. She describes herself as hardworking despite the challenge of inadequate capital. Josephine is in need of a loan to buy maize and beans for selling. She is a member of Twine Okunihira Group where members guarantee each others' loans as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Libertador Group

texts.es:
Dúo Cristo Libertador
Doña Elba Araceli es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 37 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta su hijo de 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió  en comprar mas ropa que vende en su negocio así pudo surtirlo un poco mas con otras variedades de ropa.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio,  asi obtendrá mas ganancias para poder mandar a su hijo a estudiar para un futuro mejor.
Es su cuarto crédito kiva y gracias a Dios su negocio a marchado bien y no a caído en mora,  ella agradece el apoyo que ha recibido ya que atreves de eso a podido salir adelante esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Ropa para vender.
texts.en:
Dúo Cristo Libertador (Christ the Liberator Duo)

Mrs. Elba Araceli is originally from Tecpán, Guatemala. She is thirty-seven years old and is responsible for her five-year-old son. She works selling clothing.

She invested the loan she received in buying more clothing that she sells in her business so that she could supply it a little more with other kinds of clothes.

Her dream is to expand her business more; that way she can earn more income to send her son to school to have a better future.

This is her fourth Kiva loan, and thanks to God her business has done well, and she has not fallen into arrears. She is grateful for the support that she has received since she can get ahead. She is applying for this loan to buy clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.en:
Elisabet is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Wandelinus, 41. Elisabet is the mother of four children: One son is 13 and a high school sophomore, and her 10- and 7-year-old daughters are in the 5th and 1st grades, respectively.

Every day, Elisabet works hard as a picker. She goes from house to house collecting used goods, which she then sells to a used goods agent. Elisabet also sells vegetables and is thinking of starting a small kiosk business. Unfortunately, she does not have enough cash to do so. As a result, Elisabet became a member of a loan group. She has requested a loan of 1,750,000 IDR from TLM. Elisabet is excited about the loan provided by Kiva, via TLM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and other stock for a kiosk business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milagros is 51 years old.

Milagros has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Milagros has been in this business for two years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is from Trinidad, Bohol. He runs a sari-sari (general) store business in his home. He sells shampoo, canned food, insect repellent, sugar, milk, coffee and noodles. This is his main livelihood. He is requesting a loan to increase his inventory. He will use it to buy candy, noodles, canned food, shampoo, conditioner, biscuits, sugar and milk. Joel aims to make continuous improvements so he can expand his business and assure a better return on his investment for his family.

loans.use: to buy candies, noodles, canned food, shampoo, conditioner, biscuits, sugar and milk

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old. She is married and has three children who are between the ages of 18 and 25 years old. Her husband is a security guard. Victoria is a water sachet vendor and also prepares and sells kebab powder. She has been selling sachet water in her house for two years and wants to expand her business.

Victoria will use this loan to buy more water sachets to sell. She wants to use her profit savings to rent a store where she will sell the water. She is hopeful that her business will expand over the next five years and earn her more income.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water to sell

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
A young woman is 25 years old living in Chorm Ksan district of Preah Vihear province and a married mother of three dependent children, only one of whom is in school. Rice farming is the main source of her income. Moreover, Sophal works as a paid worker to supplement her income. These businesses have been with her for four years and it earns her about 68,000KHR per day to support the family condition. Destroying rice-paddy filed by drought and flooding cause her to earn lower income than before.

After successfully repaid the previous loans, which help her to have a better house to stay, she is now leading a group to apply for a new Kiva loan. This is the third cycle for Sophal via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a solar light bulb to brighten her house at night time. She hopes that she could earn more income to upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy a solar light system to brighten her house at night time.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products for her kiosk business such as soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
His name is Rolando, aged 49, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Gloria whom he has eight children of which some are in college, the rest in high school and elementary level in school. Raising a big family is a big challenge for Rolando but it is also rewarding for him that with his hard work and faith in God he is able to provide their basic needs and education for his children.

Rolando is into buy and sell of fruits for ten years already. He buys fruits from farm owners and sells them by the kilo at his fruit stand along the highway. Bananas and papayas are almost staple in a Filipino household.

To help him sustain and grow his sales he is requesting for an PHP 8000 loan to buy several kilos of bananas, papayas and pineapples. He hopes for a positive response from you. His fruit stand means a lot to him for this is his main source of income to feed his children and send them to school.

Rolando's number one dream is to send all his children to College to allow them better opportunities in life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week where he finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various kinds of bananas, pineapples and papayas to sell.

loans.name: Morning Star Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ronald, a member of Morning star women group in Nakuru. He is twenty seven years old, married and blessed with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014.
Ronald does maize, beans and vegetable farming, he also keeps poultry. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to run his enterprise better and profitably unlike before.

He is taking a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and chicken feeds. This will increase his farm production and meet the demand. This will earn him more income hence go a long way in supporting his family basic needs and medical care.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and chicken feeds. This will increase his farm production.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 27 years old and he is married with one child, aged 3. He owns a shop. With the loan he requested, he plans to pay for his school fees. He attends Mount Kenya, a private, higher-learning institution. He began his studies in 2014 and he plans to graduate in 2017. After paying his school fees, he plans to make savings to invest in his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Manuel Vicente

texts.es:
Manuel es un campesino de pelo y pecho, un empresario trabajador que entrega diariamente su cuerpo y alma al campo, tiene dos hijos que son su fuente de inspiración y con su negocio trata de generarles una excelente calidad de vida a ambos que nunca les falte nada y que su profesión siga vigente con el pasar de los años, puesto que uno de sus deseos es que cuando llegue el momento sus muchachos se hagan cargo del negocio familiar, pero solo tiene 55 años de edad y unas ganas enorme por trabajar y progresar y espera hacer hasta que su salud se lo permita.

Manuel en el momento afronta una problemática global, la sequía está afectando sus cultivos y necesita de insumos para abonar y mantener sus terrenos, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas con el objetivo de darle a su campo, abono, riego y pesticidas, protegiéndolos contra animales y depredadores y minimizando el impacto que trae las sequías.
texts.en:
Manuel is a courageous farmer and a hardworking entrepreneur that gives his body and soul to the land daily. He has two children who are his source of inspiration. With his business he tries to provide them with an excellent quality of life so that they don't ever lack anything. He hopes that his business will prevail through the years since one of his dreams is that when the time comes, his children will take over the family business. However, he is only 55 years old and has a strong desire to work and progress and he hopes to do this until his health allows him.

Manuel is currently facing a global problem, the drought is affecting his crops and he needs supplies to fertilize and maintain his lands. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies with the goal of providing his fields with fertilizer, irrigation and pesticides so that they are protected against animals and predators and minimizing the impact that the droughts bring.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 41 years old. She is married to a carpenter and has four children between the ages of 7 and 20 years old. Priscilla has been selling water to her community for 6 months. The major challenge she faces with this business is frequent water shortages. She is unable to sell water when the piped water stops flowing.

With this loan, Priscilla will be able to buy a water storage tank and the inputs required to install the tank to store more water. This will enable her to sell water at any time during the week.

loans.use: To purchase a water storage tank for her water vending business

loans.name: Lidia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lidia es una joven de 20 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad denominada Chocola.
Lidia para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica desde hace cinco años a la compra y venta de tortillas gracias a este pequeño negocio ha logrado solventar los gastos de su familia, pero ella cuenta con una venta de comida que es de donde proviene otra parte de sus ingresos. Lidia desde hace algún tiempo había considerado la posibilidad de realizar una inversión para que el negocio cuente con mejores servicio, es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar maíz leña y todo lo  necesario para su negocio. Lidia tiene el anhelo de hacer que su negocio crezca para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 20 year old young woman. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in a community named Chocola.

In order to help her parents with the household expenses, Lidia started to making a living in the buying and selling of tortillas five years ago. Thanks to this small business, she has succeeded in paying her family's expenses, but she relies on a sale of food which is where another part of her income comes from.

For some time, Lidia has considered the possibility of making an investment so that the business can count on better services. It is for this reason that she is now requesting a loan of Q 4,000.00 to buy corn, firewood, and everything necessary for her business. Lidia has the desire to grow her business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to sell tortillas.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de tortillas, estudio hasta segundo grado, pero por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar  estudiando, está  acompañada y junto a su esposo ha procreado tres hijos.

María, desde muy pequeña su mamá le enseño los oficios domésticos y también a hacer tortillas, es por eso que tiene  mucha experiencia en  las actividades  que realiza, ahora hace tortillas para vender y es de esa manera que obtiene ingresos para poder ayudar a los gastos del hogar. 

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar  maíz y leña, para seguir trabajando y ampliar más su negocio.

El sueño de María, es construir una galera más grande para su negocio, también desea se preparen académicamente y tengan mayores oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and works in domestic trade and the sale of tortillas. She studied up to second grade, but for lack of financial resources could not continue studying. She is accompanied by her husband who has fathered her three children.

From a very early age, Mary's mother taught her household chores and also how to make tortillas, this is why she has extensive experience in these activities. She now makes tortillas to sell and thereby earning revenue to help expenses at home.

She needs the money from her loan to purchase corn [maize] and firewood, to continue working and expand her business.

Mary's dream is to build a larger stall for her business. She also wishes [her children] to prepare academically and have more employment opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase corn[maize] and firewood.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres están acompañados, pero solo uno vive con él y está estudiando en la universidad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuido del hogar.

Manuel, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a trabajos agrícolas desde muy pequeño, él le ayudaba a su padre a sembrar cuando tenía tiempo libre, porque también estudiaba; además de los trabajos agrícolas, también trabaja como vigilante, pero actualmente está desempleado, es por eso que ahora dedica su tiempo a sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y de frijol, de esa manera tiene ingresos para ayudar a su hijo para que siga estudiando.

Manuel, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y para pagar mozos que le ayuden a sembrar, con este crédito el tendrá los insumos necesarios para abonar sus cultivos y mejorar sus cosechas.

Manuel, sueña con ver a su hijo graduado de la carrera universitaria que escogió y que pueda desempeñarse en el ámbito laboral, para tener una mejor calidad de vida; también desea alquilar 7,000 metros cuadrados para cultivar más granos básicos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 55 years old and he went to school until high school. He is married and has four children of whom three are in relationships; only one lives with him and is studying at a university. His wife is a homemaker.

Manuel is a hardworking person. He has been doing agricultural work from an early age. He used to help his father sow when he had free time but he also studied. In addition to agricultural work, he also worked as a guard but he is currently unemployed which is why he devotes his time to planting 7,000 square meters of corn and beans. This allows him to have an income to support his son so that he can keep studying.

Manuel needs this loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for people to help him sow. With this loan he will have the necessary supplies to fertilize his crops and improve his harvests. Manuel dreams of seeing his son graduate from the college career he chose and that he can keep working so that he can have a better quality of life. He also hopes to rent 7,000 square meters to grow more basic grains.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay people to help him sow.

loans.name: Los Vencedores Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LOS VENCEDORES” conformada por 05 socios entusiastas  y responsables. Ella es roselina una de las socias de 52 años de edad. Casada con 4 hijos uno de ellos aun dependiente. Roselina se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de belleza por catálogo desde hace más de 11 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es que todos sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales. Su crédito lo destinará para la compra de cosméticos como el rubor labial esmaltes de uñas perfumes y talcos. El grupo “los vencedores” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Roselina es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo color azul.
texts.en:
This is the new “LOS VENCEDORES” group formed by 5 enthusiastic and responsible members. Roselina is one of the members, she is 52 years old. She is married and has 4 children, one of them is still dependent on her.

Roselina has been selling beauty products by catalog for more than 11 years. Her wish is for all her children to become professionals. She will use the loan to purchase cosmetics such as lipstick, nail polish, perfumes and talc. The “LOS VENCEDORES” group appreciates the KIVA lenders for this loan because it allows them to continue to improve. Roselina is the first one on the left wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics such as lipstick, nail polish, perfumes and talc.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel tiene 30 años de edad, conviviente, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Abel se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte de Oyotún a Chiclayo y viceversa, cuenta con casi 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para realizar reparaciones y arreglos a su vehículo (mantenimiento), el espera mejorar la calidad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Abel is 30 years old, common law, lives in Oyotún district, a rural area dedicated to agriculture and livestock which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Abel woks in transport services from Oyotún to Chiclayo and vice versa, with almost two years of experience in this business and with good personal and work references in his district. 

The loan will be used for repairs and adjustments to his vehicle (maintenance).  He hopes to improve the quality of his service in order to meet the diverse needs of customers in the area which will generate higher revenues that will enhance his quality life.

loans.use: with repairs and alterations to his vehicle

loans.name: Comerciantes De Nahulá Group

texts.es:
Manuel (es el primero del lado izquierdo) es un hombre de 44 años, es soltero vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Nahualá, Manuel desde muy pequeño ha laborado como sastre y gracias a esta labor ha sacado adelante a su familia, pues con el esmero, dedicación, que Manuel le pone a su trabajo cuenta con mucha clientela, y esto lo ha beneficiado a el de gran manera, pero aparte de ser sastre también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías que forma parte su ingreso. Pero ahora Manuel tiene la necesidad de comprar más telas para seguir elaborando pantalones  y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.

El gran sueño de Manuel es contar con una casa propia donde pueda vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Manuel (the first person on the left) is a 44-year-old man. He is single and lives with his family in the town of Nahualá. From a young age, Manuel has worked as a tailor and has supported his family thanks to this job. He has many customers because of the dedication and devotion he puts in his work and this has greatly benefited him. In addition to being a tailor he also makes crafts which is also part of his income.

Manuel needs to buy more fabric to keep making pants and satisfy his customers' needs. Manuel's greatest dream is to have his own home where he can live better.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make pants.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a married woman and has five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 40,000 KSH, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera que vive muy feliz junto a su pequeña hija de 10 meses a la que desea brindar lo mejor. Flor se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable que quiere un futuro mejor para su hija, diariamente se dedica a la venta de diversos estilos de sandalias, es así como cubre las necesidades básicas de su hija. Flor solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frutas y verduras, ya que desea aumentar sus ganancias para brindar lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Flor is 39 years old, a single mother who lives very happily with her 10 month old daughter to whom she wishes to provide the best for. Flor is characterized as a hardworking and responsible woman who wants a better future for her daughter. Every day she works by selling various styles of sandals. This is how she is able to cover the basic needs for her daughter.

Through FUSAI, Flor is requesting a loan to invest in: fruits and vegetables because she would like to increase her earnings to be able to provide the best for her daughter.

loans.use: to invest in: fruits and vegetables, since she wishes to increase her earnings to provide the best for her daughter.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married woman with three children. She has owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling coconuts. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Un enorme y arduo trabaja es el que tiene que hacer Luis Fernando quien desea montar un negocio de venta de snacks, pero tal y como lo ven en la foto, la chaza que empleara está en pésimo estado y no solo eso el piso tiene un pasto muy alto, necesita pintura, muchas reparaciones que demandan muchos gastos, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar adecuaciones locativas, mejorar el piso, colocar instalaciones eléctricas y de acueducto y comprar surtido de dulces, frituras, chocolates, bebidas, cervezas, entre otros.
Luis Fernando quiere ser independiente y luchar por un mejor futuro para su familia conformada  por su pareja y 4 hijos, siendo su sueño a largo plazo comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
An enormous and difficult task is what Luis Fernando has to accomplish. He wants to set up a business selling snacks, but as you can see in the photo, the stand that he will use is in a disastrous state, and not only that, the floor has very high grass. It needs paint and many repairs that require many expenditures.

Therefore he needs to apply for a loan to do the remodeling of his location, improve the floor, make electrical installations, install water conduits, and buy a stock of sweets, fried snacks, chocolates, beverages, and beer, among other items.

Luis Fernando wants to be independent and strive for a better future for his family, which consists of his wife and four children. His long term dream is to buy a home.

loans.use: to do construction work for his business, since he needs to transform the snack stand that you see in the photo to a sales stand for food

loans.name: Dúo Estrellas De Tecpan Group

texts.es:
DUO ESTRELLITAS DE TECPAN
Doña Irma Yolanda, es originaria de la aldea xetzac, municipio de Tecpan, ella tiene 23 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos menores de edad, un niña y un varón ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de hilos para elaborar sus tejidos típicos y también compro dos cerdos para crianza.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ya que asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y podrá mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
Ella agradece a kiva por el apoyo que le esta dando ya que a sido de mucha bendición en su vida, es su segundo crédito kiva y gracias a Dios a podido pagar bien, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para elaboración de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
DUO ESTRELLITAS DE TECPAN

Irma Yolanda is originally from the Xetzac village, municipality of Tecpan. She is 23 years old. Under her care are two young children: one girl and one boy. She works in the production of traditional hand-woven fabrics and animal husbandry.

The loan she received was invested in the purchase of thread to produce her hand woven fabrics and she also bought two pigs for breeding.

Her dream is to expand her business so that she will receive better earnings and so she will be able to send her children to school and obtain a better future.

She thanks Kiva for the support it has given since it has been a great blessing in her life . This is her second Kiva loan and thanks God that she has been able to repay her last one.

She is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials for the creation of hand-woven fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the production of hand woven fabrics

loans.name: William Roberto

texts.es: William tiene 43 años de edad, es un hombre soltero que vive muy feliz junto a su madre de 72 años en casa propia y humilde. William se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y que quiere un futuro mejor. William en su hogar tiene a la venta artículos de primera necesidad y además, en ocasiones trabaja como jornalero en una finca en la cual realiza oficios diversos es así como aporta económicamente a su madre y cubre sus necesidades básicas. William solicita un crédito a FUSAI con el propósito de abastecer más su tienda con artículos de primera necesidad; esto le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su madre de mejor manera, él comprará: artículos de primera necesidad  tales como: granos básicos, aceite, huevos, entre otros.
texts.en:
William is 43 years old. He is single and lives very happily with his 72-year-old mother in their own modest home. William is known for being a very hard-working man who wants a better future.

William has a store in his home where he sells basic household items, and in addition sometimes works as a day laborer on a farm, where he carries out various responsibilities. This is how he supports his mother and covers their basic necessities.

William is requesting a loan from FUSAI for the purpose of further stocking his store with basic household necessities. This will allow him to improve his income and better help his mother. He will buy basic household items such as staple grains, cooking oil, eggs, and other products.

loans.use: to invest in basic household items such as staple grains, cooking oil, eggs and other products.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is from Trinidad, Bohol. He is 53 years old, married and has been in a piggery business. He also farms vegetables like squash for additional income. Claudio is asking for a loan to buy more pigs and vegetable seeds that he can grow. Claudio hope to continue his business so that he can live a comfortable life in his old age. His profit will be utilized for healthy meals and payment of household bills. In the future, he would like to expand his business and see an increase in his profits.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Lollybeth

texts.en: Lollybeth is 32 years old and from the community of Trinidad in Bohol. She is married with two children aged six and eleven. She relies on raising hogs and farming vegetables to earn an income. She plants bitter gourd and sells it in the market. Bitter gourd is usually cooked with eggs and is a favorite for breakfast. She is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and pay for house repair. Lollybeth works hard so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pay for house repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for trading.

loans.name: Ma. Salvacion

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Ma. Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 6,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Ma. Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl is 35 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Sheryl is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Sheryl has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with two children, both of whom are still too young to attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 60 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

In the future Merle would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelaida is 54 years old and one of her children is in school.

Adelaida has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. Adelaida requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teodula is 48 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Teodula has a business selling sand and gravel in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. She requested a PHP 21,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional tons of sand and gravel to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teodula would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tons of sand and gravel to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 57 years old with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. Mary Jane has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 36 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. Jenelyn has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Leang Sry's Group

texts.en:
Leang Sry, a resident from Kampong Cham province, is a 45-year-old mother of three dependent children. One of her children is under the age of school while the other one is being educated in school and needs her support.

For over two decades, this industrious mother, together with her husband, has been growing rice on one hectare of farmland as the main source of the family’s income. Additionally, her spare time is always wisely spent on working as a construction worker to supplement her income. Both of her businesses earn her about 48,300 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. The main challenge of the family’s business is that the rice crops have been destroying by pests, which results in low output.

This is the second time for her to seek a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the previous loan that she paid back completely, Leang Sry has managed to improve her family's standard of living. In fact, she has renovated the house to be more comfortable. As the leader of her five-member group, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizers to increase the productivity of her crop yields.

She hopes to earn more income so as to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to increase the productivity of her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is a 67-year-old woman who works hard in spite of her age. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She has invested on a fishing business for a long time now. She is asking a loan to buy new fishing nets that she can use to increase her catch. Her income will take care for her need of healthy food, household bills and savings. She hopes to earn a good income so she can enjoy her old age.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 51-year-old married woman. Her husband is a fisherman. They have four dependents, ages six to 18. She has helped in their livelihood for 30 years now. She also buys and sells fish.

Gemma is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand their business so she can continue sending her children to school. She and her family live in Carles, Iloilo.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 57 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nena has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Nena requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, a 50-year-old married mother of four, has been farming corn in the Philippines for 30 years now. The recipient of three previous loans from NWTF, she has requested a new loan for PHP 12000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 29 years old with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Dulce has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

Dulce has been running the general store for five years. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Chresil  Ann

texts.en: Chresil Ann resides in Liposong, Ozamiz City. She is married. She had started to operate a piggery for a year now and it is doing well. She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to buy feeds for her piggery. She wants an improvement to her piggery in order to earn more and save little by little from a portion of her income for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To buy feeds for her piggery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two piglets

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for four years. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 47 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 48-year-old, married woman with 15 children. Eight of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Salvacion has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her beauty salon.

Salvacion has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her beauty parlor shop.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 56 years old and has three children.

Carina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Carina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Carina has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old and has five children. Elsa is married and three of her children are in school.

Elsa is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her cattle. Elsa has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is a 37-year-old married woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like lotion, roll-on, etc.

Zeny has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like lotion, roll-on, etc.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is married and works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable "buy and sell" business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Natividad has been in this business for six years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresa is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Teresa has a general store business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like cereals, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, beers, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teresa has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like cereals, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, beers, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Florellas 2 Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Florellas 2¨ esta integrado por 3 mujeres laboriosas y luchadoras, capaces de demostrar los emprendedoras que pueden ser, por sacar adelante a su familias. Por segunda vez se encuentran solicitando crédito en ADIM, para abastecer el inventario de sus pequeños negocios. Quien coordina al grupo es María Andrea, de 41 años, acompañada y con un hijo quien cursa la secundaria. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de cajetas y prendas para damas. Independientemente busca poder comercializar los productos. Con el crédito invertirá en la compra de prendas (collares, anillos, chapas de material de acero. Demandados por su apreciable clientela. Con el primer crédito le permitió salir adelante y comprar cosas personales. Las otras integrantes son Ana, 35 años, elabora y vende cosa de horno en su casa. y Janeth de 35 años dedicada a la venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante en su comunidad.
texts.en: The "Florellas 2" group is composed of 3 entrepreneurial and hardworking women who demonstrate how strong they can be to get their families ahead. They are requesting a loan from ADM  for the second time in order to stock their small businesses. 41-year-old Maria Andrea coordinates the group. She has a partner and a son who is in high school. She has worked for 15 years making and selling women's accessories. She hopes to be able to sell her products independently. She will use the loan to buy accessories (necklaces, rings, steel badges). Her customers demand these products. With her first loan she was able to get ahead and buy personal items. The other group members are Ana (35 years old, sells pastries at home) and Janeth (35 years old, sells used clothing in her community).

loans.use: to buy accessories (necklaces, rings, steel badges).

loans.name: Nhì

texts.en:
Nhì is 57 years old and she is married with 3 children.

Mrs. Nhì has a retail business selling stationary items. Nhì has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Nhì faces is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system.

In 2012, Nhì joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhì has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nhì hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom and a water filter system.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married with two children. She manages her own farm to make a living. She has been planting and harvesting coconut and vegetables in town for 25 years. She requested a loan from GDMPC to pay for the labor costs of harvesting coconut.

Conchita wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs of harvesting coconut.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a 60-year-old married woman and has six adult children in Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years now. This has been the source of their daily income. Nida is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fuel. With this, they will be able to improve their catch which allows them to sell more fish at the market. Nida plans to save while continuing to expand her business so she can live in comfort and enjoy her old age.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel.

loans.name: Danila

texts.en:
Her name is Danila, aged 59, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Single, happy and content, being able to have her own business to support herself and help some of her less privileged relatives. 

Danila has been operating her store for three already. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her main source of income.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to fill her store with grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda, condiments, toiletries, etc. She is more than happy that she earns enough to cover her daily sustenance.

Danila's simple dream is to someday own a mini-grocery store. She prays for God to bless her with abundance in all areas of her life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items to sell at her store.
